loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Borewala, city of shrines, in Pakistan. She has two sons. Her elder son is a daily wage labor and her younger son reads in 2nd standard. Sakina wants her younger son to complete his education. To provide him with a better education, she sells cosmetics in her community, and in the shops as well, which she purchases from the Shahalmi market, Lahore city . Her business produces approximately 8,000 PKRs. 

Her husband runs a business selling vehicle tires. He has a good reputation amongst his customers. He has been in this business for over fifteen years. Sakina has successfully completed three loans to Asasah and now is applying for the fourth time for a loan to invest capital in her husband’s business. The capital will allow him to purchase the vehicle tires and sell them to his customers in order to generate a good income.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle tires to sell.

loans.name: God's Favour Group

texts.en:
Beatrice N., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "God's Favour". She is 40 years old, single, and has one child who is 23 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial difficulties.

For 1 year now, she has been selling charcoal at the Red Light market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She describes herself as hardworking.

Beatrice plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Her dream is to grow her business and to continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Loko Massama Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Loko Massama” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo small-town, near Freetown. They are seeking a loan of SLL 700,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses and make more profits, consequently improving on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Mamusu K.. Mamusu is age 38; she was born in Loko Massama village. Now, she lives in Waterloo with her husband who is a building contractor.

For ten years now, Mamusu has sold cloth – lace, cottons, etc. She also sells underwear. With her share of the loan, she will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to increase her business stock and quality.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and underwear wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more produce like maize and cassava to sell

loans.name: Kadmala

texts.en:
Kadmala E. is currently in the business of selling food at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more tables and chairs for her restaurant.  Kadmala is 41 years old and is married. Her husband is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and chairs in the restaurant.

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Oretha S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God's Blessing. She is 38 years old, married and has four children, ranging in age from 7 to 19 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to poverty. She also cares for two siblings. All of her children are attending school.

For 8 years now, she has been selling lappas (traditional clothing) at Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 52,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more lappas. She describes herself as a peaceful woman.

Her dream is to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more lappas.

loans.name: Great Women Group

texts.en:
Mary N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Great Women. She is 35 years old, married and has five children who range from 4 to 17 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 15 years, she has been selling rice, fish and oil at her house in Chicken Farm in the Redlight community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rice, fish and oil. She describes herself as a hard working woman.

Her hope is to expand her business, to build a shop and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more rice, fish and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more iron sheets, nails, hammers, etc., for his store

loans.name: Mugarama Parents Association, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Hard work and the creative nature of B. Robert has seen him operate a thriving business handling sales of local brew or liquor, commonly referred to as waragi, alongside his modest retail shop here in Uganda.

This married father of one child has been running his business for the last six years in Magarama, Ibanda. Over this time, he has faced a major problem of having too little capital to purchase the materials used, including bananas whose price of 75,000 shillings is what he gains on a weekly basis.

Therefore, with this this loan, Robert is looking at reviving his business by buying more sweet bananas for making local brew and also expanding his retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase more sweet bananas and more retail stock like salt, etc.

loans.name: Acuarela Group

texts.en:
This comunal bank is called “Acuarela”. It is made up of 13 members who are from the community of Nueva Imperial, located 20 minutes from the city of Temuco. Their businesses are, primarily, the sale of silver jewelry, used clothing, natural products (like snail cream and soaps), creation of artisan products, preparation of fast food, sale of plastics, of chocolates, a call center, and a candy shop.

The group member interviewed was Idelia, who is the group’s president. In the picture you see her in the first row, to the left with short gray hair.
Idelia has a call center from which she also sells sweets and general goods. Her shop is located in the center of Nueva Imperial, and she has had this business for approximately 8 years. She will invest this loan in paint to refinish the outside of her business, and into a few display cases to show her products. She likes for her business to be well-kept, so she does not like to go very long without touching up the paint and displays. This is necessary because she has a lot of competition. She also plans to put part of the loan into merchandise such as cell phone re-charge cards, sweets, diapers, razors, and deodorants.

Idelia’s goals are to add on to her home and to buy a car, and she is currently saving for these projects. Her motivation is her 22-year-old daughter who is attending university and studying sociology. What Idelia has enjoyed the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is sharing experiences with her group because they have created strong connections and friendship between them.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community lives; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: To purchase paint, display cases, and merchandise.

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Eulalia Dora C. de 33 años, es presidenta de la Asociación Comunal 16 de Julio que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani.Eulalia es casada y vive en la ciudad de El Alto, zona San Luis hace 4 años aproximadamente, ella se dedica a vender comida cerca a una plaza hace 3 años  y necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, papa y fideo con los cuales prepara alimentos con mayor freciencia.
Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación se dedican al tejido de prendas de vestir,  confección de mantas y venta de jugos. Todos necesitan el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Eulalia Dora C., age 33, is the president of the 16 de Julio Communal Bank. It is part of the Collpani Community Center. Eulalia is married, and she has lived in the city of El Alto in the San Luis region for approximately four years. She has been selling food near a plaza for three years. She needs the loan to buy the supplies that she uses most frequently like rice, potatoes, and noodles. The rest of the members of this communal bank knit clothes, make blankets, and sell juices. They all need the loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Zoila Del Socorro

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Zoila del Socorro M. E. tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera con 5 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando gracias al esfuerzo que realiza su madre, la que se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la actividad de costura.

Doña Zoila tiene muchos clientes ya que en el barrio que habita hay poca competencia, además que tiene contratos con colegios e instituciones privadas para la elaboración de uniformes. Con esta actividad doña Zoila sola a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, sin embargo en sus contratos ella tiene que comprar la tela por lo que debe contar con un capital para tal fin, ya que las instituciones solamente entregan un adelanto el cual no cubre el total de la inversión.

Esta costurera ya ha sido beneficiada en un par de veces con el apoyo de Kiva y a pagado sus prestamos en tiempo y forma, a la vez aprovecha para agradecer a los prestamistas que depositaron su confianza en ella y espera poder seguir cumpliendo puntualmente con sus cuotas de pago.

Actualmente la señora M. tiene varios contratos que cumplir por tal razón requiere se le financie para comprar los siguientes insumos:


1 Rollo de tela Sicatex el que compra a US 270 dólares cada rollo, 100 yardas de tela Gabardina la cual compra a US 1,50 dólares cada yarda, 100 yardas de tela para mosquitero que le cuesta US 1 dólar cada yarda, 100 yardas de tela Dacron la que compra a US 3 dólares cada yarda y  1 rollo de tela bubuja el rollo le cuesta US 80 dólares.
texts.en:
Zoila del Socorro M. E. is a 37 year old small businesswoman. She is a single mother with five children. The children go to school thanks to their mother’s efforts. She has been a seamstress for over 20 years. Zoila has a lot of customers in the neighborhood where she lives. There is little competition. She also has contracts with schools and private institutions to make uniforms. Through this activity Zoila has been able to, by herself, get her children ahead. Nevertheless, she has to buy the fabric for the contracts that she has. She needs to have the money to do this because the institutions only give her a payment ahead of time that does not cover all of the investment. This seamstress has benefited a couple of times from help from Kiva. She has made her payments on time. She is grateful to the lenders who put their faith in her. She plans to be able to keep making her payments on time. Mrs. M. has various contracts to fill. That is why she needs a loan to buy the following supplies: 1 roll of waterproof fabric at US $270 per roll, 100 yards of gabardine fabric for US $1.50 per yard, 100 yards of netting fabric at US $1 per yard, 100 yards of Dacron fabric for US $3 per yard, and 1 roll of linen fabric at US $80 per roll.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy the following fabrics:  waterproof, gabardine, netting, dacron, and linen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sensus Perfume, body lotion, facial cleansing gel, aveeno soap, Sweet thongs, Haiku cologne and girls’ cologne.

loans.name: Las Alondras Group

texts.es:
Las Alondras tiene como miembros mujeres positivas y luchadoras como es el caso de Carmen quien empezó su negocio hace vaR. años ella está trabajando dentro de un programa que se llama Wawa wasi donde es madre cuidadora de niños entre 6 meses y 2 años de edad además por las noches se dedica a la venta de comida rapida como: salchipapas y hamburguesas, esto le permite tener mayores ingresos para los gastos en su casa. En el futuro a ella le gustaría tener un negocio mas simple y al que no le dedique mucho tiempo ya que sufre de una enfermedad  a los huesos.    

Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of Las Alondras are positive and tenacious women. Carmen is one of them. She started her business several years ago. She works in a program called “Wawa Wasi”, where she takes care of children between the ages of six months and two years old. Also, in the evenings she sells fast food like “salchipapas” (fried potato and sausages) and hamburgers. This allows her to have greater income for the household expenses. In the future she would like to have an easier business. She wants one where she does not have so spend a lot of time because she has a bone illness. The members are grateful for and value the support given them through this means and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: American rice, toilet paper, flour, beans, oil, Maruchan soup, condensed milk and sugar

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey(Mujeres Trabajadoras) Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña kyre y nace gracias a Varias señoras  que se unieron y decidieron formar un comité en el barrio. 
 Están muy contentas ante la posibilidad de organizarse y progresar de manera comunitaria. 
Ellas solicitan en crédito lo cual invertirán en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales y así cada día poder progresar y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes del comite es la señora Iris, quien es muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella tiene venta de ropas en el mercado, no posee un puesto definido ya que resulta bastate caro adquirir un puesto, es por eso que ella recorre varios lugares para ofrecer sus mercaderias.
A pesar de las dificultades ella tiene muy esperanza en su trabajo ya que ayuda con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas para invierno, como, sueter, pantalones, buzos, camperas.
texts.en:
The Kuna Kyre committee was born thanks to several women who came together and decided to form a committee in their neighbourhood. They are very happy with the opportunity to organize themselves and progress in a communal manner. They are requesting a loan which they will invest in the purchase of items that will be sold in their respective commercial activities. Thus every day they will be able to progress and get ahead. One of the group members is Iris, who is very hard-working and dedicated. She sells clothing in the market; she does not have a defined stall as it is rather expensive to buy one. For this reason she travels to different areas to offer her merchandise. Despite the difficulties, she has a great deal of hope in her work, since it helps with household costs. She is requesting a loan to purchase winter clothing such as sweaters, pants, jumpers and jackets.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Winter clothing

loans.name: Remember Group

texts.en:
Morris B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Remember. He is 58 years old, married and has four children who range in age from 5 to 7 years old. He was only able to attend vocational school due to financial difficulties. He also cares for one sibling.

For 17 years now, he has been selling soap, bread, milk, sugar coffee and other provisions in a shop in the Paynesville community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He says customers get attracted to his business because he sells quality products and talks to them in a friendly manner. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more soap, bread, milk, sugar coffee and other provisions. He describes himself as a caring father.

His dream is to grow his business, to build a house and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more soap, bread, milk, sugar coffee and other provisions.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent M. is 27 years old and married, and has a two-month old child. He slaughters goats and sells skewers of the grilled meat. He also sells a few foods, such as green bananas. In addition, he buys and sells cattle to merchants who sell them in the city. He has been in this business for 7 years. His wife is a tailor but she does not work at a moment due to a lack of capital. She is currently helping her husband with his different businesses. He would like to have a loan to increase the number of animals he butchers and sells, in addition to growing more bananas. With the profits, he hopes to renovate his house.

About the Bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Buying goats and enriching his garden

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 56-year-old, hard-working mother of six children ranging in age from 11 to 35 years old. One of her children goes to school, but the rest have finished high school. Two of her sons will advise her on how to use the loan. One of them is a motorcyclist and the other is a taxi driver, but is looking for work.

Virginia owns a store that sells food and household goods. With a loan, she plans to increase the products she carries. Using the profits, she hopes to buy a piece of land, enlarge her shop, and make a small restaurant. She is located near a school and believes she will have a steady clientele. 

About the bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Favour Group

texts.en:
Dorcas K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Favour. She is 40 years old, married and has 10 children who are between 7 and 24 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 4 years, she has been selling plantain and oil at Poultry Market, Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She says customers get attracted to her business because she talks to them in a friendly manner. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more plantain and oil. She describes herself as a very quiet person.

Her dream is to expand her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more plantain and oil.

loans.name: Hariette

texts.en:
Harriet is a 53-year-old widow with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a garden where she grows produce to sell. She also has a shop where she sells grocery items, including beer and some soft drinks. Harriet has been running this business for 14 years and her business has become well known during this time. She is requesting a loan to restock her store. With the profits, she hopes to expand her inventory.

About the bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Restocking her store

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is a 45-year-old widow who has four children. Her children are 13-25 years old and three are in school.  

Speciose is an industrious woman.  She purchased a milling machine that she uses to grind food items for the local farmers.  For example, when the cassava is harvested, the farmers often want to grind a portion of it into flour to preserve it for a longer period of time.  She also grows onions, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, and other crops that she sells in the market.
 
She is requesting a loan to start her own wholesale store stocked with enough food to sell to local merchants.  This will increase her capital and prevent her from having to move from market to market.

About the bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more food products to sell and to develop a permanent wholesale store

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric M. is 30 years old and a father of 3 children between the ages of 3 and 5 years old.  Two of the children are in school.  He and his wife sell second-hand clothes. They have run this business for 6 years.  

Eric is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes. He also hopes to use the profits to buy even more clothes.  Eric’s dream is to leave this business to his wife after two years and start a different business, such as buying a car that can be used as a taxi. 

About the bank:
Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) is a public limited company established to provide financial services as a ladder of opportunity to the poor and small entrepreneurs for whom access to formal financial capital is currently limited. UOB's vision is to be a sustainable financial institution achieving significant economic, social and spiritual transformational impact on the underprivileged of Rwanda through a variety of products and related training in a way that reflects the love of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda De Constancia Group

texts.es:
Reynalda, es casada y tiene 07 hijos. Reynalda pertenece al Banco Comunal Rosalinda D. Constancia el cual queda en el Distrito D. Constancia, ubicado en el departamento Huancavelica, donD. se desempeña como Presidente D. la Junta Directiva.
Reynalda, se dedicaba a la venta D. tubérculos; gracias a la ayuda D. sus ahorros y su préstamos ahora se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales, como vacas, toros, caballos, etc. lo cual le genera mayores ingresos. Reynalda, requiere D. un nuevo préstamo para la compra D. vacas y animales mayores, con el cual incrementara aún más su negocio. 
Pensando en su futuro y en el D. su familia, Reynalda quiere establecer otro negocio como la compra y venta  D. cereales y granos. Y que sus ganancias y ahorros le sirvan para la educación D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reynalda is married and has 7 children. Reynalda belongs to the communal bank Rosalinda D. Constancia where she serves as chairperson of the board; it is located in Huancavelica, a sub district of Constancia. Reynalda used to sell potatoes but thanks to her savings and loans she now buys and sells livestock such as: cows, bulls, horses, etc., which generates higher income. Reynalda requires a new loan to purchase cows and larger animals, which will increase her current business even more. In thinking about her future and her family's future, Reynalda would like to initiate another business like the purchase of grains and cereals so her earnings and her savings can be put towards her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Kumba N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Togetherness. She is 38 years old, single and has two children who are 7 and 24 years old respectively. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school.

For 6 years, she has been selling ladies' handbags and blouses at Redlight Market, Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She started her business by selling popcorn, peanuts and juices with a little amount of money. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more ladies' handbags and blouses. She describes herself as an earnest person.

Her goal is to grow her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more ladies handbags and blouses.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe tiene 42 años, su actividad económica es la crianza y venta de cerdos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad, pues empezó porque su familia le había enseñado desde muy temprana edad este negocio, por lo que decide hacerse cargo y sufragar gastos para su familia, por lo que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida de la forma más humilde. Es así que decide realizar este financiamiento con el fin de comprar materia prima como cerdos además tiene que comprar alimentos para engordarlos. Su deseo es ampliar con su negocio aun mas y que sus hijos logren hacerse cargo del negocio.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 42 and grows and sells pigs. He has been doing this for more than 8 years. His family taught him this work when he was very young, so he decided to take charge of his family's expenses, as he has two young children in his care. He has always enjoyed making a living in this humble way. He decided to take out this loan with the goal of buying basic material such as pigs and food to fatten them up. He wants to expand his business further, and hopes that his children will take over the business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en la casa de su madre.Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores. Se dedica a la comercialización de forraje, maíz  y habas que produce, los lleva a la feria comercial de su localidad y a los comerciantes que lo solicitan. Su trabajo es durante todo el día, y su esposo  trabaja junto a ella y sus hijos también la ayudan en las labores. Para ella lo mas rentable es la venta de forraje, porque es lo que tiene mayor  demanda en su zona, además tiene clientes fijos es por eso que desea adquirir nuevas extensiones de terreno.Es la sexta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con sus pagos, y agradece  a las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Gloria tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono que necesita para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Gloria, 35, lives with her husband and their 5 children in her mother's house. She has worked in agriculture and raised small animals all her life. She sells fodder, corn and broad beans that she produces and brings to the commercial market in her area and to the merchants who request her products. She works all day, and her husband works with her. Their children also help them with the work. For Gloria, the most worthwhile activity is the sale of fodder, since it is most in demand in her area. She also has loyal clients, and so she wants to acquire new expanses of land. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She thanks the people who are making this loan possible, as it will be very useful in the advancement of her business. Gloria plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of several bags of fertilizer that she needs for the next sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc Ii Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. TORRECHAYOC II”; Nuestros socios viven en la provincia D. Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Inocencia;   ella tiene 28 años D. edad, la socia es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la panadería ella tiene una pequeña panadería en el barrio D. Berriozábal, la socia también venD. productos D. omnilife, Nuestra socia normalmente sacaba préstamos para comprar  harina, manteca y aceite y una parte utilizaba para comprar los productos D. la empresa D. omnilife, ahora la socia tiene otras prioridades, Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para terminar D. construir su casa.

Nuestros otros socios se dedican a la panadería, docencia, tienda D. abarrotes, kiosco escolar, y para terminar los acabados D. sus casas.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These associates belong to the community bank "Senor D. Torrechayoc II"; they live in the province of Urubamba in the Cusco department. Inocencia is 28, and a single mother of two children. She does housework and runs a small convenience store in the Berriozabal neighbourhood. She also sells Omnilife products. She has usually used loans to buy flour, butter and oil and Omnilife products, but now she has other priorities. She is requesting this loan to buy materials to finish building her home. The other members have convenience stores, grocery stores, school kiosks, teach, or need to finish their houses. They are appreciate and value the support offered, and promise to repay the instalments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: completion of home construction

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El solicitante es conviviente vive en casa alquilada desde 5 años, cuenta con taller de reparacion de artefactos en el mercado San Antonio con buena ubicacion. Su esposa trabaja como obrera en la agricola San juan desde hace 3 años. El destino del credito es para pagar la deuda de la comptra de un artefacto y para incremento de capital compra de materiales
texts.en:
Marco Antonio has lived with his partner in a rented house for 5 years. He has an appliance repair shop in the San Antonio market, a good location. His partner has worked as a labourer in the San Juan farm for three years. This loan will be used to pay the debt of the purchase of an appliance and as working capital to buy materials.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expense and working capital

loans.name: Poderosas De Lircay Group

texts.es:
El BancoComunal Poderosas D. Lircay, se encuentra ubicado en L. Comunidad del mismo nombre del departamento D. Huancavelica.
Elsa, es socia y Tesorera del Bancomunal, tiene 02 hijos pequeños los cuales van a L. escueL.. Elsa se dedica a L. venta D. carnes, negocio que heredó D. su familia, ya que ayudaba desD. pequeña a sus padres en L. tienda que ahora elL. administra. Elsa con su ingreso a Finca  ha aprendido a ser puntual y responsable, lo cual junto con sus préstamos le ayuda mucho en su negocio. 
Elsa, requiere D. un préstamo con el cual realizará mejoras en su tienda y así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Elsa por ahora invierte sus ahorros apoyando a su esposo, quien se encuentra por terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
The Poderosas D. Licay community bank is located in the community of the same name, in the Huancavelica department. Elsa is treasurer of the community bank. She has 2 little children who go to school. Elsa sells meat, a business that she inherited from her family, as she helped her parents from a very young age in the stO. that she now runs. When Elsa joined Finca she learned to be punctual and responsible, and this and her loans have helped her a lot in her business. Elsa needs a loan with which she will make improvements to her stO. and thus offer a better service to her customers. For now she devotes her savings to helping her husband, who is about to finish his university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mejoras en su tienda

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 34 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y su hijo, quienes viven juntos en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de comestibles en una pequeña bodega que posee dentro de su casa. Desde ese momento ofrece sus productos con la mayor amabilidad y tranquilidad, además de ello también prepara gelatina, cuya venta la ayuda aumentar sus ingresos. Las ganas de salir adelante, hace que no se limite en una sola actividad, es por ello que desea realizar otros trabajos, con tal de generar ingresos económicos a su familia. En adelante ha pensado mejorar su tienda tanto en infraestructura como también en implementación, pues quiere que sea más amplia y mejor surtida para así ganar más clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y ella se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is 34 and shares her life with her husband and child. They live together in their own home. She sells food in a small store in her home. She has always offered her products with the greatest kindness and gentleness. She also prepares jelly, the sale of which helps her to increase her earnings. Her desire to get ahead means that she does not limit herself to one single activity, and so she wants to do other jobs to generate income for her family. In the future she plans to improve her store, both its infrastructure and set-up, and she wants it to be fuller and better-stocked to gain more customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all her repayments. With the requested loan, she will buy a greater quantity of products to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock

loans.name: La Pinada De Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Grupos Solidario La Pinada de Santa Lucia
La señora Nicolasa Álvarez es la representante de este Grupo, el negocio que ella tiene desde màs de año y medio es una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite, sal, huevos, gaseosas, golosinas, además también tiene una venta de tortillas , ella es muy dinámica y trabajadora por eso es muy  conocida en el lugar donde vive, y esos le ayuda ya que  sus clientes  saben dónde buscarla y es por eso que ha tratado de hacer crecer su negocio, y conforme sus clientes le piden nuevas cosas ellas trata de tenerlos para poder quedar bien con ellos, por ejemplo además  vende regalos para diferentes ocasiones ya que las personas se los pedían, ella ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsable ya que en el tiempo que FAPE le ha brindado crédito ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, ella dice estar muy contenta porque tiene muchos planes que quiere lograr es por eso que solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio.  Doña Marìa Eduarda Garcìa quien es otro miembro del grupo tiene su venta de tortillas, huevos, salchichas, longanizas, tomate y otros productos que le solicitan sus clientes, ella tiene 5 niños y ella nos cuenta cómo es que está animada en querer hacer crecer su negocio para que pueda ayudar junto con su esposo a poder darles una educación a sus hijos ya que todos van a la escuela, ha sido una mujer emprendedora y responsable, ya que como ella dice siempre debe dejar bien su nombre porque también es un ejemplo para sus hijos, y doña Beronica T. es la tercer miembro del grupo, ella cuenta con una venta de regalos, cosméticos, zapatos, ropa para bebè y una diversidad de detalles que sus clientes le piden, ella cuenta que ha estado luchando por cuatro años en este negocio y se ve como poco a poco va mejorando, es una persona muy servicial y ella dice que quiere quiere tener otra sucursal de su negocio en algún punto màs central del pueblo donde vive, actualmente tiene 2 niños y dice que sus sueños son poder darles a ellos una buena educación y mejorar la oportunidad para ellos.  Las miembros de este grupo sin lugar a dudad son mujeres trabajadoras que saben lo que quieren y diariamente demuestran con su trabajo que cuando se quiere se pueden lograr las cosas, ella sin lugar a duda tienen muchos planes para este capital que solicitan a KIVA.
texts.en:
The La Pinada de Santa Lucia Group Nicolasa A. is the group's representative. For more than a year and a half she has run a store where she sells basic products such as sugar, oil, salt, eggs, soft drinks and candy. She also sells tortillas. She is very dynamic and hard-working and because of this she is well-known in her neighbourhood. This is helpful, since her customers know where to find her. She is trying to expand her business, and when her customers request new items she tries to get them to satisfy her customers. For example, she also sells gifts for different occasions as they are requested. She has demonstrated herself to be a very responsible woman, as she has been very punctual with her payments during her time with FAPE. She says she is very happy because she has many plans that she wants to achieve, so she is requesting this loan to invest in her business. Maria Eduarda Garcia, another group member, sells tortillas, eggs, sausages, spicy pork sausages, tomatoes and other products that her customers request. She has five children and tells us how she is working hard to expand her business in order to, along with her husband, offer her children an education; they all go to school. She has always been an enterprising and responsible woman, as she always says that she has to make a good name for herself because it is an example for her children. Beronica T. is the third group member. She sells gifts, cosmetics, shoes, baby clothing and a variety of items that her customers request. She says that she has been working hard in this business for four years and sees how, little by little, it is improving. She is a very obliging person and says that she wants to have another branch of her business in a more central area of her village. She has two children and says that her dream is to give them a good education and to improve their opportunities. These group members are, beyond a shadow of a doubt, hard-working women who know what they want and daily demonstrate with their work that when you want to, you can achieve things. Without a doubt they have many plans for this loan they are requesting from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investing in their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: In order to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Edwin Alejandro

texts.es:
Edwin Alejandro, tiene 29 años de edad, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, vive junto con su compañera de vida y un hijo de dos años de edad,  posee un negocio de joyería, compra, elabora y vende prendas de oro y plata.
Edwin atiende el negocio junto con un primo quien le ayuda hacer los trabajos, tiene tres años de atender su negocio un horario  de 8: 00 am -4: 00 pm hace tres años, gracias a su padre que siempre le inculco este trabajo.
Con ganancias de esta actividad ha logrado reunir dinero para alquilar un local donde atiende a sus clientes, el actualmente se ha visto en necesidad de solicitar por primera vez un crédito de $300.00 para compra de oro y seguir elaborando prendas que sus clientes le solicitan, Edwin es una persona que le gusta su trabajo y hace excelentes prendas de oro, el sueña con tener su propio local en su casa donde pueda vivir con su joven  familia, mejorar la calidad de vida de ellos y solventar necesidades básica de su hogar.
texts.en:
Edwin Alejandro is 29 years old and lives in El Transito, in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his partner and their two year-old son. Edwin has a jewelery business where he buys, makes, and sells pieces made of gold and silver. Edwin runs the business with his cousin, who helps him with the work. He has had this business and worked from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. for three years, thanks to his father, who taught him this line of work. With the profits from his business, Edwin has been able to get enough money together to rent a space where he can serve his customers. He currently feels it is necessary to request a loan for the first time. He is requesting $300 in order to purchase gold and continue creating the pieces his customers request. Edwin is a person who enjoys his work and makes excellent pieces of gold jewelery. He dreams of having his own house where he can live with his young family, improve their quality of life, and meet the basic needs of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold for jewelery-making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: MATERIALS TO REPAIR THE CHICKEN HOUSE (WOOD, NAILS, GLUE), AND  BUYING FEEDING-TROUGHS

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO  LAS VIOLETAS

Este grupo esta compuesto por tres señoras que se dedican a diferentes negocios, doña Angélica T.  ella se ha dedica a la venta de pollo desde que tenía 15 años de edad ella inicio vendiendo de manera ambulante   en la aldea la Ciénega San Raymundo, únicamente  con 5 pollos  luego las señoras de la aldea la buscan en sus casa para comprarle por lo que  su papa le ayudo con un pequeño capital    y le animo a que fuera vender a otro lugar llamado Ciudad Quetzal pero que vendiera en mayor cantidad, tiene 4 hijos que estudian la  primaria en la escuela de la aldea, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y  el sueño de ella es poder tener un local en el mercado de  la localidad y así poder tener una mayor venta y mejores ganancias, doña Isabel M.  tiene  una tienda  ubicada en su casa   ella tiene  6 hijos 5 de ellos ya son casados  y tiene  una  hija  de 14 años viviendo con ella y que sigue estudiando su  educación básica en el pueblo con la ayuda de su esposo han podido progresar un poco en su tienda y el crédito lo necesita para la compra de un refrigerador ya que al no contar con uno no puede ofrecer algunos productos que necesitan ser refrigerados, como productos lácteos, gaseosas frías, helados, embutidos etc.  Doña Ángela T. ella se dedica a la venta de pollo en la colonia Villas del Quetzal en donde tiene un local,   ella tiene un hijo  y es viuda y menciona que necesita este préstamo para poder invertir más en su negocio, ya que  aunque ella quiere invertir pero no cuenta con los recursos necesarios no puede hacer posibles sus planes.  Estas señoras son mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables ya que FAPE las ha conocido y siempre están buscando la manera de superarse, ellas se sienten contentas cuando ven que su trabajo da frutos y que se ve reflejado en bienestar para sus familias.
texts.en:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO LAS VIOLETAS The group has three members, all of them women in different lines of business. Angélica T. has been selling chickens since she was 15 years old. She started off as a street vendor with only 5 chickens in the Ciénega San Raymundo village. Soon the women in the village were looking to buy from her, so her father gave her a small capital and encouraged her to go to another town called Ciudad Quetzasell to sell in greater quantities. Angélica has 4 children who study in the village primary school and her husband is a bricklayer. Her dream is to own a shop in the town market to increase sales and improve profits. Isabel M. has a shop in her own home. She has 6 children, 5 of them married and a 14 year old daughter who lives with her and attends the local school. With the help of Isabel's husband the shop has been doing well. She needs a loan to purchase a fridge, because the lack of it prevents her from offering refrigerated products such as dairy produce, cold lemonades, ice-creams, cold meats, etc. Ángela T. sells chickens from her shop in the Villas del Quetzal neighborhood. She has a son and is widowed. She needs the loan to invest more in her business, which she is unable to do at the moment due to her limited means. They are all very hardworking and responsible women and FAPE has got to meet them. They are always trying to better themselves and are happy to see the positive impact of their work on their families' well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es:
Juana tiene 50 años D. edad y es soltera, vive junto a un familiar en un asentamiento humano (zona urbano - marginal) del distrito D. Cura Mori, un distrito cuyas principales actividades son la agricultura y la ganadería, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y a la región del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicado a tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Juana se gana la vida ccomercializando animales y vendiendo chicha desD. hace mas D. 25 años. Ella cría aves D. corral y animales menores en unos corrales ubicados en la parte posterior D. su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona con frecuencia.

Adicionalmente prepara chicha D. jora y la comercializa entre sus vecinos, la chicha es una bebida típica D. los países sudamericanos que es preparada a base D. harina D. maíz y que se consume desD. tiempos ancestrales, los pobladores D. áreas rurales las consumen en diversas celebraciones y durante su jornada laboral ya que creen que les brinda mayor energía.

Juana es una mujer que gusta mucho D. su trabajo y que se vale D. el para salir adelante. Ella desea ampliar su negocio comprando alimento balanceado para sus animales e insumos para seguir elaborando chicha, D. esa manera podrá aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 700 nuevos soles.

En la zona donD. vive ella es bastante conocida por sus vecinos, los cuales la consideran una mujer honrada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old, single, and lives with a relative in a settlement (marginalized urban area) in the district of Cura Mori. The main business activities in the district are agriculture and livestock breeding. This district is part of the province and region of Piura, which is located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Juana has earned a living selling animals and “chicha” (a beverage maD. of corn) for more than 25 years. She raises poultry and small animals in the pens located behind her house. When the animals are fully developed, she sells them to merchants who frequently pass through the area.

She also prepares “chicha D. jora” and sells it to her neighbors. Chicha is a traditional beverage in South American countries that is maD. of corn and consumed during ancestral celebrations. Rural villagers drink chicha for various festivals and during the work day because they believe it provides increased energy.

Juana is a woman who enjoys her work and views it as an opportunity to get ahead. She wants to increase her business by purchasing balanced feed for her animals and ingredients for making chicha. This will allow her to generate more sales and improve her income. To achieve her goal, Juana is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN.

In the area where she lives, Juana is well-known among her neighbors. They consider her to be an honest and hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed & ingredients for making "chicha"

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Lucila;   ella tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos los mayores de 23 y 20 años son estudiantes en la universidad, la socia se dedica a la administración de su tienda abarrotes y con esta tienda ella puede seguir apoyando a sus hijos con los estudios. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda abarrotes con mayor cantidad de productos.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the Esmeralda Communal Bank. She lives in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Lucila is 55 years old, married, and has three adult children between the ages of 20 and 23. All of them are university students. Lucila manages a grocery store so that she can continue supporting her children with their education. She is requesting a loan to keep her store in operation by acquiring a large quantity of products.

Lucila values and has endless appreciation for the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of products for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Sumpango Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO MJJERES TRABAJADORAS, ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA SANDRA S. TIENE 32 AÑOS Y TIENE DOS NIÑOS PEQUEÑOS, ELLA TIENE UNA VENTA DE TORTILLAS, ELLA ES UNA MUJER MUY TRABAJADORA LO REFLEJA EN SU ACTIVIDAD COTIDIANA, POR EL ESFUERZO Y EL EMPEÑO QUE ELLA TIENE. SE LEVANTA TODOS LOS DIAS A LAS 5:00 AM PARA EMPEZAR CON SUS LABORES,  DESDE HACE  8 AÑOS QUE ELLA  TENE SU TORTILLERIA,  AHORA NECESITA CAPITAL PARA PODER COMPRAR MAIZ Y ADEMÀS HA EMPEZADO A VENDER ROPA TIPICA POR LO QUE NECESITA CAPITAL PARA PODER INVERTIR.  DOÑA ROSA T.  ES OTRA MIEMBRO DEL GRUPO ELLA VENDE DESAYUNOS EN UNA FINCA DONDE TRABAJAN MAS DE 75 PERSONAS TAMBIEN HACE DELANTALES  Y LOS VENDE DE MANERA  AMBULANTE, ES CASADA TIENE 5 HIJOS  ELLA COMPARTE EL NEGOCIO CON SU HERMANA HILARIA T. QUIEN VENDE  ALMUERZOS EN LA MISMA FINCA Y ASI LAS DOS PUEDEN  TENER LA OPORTUNIDAD DE PROGRESAR. DOÑA HILARIA  NECESITA TAMBIEN VENDE ROPA TIPICA,  ELLAS HAN DEMOSTRADO SER PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y TRABAJADORADOS YA QUE FAPE LA HA CONOCIDO POR VARIOS AÑOS, LOS SUEÑOS DE LAS SEÑORAS ES PODER CONTRIBUIR EN SU HOGAR Y DARLES A SUS HIJOS UNA OPORTUNIDAD DE SUPERARSE..
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) is represented by Sra. Sandra S.. She is 32 years, has two small children, and earns her living selling tortillas. Sandra is a hardworking woman as reflected by the effort and commitment she puts into her daily activities. She wakes up every morning at 5am to begin her work. Sandra has been selling tortillas for eight years, but now she needs capital to buy corn. In addition, she has started selling traditional clothing and needs capital to invest in this new venture.

Doña Rosa T. is another member of the group who sells breakfasts at a farm that employs more than 75 workers. She also makes aprons and sells them as a street vendor. Rosa is married and has five children. She shares her business with her sister Hilaria T., who also sells breakfasts at the same farm. Both of them seek to have opportunities to make progress. Doña Hilaria also sells traditional clothing.

They have been clients of FAPE for several years and have demonstrated that they are responsible and hardworking people. These ladies dream of contributing to their households and providing their children the opportunity to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Vicentina;   ella tiene 52 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 6 hijos los dos últimos hijos tienen 23 y 20 años, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de verduras en el mercado vino canchón de San Sebastían, ella tiene el stnad nº 52. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor de los proveedores.  

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Esmeralda Communal Bank. She lives in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Vicenta is 52 years old, married, and has six children. Her two youngest children are 23 and 20 years old. She divides her time between her household activities and selling vegetables at the Vino Canchón Market in San Sebastían. She has vending stall No. 52. Vicenta is requesting a loan to buy vegetables in bulk from her suppliers.

She values and has endless appreciation for the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito D. San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Elvira;   ella tiene 73 años D. edad, la socia es viuda y la socia se dedica comprar habas, maíz, frejoles, entre otros productos secos. Nuestra socia compra y venD. productos secos D. los proveedores dueños D. terrenos D. cultivos y le venden a la socia al por mayor. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor los productos secos.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Esmeralda Communal Bank. She lives in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Elvira is 73 years old and widowed. She sells legumes, corn, and other dried products. Elvira buys her dried goods from the suppliers who grow them and then sells them in bulk. She is requesting a loan to buy large quantities of dried goods.

Elvira values and has endless appreciation for the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of dried goods

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Tania;   ella tiene  29 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y la socia tiene un hijo de 2 años, ella alterna sus actividades con la venta de materiales de construcción, Nuestra socia compra todo tipo de materiales para construir y los vende al por menor a las diferentes tiendas de ferreterías. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Esmeralda Communal Bank. She lives in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Tania is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a two year old son. She divides her time between her household activities and selling construction materials. Tania buys all types of construction materials and sells them at retail to different hardware stores.

She values and has endless appreciation for the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Norma Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Norma García tiene 42 años es casada y tiene dos hijas menores de edad. La señora Norma tiene un negocio de venta de leña, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación. No es un negocio pequeño, ya que ella lo que hace es comprar los piezas grandes de leña, paga para que los rajen y luego distribuye a las ventas cercanas y también al mercado. Ella ya tiene 15 años de tener este negocio, sin embargo es importante mencionar que antes la señora también tenía un negocio de pulpería, sin embargo lo tuvo que desistir debido a que muchos créditos daban y la gente no le pagaba. La señora está solicitando este crédito ya que desea ampliar su negocio. Su sueño siempre ha sido que con su trabajo sus hijas puedan prepararse y llegar a estudiar en la universidad, brindándole una mejor vida con mayores facilidades.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma García is 42 years old, married, and has two young daughters. Sra. Norma operates a firewood business from her home. This is not a small business since she has to buy large pieces of firewood and is responsible for splitting them into smaller logs before distributing them to nearby stores or selling them at the market. She has 15 years of experience in this business. However, it is important to mention that she also had a grocery store, but she had to close it down because too many customers purchased on credit and never paid her.

Sra. Norma is requesting a loan so that she can expand her business. Her dream has always been to prepare her daughters so that they could study at the university and provide them a better life with all the conveniences.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to expand her business

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan Manuel tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja y su pequeño hijo en su casa propia, propiedad que le costo mucho adquirir. El trabajo al que se dedica, es brindar servicio de transporte, en donde posee un vehículo. Es así que durante 6 años trabaja en esta actividad, paralelo a ello, también se dedica en la venta de artesanía, que la ayuda a incrementar sus ganancias. Juan asegura que el trabajar mucho e invirtiendo en varias actividades podrá progresar y sacar adelante a su familia. Disfruta mucho lo que hace, la experiencia que tiene le da la comodidad de realizar su trabajo tranquilamente sin ningún inconveniente, sin embargo es muy agotador, por lo que a veces le resulta estresante. En un futuro desea comprar más vehículos y así tener una gran flota consolidando así una microempresa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, brindará servicio técnico a su vehículo.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 29 years old and has his own home which he acquired at great cost. He lives with his wife and their young son. Juan provides transportation services using a vehicle that he owns. For six years he has been in this line of work and also sells handicrafts to earn extra income. Juan says that he works hard and invests his time in different activities in order to make progress and move his family forward. He enjoys what he does and takes comfort in his experience that enables him to work peacefully without any problems. Nonetheless, his job is exhausting and can be stressful at times. In the future, he wants to buy more vehicles so that he can have a large fleet and strengthen his micro-business.

This is his first loan with MFP. Juan promises to be prompt with all of his payments. The loan he requested will be used to pay for technical maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for technical maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Anastasya

texts.en: Anastasya is married and has a small son. She sells bed sheets and souvenirs at an open market in Novaya Kahovka. Anastasya started this business 9 years ago because she needed to support her family. Today her business goes well and she enjoys it. Anastasya would like to develop her business further. She would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment of products to sell and to increase her income.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of inventory.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Nieves;   ella tiene 29 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7, 4 años de edad; la socia es ama de casa y ella ahora quiere ayudar a su conviviente que se dedica a la distribución de agua, él quiere comprar una motobomba. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una motobomba para la mejor distribución de agua.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the Esmeralda Communal Bank. She lives in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Nieves is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 9, 7, and 4). She currently helps her partner with his water distribution business. He wants to buy a motorized water pump. Therefore, Nieves is requesting a loan to obtain a motorized pump to help improve water distribution.

Nieves values and has endless appreciation for the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motorized water pump

loans.name: Union Y Vida Group

texts.es: El grupo de Union y Vida esta conformado por tres socias, ellas son originarias de Sumpango. La mayoria de señoras de dedican a bordar y tejer. La representante es Olga A., madre de 6 hijos, ella vende ropa tipíca en el municipio y todos los dias viernes viaja a otro municipio para comprar mercadería. Las otras dos integrantes se dedican a bordar blusas, asñi como también a tejer fajas, Olga necesita agrandar su negocio ya que ha tenido ucha demanda, por lo que solicitan otro c´redito, ellas han tenido varios cr´ditos con FAPE, y han pagado muy bien, con el dinero solicitado comprarán ropa para hacer crecer mas su negocio y también comprarán hilo para tejer y bordar mas ropa, ellas sueñan con tener un local propio en donde las busquen y asi mismo incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
The group “Union y Vida” (Union and Life) consists of three members who are originally from Sumpango. Most of these women engage in embroidery and weaving. Olga A. is the group representative and the mother of six children. She sells traditional clothing in the city and travels to another city every Friday to buy merchandise. The other members make embroidered blouses as well as woven sashes.

Olga needs to expand her business as a result of great demand, which is why she is requesting another loan. These women have had several loans with FAPE and repaid them successfully. The loan they requested will be used to buy clothing to expand Olga’s business as well as acquire more yarn for producing embroidered and woven clothing. They dream of having a store where customers can find them and they can grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La Señora Nelly tiene 43 años, es madre soltera con 4 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues siempre está pendiente de lo que su actividad necesita ya que la mayoría de sus clientes le realizan diferentes pedidos. Por lo que es una mujer que demuestra que salir adelante para ella y su familia es muy importante. Este el motivo del financiamiento que es para la compra de materia prima como calzado, ropa para damas, jóvenes, vestidos, faldas y pantalones.
texts.en:
Nelly is 43 years old and a single mother with 4 children under her care. She is involved in clothing purchases and sales and has been in this business for more than 21 years. This is not the first time that she is requesting a loan. She is always waiting to see what her business needs since the majority of her customers make different requests. She is a woman that shows that helping her family to progress is very important. This is why the loan is for the purchase of raw material such as shoes, clothing for women and teenagers, dresses, skirts and pants.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Petronila;  ella tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 23, 21 años de edad, la socia se dedica  a comprar al por mayor y menor materiales de construcción y los vende a las ferreterías y también de forma directa, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y de esta forma implementar su negocio. La socia aparece en la foto que acompaña la historia de costadito porque ella tiene un moretón en la otra mejilla.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the "Esmeralda" Communal Bank. Our member lives in San Sebastián District, which is part of the Department and Province of Cusco. Our member is Petronila; she is 41 years old, married, and has three children who are 24, 23 and 21 years old. She buys construction materials wholesale and sells them to hardware stores or sells them directly herself. Our member is asking for the loan to buy construction materials wholesale. Petronila prizes and is infinitely grateful for the support offered to her through this medium, and she promises to pay off her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of construction material

loans.name: Myriam Magali

texts.es:
Myriam de 22 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Guayaquil, vive aun con sus padres pero trabaja  como vendedora Yambal (es una compañía de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales). 

Para comenzar como vendedora Yambal, sus padres le prestaron dinero para comprar productos y cosméticos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación las ventas de cosméticos han sido su primer ingreso para comenzar a independizase. Vende perfumes, cremas, shampoo y cosméticos su horario es variado. 

Para tener mas variedad en sus productos quiere comprar perfumes, cremas con el préstamo. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Myriam, 22 years old, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She still lives with her parents but works as a Yambal vendor (Yambal is a company that sells cosmetics by catalog, which helps the women of Ecuador become potential vendors). To get started as a Yambal vendor, Myriam's parents lent her money to buy products and cosmetics. Little by little, with effort and dedication, cosmetics sales have become her main income so she can begin to become independent. She sells perfumes, creams, shampoo and cosmetics. Her schedule varies. To have a greater variety of products, Myriam wants to buy perfumes and creams with the loan. In the future, she wants to have her own cosmetics store.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, creams

loans.name: Macetitas Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA  MACETITAS, PORQUE SE DEDICAN A LA ELABORACION DE MACETAS DE BARRO ESTA  UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MEXICO, MUY CERCA DE LOS LÍMITES CON EL ESTADO DE MORELOS. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9  INTEGRANTES.
LA SEÑORA CAMILA A. ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO. TIENE 48 AÑOS Y SOLO ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA, ELABORA MACETAS DE BARRO. LLEVA 15 AÑOSDEDICANDOSE A LA  ALFARERIA, YA QUE ES UNA TRADICION FAMILIAR, SU MAMA LE ENSEÑO EL OFICIO CUANDO PERDIO SU TRABAJO DE EMPLEADA DOMESTICA, VIVE CON SU MAMA Y SU HERMANO.
SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA  QUE UTILIZA PARA LA ELABORACION DE LAS MACETAS, LAS MACETAS LAS VENDEN SIN HORNEAR, YA QUE NO CUENTAN CON UN VEHICULO PARA TRASPORTAR SU PRODUCTO Y SOLO LO VENDEN CON SUS VECINOS,  SU SUEÑO ES CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO  DE LAMINA PARA PODER ALMACENAR SUS MACETAS YA QUE SE ACERCA EL TIEMPO DE LLUVIAS.

EL NOMBRE DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPOS Y SU ACTIVIDAD SON:
IGNACIA S.                    ALFARERIA
MARIA MERBI G.                ALFARERIA
GREGORIA SABEL A.             ALFARERIA
ERNESTINA O.                  ALFARERIA
JUANA C.                      ALFARERIA
MERCED G.                     ALFARERIA
LEONOR ESTELA M.              ALFARERIA
CLEMENTINA C.                 ALFARERIA
texts.en:
This group is called Macetitas, because it focuses on making clay pots. It is located in Mexico in the state of Puebla, very close to the border with the state of Morelos. The group consists of nine members. Camila A. is a member of the group. She is 48 years old and only has a grade school education. She makes clay pots. She has dedicated herself to pottery for 15 years, as it is a family tradition. Her mom taught her the trade when she lost her job as a domestic servant. She lives with her mom and her brother. She asks for the loan to be able to buy raw materials to use to make pots. She sells the pots without kilning them, and as she has no vehicle to transport her product, she only sells to her neighbors. Her dream is to construct a room with plate to be able to store her pots as the rainy season is approaching. The name of the members of the group and their job are: IGNACIA S. Pottery MARIA MERBI G. Pottery GREGORIA SABEL A. Pottery ERNESTINA O. Pottery JUANA C. Pottery MERCED G. Pottery LEONOR ESTELA M. Pottery CLEMENTINA C. Pottery

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials to use to make pots

loans.name: Estrellas De Sumpango Group

texts.es: El grupo estrellas de Sumpango del municipio de Sumpango, Sac. esta conformado por tres integrantes, las tres se dedican a varios negocios como por ejemplo, Veronica se dedica a cocer delantales las cuales vende en el municipio, es madres de una niña. Odilia tiene  cuatro hijos, se dedica a bordar blusas que se utilizan para algunas ceremonias especiales dentro del municipio de Sumpango, al igual que Hermelinda quien se dedica a bordar así como tambien a vender refacciones en el mercado, las tres han trabajado varios ciclos con FAPE, ahora nuevamente solicitan otro, ya que son socias puntuales, el dinero del crédito lo utilizarán para comprar diversos materiales para uso de los negocios, ellas sueñan con tener una casa propia y asi mismo contribuir a el desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
The Estrellas de Sumpango (Stars of Sumpango) Group, from the town of Sumpango, Sac., is made up of three members. The three women work at several businesses; for example, Veronica sews aprons which she sells in town. She has a daughter. Odila has four children. She works embroidering blouses which are worn for special ceremonies in the town of Sumpango. Hermelinda also embroiders and does alterations in the market. The three women have worked with FAPE for several loan cycles, and now they are asking again for a loan, since they are punctual members. They will use the loan money to buy different materials to use in their businesses. They dream of having their own houses and thus contributing to the development of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for their businesses

loans.name: Estefa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Estefa;   ella tiene 22 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años la socia es ama de casa se dedica íntegramente al cuidado de su menor hijo, él conyugue de ella tienen una vulcanizadora él conyugue necesita comprar herramientas de trabajo para su taller y ella lo ayudará con el préstamo. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para apoyar a su conyugue y comprar herramientas para su taller de vulcanizadora.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Estefa is a member of the “Esmeralda” Communal Bank and lives in the San Sebastián district of the Cusco region. She is 22 years old, lives with her partner, and has a 4-year-old son. She is a homemaker very dedicated to the care of her young son. Her partner has a tire repair shop for which he needs tools. Estefa will use this loan to support her partner by purchasing tools for his shop. Estefa greatly values and is infinitely grateful for the support offered by this loan and she promises to repay it in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for a tire repair shop

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 65 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa. Para Juan, su prioridad principal es su familia, es por ello que posee un hotel, propiedad que tanto le costo tener. Esta muy satisfecho con lo que ha logrado, ya que obtiene buenos ingresos económicos, por tal motivo anhela abrir otro hotel, con la necesidad de captar mayor clientela. Por lo que general tiene dos personas que la ayuden en la atención del cliente. Considera además, que gracias al buen servicio y a la buena infraestructura de sus habitaciones han hecho que sus clientes estén más que satisfechos. Su punto de localización es frente al parque de su propia localidad, atendiendo las 24 horas del día. Lleva 35 años laborando en este rubro, por el cual le ha sido rentable hasta la fecha. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además agradece a su grupo comunal, por los beneficios que otorga. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sábanas, frazadas y demás implementos de limpieza para dar un buen ambiente a su hotel.
texts.en:
Juan is 65, married, and has four children. They live together in their own house in Quimbiri, located in the beautiful jungles of the Cusco region. Juan’s priority is his family, so he has a hotel, although it was expensive to buy. He is very happy with what he has achieved and he makes a good income. So, he would like to open another hotel to attract more customers. He usually has two people that help him with customer service, and he thinks that thanks to this excellent service and the good condition of his guest rooms that his customers are very satisfied. His hotel is located in front of the town square and is open 24 hours a day. He has been in this field for 35 years and it has always been profitable. This is his third loan from MFP, and he promises to repay it on time. He is grateful for his communal bank for the benefits it provides. He will use this loan to purchase sheets, blankets, and cleaning supplies to keep the hotel in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets, blankets, and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, D.  25 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos. Juntos residen en una casa alquilada ubicada en una comunidad D. L. ceja D. selva peruana.Un día se dio cuenta que no tenia competencia y decidió instalar una vinícoL. donD. venD. para todo el público en general. En el primer año solo recuperó lo que había invertido, pero a partir del segundo año hacia adelante, empezó a obtener mayores ganancias, y sus ventas fueron incrementándose paulatinamente. Hoy tiene grandes pedidos D. instituciones privadas y públicas, y a veces no se da abasto con todos, e  incumple con L. entrega D. los vinos en las  fechas previstas. Por lo general sus productos los compra en otra ciudad, a un precio módico, debido a que sus familiares le otorgan ese precio y L. facilidad D. transportar los vinos. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe L. ayuda D. su pareja, y su punto D. venta está localizado en su casa arrendada, atienD. desD. las 8  D. L. mañana hasta las 11 D. L. noche. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio D. venta D. vinos, para atraer mayor clienteL..Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y  se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas puntualmente, además agradece a su banco comunal por el buen trabajo que realizan.Judith tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en L.  compra D.  una cantidad considerable D. vinos que tienen gran demanda en su localidad, ya que desea  aumentar sus ingresos y a L. vez mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Judith, who is 25 years old, lives with her partner and their two children. They live together in a rented house located in a community at the edge of the Peruvian jungle. One day she realized that she did not have any competition and decided to set up a wine store where she would sell to the public in general. In the first year, she only recovered what she had invested, but from the second year on, she began to have better earnings, and her sales gradually increased. Now she has large orders from private and public institutions, and at times she can't manage them all and complete the deliveries of wine on the expected dates.
