She generally buys her products in another city at a reasonable price, thanks to her relatives, who offer her these prices and the means to transport the wines. Normally she works on her own, but on occasion she receives help from her partner. Her sales location is located in their rented house, and she works from 8 in the morning until 11 at night. In the future, she is planning to expand her wine-selling business to attract more clients. This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to continue making her payments on time. In addition, she is grateful to her community bank for the good work that they do. Judith is planning to invest the loan in the purchase of a considerable quantity of wines that have great demand in her area, since she wants to increase her income and at the same time improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a quantity of wine to stock her business

loans.name: Ruben Adriel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. Rubén;   él tiene 25 años de edad, él socio es conviviente y tiene un hijo de 1 año y 18 meses, él socio se dedica al transporte, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su auto. 

Él  socio valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “Esmeralda” Community Bank. He lives in the San Sebastián District that belongs to the province and department of Cusco. Our member is Mr. Ruben. He is 25 years old. He has a domestic partner and a one-year-old child. Our member is a driver. He is asking for this loan in order to buy tires for his car. Our member values and is infinitely grateful for the help offered from the bank. He promises to repay the loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member is asking for this loan in order to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Señor De Palomo Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Señor D. Palomo, se encuentra ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica, su actividad principal es el Comercio.
Bertha es socia y Tesorera del Bancomunal, es casada y tiene 05 hijos, dos varones y 3 mujeres, todos mayores D. edad, quienes están estudiando en L. Universidad. Bertha se dedicaba a L. venta D. pernos en general, pero ahora gracias a que tiene mayor capital, su negocio ha mejorado y ha crecido, dedicándose a L. venta D. repuestos para motocicletas. Como producto D. sus reuniones Bertha a aprendido a ahorrar, ser solidaria y puntual, lo cual le ayuda en su negocio. Bertha requiere D. un préstamo para comprar mercadería, L. cual le generará mayores ingresos y así lograr pronto el sueño que tiene D. poder tener una tienda granD. con muchos repuestos D. motos.
texts.en:
The “Señor D. Palomo” Community Bank is located in the department of Huancavelica. The bank’s major activity is commerce. Bertha is a member and the treasurer of the bank. She is married and has five children, two boys and three girls. They are adults and are studying in the university. Bertha sells general hardware. Now, since she has more capital, she is improving her business. She is now selling motorcycle tires. As a result of the meetings with the community bank, Bertha is learning to save money and to be a punctual group member. These skills help her with her business. Bertha is asking for a loan in order to buy the type of merchandise that will generate the largest earnings. In this way she will reach her dream of having a large store with many types of motorcycle tires.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: motorcycle tires

loans.name: Jilma Del Socorro

texts.es: Jilma Del Socorro tiene 29 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de cerdo. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que anteriormente inicio con otra actividad como es la venta de comida por lo que necesitaba mantener a sus 2 hijos que son menores de edad y están a su cargo,  ella es una mujer humilde y que le gusta su actividad pues se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy popular en su comarca ella es muy responsable con su actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para engorde. Sueña con construir su propia casa para dejársela a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jilma is 29 years old. She buys and sells pigs. She has been doing this business for the past six years. Before this she sold prepared food. She is the sole support of her two minor children. She is a humble woman and she enjoys her business activities. She is well known in her field of work. She is very responsible. With this loan she will buy pigs and food to make them fat. Her dream is to build her own house so that she can leave it to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ajoa

texts.en:
Ajoa E. fries doughnuts for her customers who buy them and move around to sell them in Takoradi. She has not received any form of education and she is a widow taking care of four children. She is responsible for the general welfare of her family.

Ajoa’s loan is going to serve as additional capital which she is going to use to buy bags of flour and other ingredients to prepare her doughnuts for her demanding customers. She plans to use the new income from her business to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients for preparing her doughnuts

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente al a provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es El Sr. Fausto;   ella tiene 65 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 37, 29,  el socio es casado y la socia se dedica a la zapatería, Nuestro socio se dedica a la fabricación de calzados. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de calzados para fabricar calzados.
 
El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “Esmeralda” communal bank. He lives in the San Sebasitián district, in the province and department of Cusco. Our member is Mr. Fausto. He is 65 years old and has two children who are 37 and 29 years old. He is married. He is a shoemaker—he manufactures shoes. He is requesting a loan to buy materials for making shoes. Mr. Fausto values and is infinitely grateful for the support provided to him through this program and he promises to repay his debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He is requesting a loan to buy materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Tejedoras De Sumpango Group

texts.es: El grupo Tejedoras de Sumpango, esta conformado por tres integrantes, las tres señoras se dedican a Tejer, la lider del grupo es Doña Alberta, ella vende también refacciones los fines de semana en el municipio, ella es muy trabajadora, las otras dos integrantes se dedican a tejer y a sembrar hortalizas, tales como ejote, maíz frijoles, miltomate, etc. Las socias han tenido dos créditos con FAPE, solicitan nuevamente un crédito para poder invertir en su negocio y asi poder realizar mas tejidos y surtir mas su negocio, ellas sueñan con ser día a día mas conocidas y abarcar mas territorio vendiendo sus tejidos.
texts.en:
The Group “Tejedoras de Sumpango” (Knitters of Sumpango) is made up of three ladies who knit. Alberta is the leader. She also sells spare parts in town on the weekend. She is a hard worker. The other members also knit and grow vegetables, such as green beans, corn, beans, tomatoes, etc. They have had two previous loans through FAPE and they are asking for this new loan so that they can invest in their business and be able to increase their production to have a greater variety to offer. The ladies dream of becoming more well-known and of expanding their sales territory.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand their business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es: Marisabel, de 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, Sebastian de 4 años de edad. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde viven en una casa alquilada. A Marisabel le gusta ser práctica y decidida, pese a que tuvo problemas con su esposo en ese entonces, decidió dejar su tierra natal de Huanuco  y buscar nuevos horizontes y pueda tener una estabilidad emocional. Ahora disfruta su vida de la mejor manera, siendo profesora imparte educación en un centro superior, trabajo que le da mucha satisfacción, ya que sus alumnos  responden positivamente en clase. Es así que trabaja desde muy temprano hasta las 1:00 de la tarde y lo que resta del día lo dedica brindado clases particulares, esto le favorece ya que recibe un ingreso adicional al sueldo mensual. Lleva 4 años trabajando, por lo que es consciente de que no toda la vida va seguir como dependiente, es por ello que mas adelante piensa abrir una tienda de venta de ropa, con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas establecidas, además confía que con su grupo comunal llegará lo más lejos posible, ya que le otorga muchas ventajas. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en los gastos de educación de su hija, además pagará el terreno del cual adquirió con la finalidad de establecer su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Marisabel is 36 years old and a single mother. Her son Sebastian is 4 years old. They live in the town of Quimbiri, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle, where they rent a house. Marisabel is practical and determined. Despite the fact that she had problems with her husband at that time, she decided to leave her homeland of Huanuco in search of new horizons and emotional stability in her life. Now she enjoys her life to the fullest. She is a professor at a Centro Superior (university), work that gives her much satisfaction since her pupils are well motivated in class. She works from early in the morning until 1:00 in the afternoon and spends the rest of the day teaching private classes. This helps her financially since it is income she receives in addition to her monthly salary. She has spent 4 years working so she knows that she is not going to remain dependent all of her life. That is why later she plans to open a shop selling clothes in order to improve the quality of life for herself and her family. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is committed to continue making her payments. She is also confident that she will reach her maximum potential with her communal group as it provides many advantages. The loan she is requesting will be used for her son’s educational expenses and to pay for the land which she purchased in order to establish her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover her son's educational expenses and pay for the land she purchased.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica Y. sells tinned tomatoes, cooking oil, onions and eggs in Takoradi. Veronica has been through senior high school. She is married to a mason and lives together with her two children. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to reinvest her new profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jovanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jovanna de  23 años , vive en una zona periurbana en Guayaquil, es vendedora Yambal (es una compañía de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales). Ella vive con su abuela y su hermana para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ella empezó como vendedora de cosméticos a los 19 años. 

Durante todos los años que ha trabajado como vendedora Yambal por catalogo ha invertido sus ganancias en mas productos. Trabaja todos los días vendiendo cosméticos, perfumes, cremas etc. Para incrementar sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas y desodorantes.  

Después de unos años ella quiere tener su propio local de cosméticos y productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
J22-year old Jovanna lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She sells Yambal products (Yambal is a company that sells cosmetics by catalogue and helps Ecuadorean women become sales agents). She lives with her grandmother and sister so she can help with household expenses. She began selling cosmetics at the age of 19. All the time that Jovanna has been working for Yambal, she has invested her profits in buying more products. She works every day selling cosmetics, perfumes, lotions etc. In order to increase her sales, she wants to use the loan to buy more perfumes, lotions, and deodorants. After a few years she wishes to buy a small store from which to sell cosmetics and personal products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, and deodorants

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia E. sells foodstuffs in Takoradi. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. Cecilia has received no formal education. She has been selling foodstuffs for some time now. She helps her husband provide for the general needs of their family. Her loan will be used to buy more and a greater variety of foodstuffs to improve her business by increasing her stock of goods. She hopes to save the new revenue from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba E. makes and sells coconut oil. She also sells cassava and plantain in Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Her husband is in farming. She provides a helping hand to her husband by clothing the children. She is confident that this loan will help boost her business. She plans to use the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell and coconut to make the oil. She hopes to reinvest her profits into the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell and coconut to make oil

loans.name: Teacalco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama TEACALCO, esta ubicado en el Estado de Morelos. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.

La señora Delia C. ocupa el puesto de Presidenta  del grupo tiene 33 años de edad, tiene dos años vendiendo refrescos.

La señora Reyna G. está casada y se dedica a la producción y venta de Leche y sus derivados, así como de carne.

Hace 38 años su esposo y ella tenían unas vacas, empezaron vendiendo leche en el pueblo, hasta un día que le pidieron que entregara leche en la Escuela Técnica en la que asistía su hijo.
Al ver que no le alcanzaba el dinero, la señora comentó esto con su hijo quien pidió a uno de sus maestros le enseñara a hacer queso Oaxaca. El maestro le enseño no solo a el sino también a sus padres, mismos que aprendieron muy rápido y hoy en día tienen un pequeña empresa productora de Leche y sus derivados, así como de Cría y venta de cerdos.

El programa de Desarrollo Agropecuario la visitó y le apoyaron con un crédito para una prensa y una descremadora.

Posteriormente inicia con el pie de cría de cerdos, ellos los crían y los sacrifican para vender en su carnicería y algunos clientes.

Actualmente ellos tienen clientes en Taxco y Cuernavaca.

El crédito que recibió lo utilizó en la compra de materia prima: cloruro de calcio, blanqueador y cuajos, mismos que utilizan para producir el Queso Oaxaca.
texts.en:
This group is called Teacalco, and it is located in the state of Morelos. The group is comprised of ten members. Delia C. is the president of the group. She is 33 years old, and she has been selling soft drinks for two years. Reyna G. is married, and she produces and sells milk and its derivatives. She also sells meat. Thirty-eight years ago she and her husband had some cows. They started selling milk in the town. After one day they were asked to deliver milk to the technical school their son attended. Upon seeing that this was not enough money, she mentioned it to her son. Her son asked one of his teachers to teach him how to make Oaxaca cheese. The teacher not only taught him, but his parents as well. They learned very quickly, and they now have a small business producing milk and its derivatives. They also raise and sell pigs. The program for “Desarollo Agropecuario” (Farming Devlopment) visited her. They helped her with a loan for a press and a machine that skims milk. She later began raising pigs. She raises them and then butchers them to sell in her meat market and to some customers. They currently have customers in Taxco and Cuernavaca. She used the loan that she received to buy raw material like calcium chloride, whitener, and rennet. She uses these to make Oaxaca cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calcium chloride, whitener, and rennet to make Oaxaca cheese.

loans.name: Flores De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Las flores de Sumpango, esta conformado por tres personas, la mayoria se dedica a la agricultura, y también a los tejidos, la representante del grupo, es donña Juana B., de 35 años con tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura en el mismo municipio, lleva 10 años dedicandose a la siembra de; miltomate, necesita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar mas material y sembrar mas miltomate, aprovechando las lluvias de este mes. las tres han trabajado varios ciclos con FAPE y siempre han sido puntuales en la realización de sus pagos, utilizaran el crédito para comprar semillas e hilos para tejer. Sueñan con ver a sus hijos formando un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The group Flores de Sumpango (Flowers of Sumpango) consists of three members. They work in agriculture as well as in weaving. The group's representative is Juana B. who is 35 years old. Juana has three children and works in agriculture in the same town. She has ten years of experience in cultivating green tomatoes. She is seeking a new loan to be used for the purchase of raw materials so that she could plant a larger quantity of green tomatoes and take advantage of the rainy season this month. The three partners have completed several loan cycles with FAPE and have always been timely with repayments; they will use the new loan to purchase seeds as well as threads for weaving. All of them dream of a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for agriculture and weaving

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila E. is single. She prepares tea and serves it with eggs and bread at Takoradi. Her customers are mostly those who want to take their breakfast outside the home. She has been through junior high school. She responsibly takes care of herself.

Sheila’s loan will be used to buy more ingredients to prepare her tea for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to prepare her tea for sale

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina D. is married and has three children. She has been educated to senior high school level. Her husband is a welder.

Georgina sells firewood and charcoal at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the home. She will use the loan to purchase extra charcoal and firewood. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase extra charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty K. buys fresh fish in bulk, stores it in a freezer, and then sells it later in smaller quantities at Takoradi.

Gifty has received junior high school education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Gifty’s loan will be used to buy additional boxes of fish to freeze for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of fish to freeze and sell

loans.name: La Segunda Rosa Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la Sra. Ángela del Carmen S., presidenta del grupo La Segunda Rosa, que está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla en México.  Se ve en la foto a las integrantes del grupo así como los adornos típicos de la festividad del pueblo.   Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado ovino y a la venta de maíz cultivado por ella y su esposo. Considera que no hay mejor trabajo que la agricultura y la cría de animales domésticos.  Al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente agradecida ya que por su condición económica y edad considera que es muy difícil que le otorguen un préstamo.  A sus 66 años casada y sin estudios, tiene 9 hijos (5 hombres y 4 mujeres) de los cuales solo uno de ellos depende de ella económicamente ya que aun se encuentra estudiando.   Solicita el préstamo para  poder comprar alimento para su ganado ovino, fertilizantes y comprar más animales para cría y vender.   También espera que con sus ganancias pueda seguir ayudando a su hijo en sus estudios y seguir siendo una persona productiva.
El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes las cuales son:

María Luisa P			Vta. De ropa
Mercedes R.			Vta. De ropa
Teresa M.			Vta. De maíz
Felipa Josefina L.		Vta. De tortilla
Laura Vianeis R.		Vta. De desayunos
María Noelia V.			Vta. De calzado
Lidia Silvia T.			Vta. De tortilla
Ventura G.			Vta. De desecho industrial
texts.en:
This photo was taken in the house of Sra. Ángela del Carmen S., president of the Segunda Rosa group which is located in the state of Puebla, Mexico. In the photo the members of the group can be seen as well as decorations typical of the town. Ángela raises sheep and also sells the corn which she and her husband grow. She believes that there’s no better work than farming and raising livestock. She knows it is difficult to ask for a loan at this time given her economic situation and age, so she is grateful that the money will be granted to her. Ángela is 66 years old, married, and has no education. She has nine children (five sons and four daughters), only one of whom is still dependent on her as he is a student. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy animal feed, fertilizer, and more animals to raise and sell. She also hopes that with the profits she will be able to continue helping her son with his studies and continue being a productive member of society. The group is comprised of the following ten members: María Luisa P (clothing S.)  Mercedes R. (clothing S.)  Teresa M. (corn S.)  Felipa Josefina L. (tortilla S.)  Laura Vianeis R. (breakfast S.)  María Noelia V. (shoe S.)  Lidia Silvia T. (tortilla S.)  Ventura G. (industrial waste S.)

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animal feed, fertilizer, and more animals

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana tiene 48 años, vive en San Martín Jilopeque, es casa con Don Emigio y tienen 8 hijos. Doña Juana se dedica a criar barracos y a prestarlos  para raza, ella viaja a Chimaltenango a vender a sus animales, como conejos, chompipes y pollos (vende en el mercado de Chimaltenango). También se dedica al cultivo del café. Así es como Doña Juana obtiene sus ganancias y lucha para sacar adelante siempre a sus hijos junto con su esposo se han ayudado mutuamente. Juana solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos extranjeros, compra de concentrado compra de leña y abono organico para su milpa. Agradece a FAPE siempre por el apoyo que siempre da. Sueña con tener una pequeña granja.
texts.en:
48-year old Doña Juana lives in San Martín Jilopeque with her husband. They have eight children. Juana raises animals and lends them out for breeding. She travels to the market in Chimaltenango to sell her rabbits, turkeys, and chickens. She also grows coffee. These are the ways she earns her living and struggles to get ahead. Her children and husband have all helped. Juana is asking for a loan to buy a different breed of pig, animal feed, firewood, and organic fertilizer for her fields. She is grateful to Kiva partner FAPE for the help that they always provide. Her dream is to own a small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more animals and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fruits and products for their businesses.

loans.name: Ledovina

texts.es: Ledovina, de 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 jóvenes  hijos, en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a atender su negocio de repuestos  para autos, es consciente que se debe a sus clientes, y siempre  trata de atenderlos con mucha amabilidad. Sus ventas han mejorado bastante con respecto a los años anteriores, y reconoce que le falta mucho por mejorar. Normalmente trabaja junto con su esposo; y su negocio está bien posicionado en la localidad; es por eso que  atiende desde las 5  de la mañana hasta las 10  de la noche. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar  un taller que brinde mantenimiento a  todo tipo de autos, y ya pensó que su esposo se encargará  del negocio.Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos, además se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes se apoyan mutuamente. Ledovina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de  cantidad de repuestos para autos que necesita para  atender la constante demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ledovina, age 34, lives with her husband and four young children in their own home. Ledovina's business is auto parts sales; she knows that she owes everything to her clients, and for this reason she always tries to provide them with the best care. Her sales have increased substantially compared with prior years, yet Ledovina recognizes that there is much she can do to improve. Usually, Ledovina works together with her husband; their business is well-positioned in the town, and, because of this, she works from 5 in the morning until 10 at night. In the future, Ledovina is planning to set up an auto-repair shop that will provide maintenance services to all types of cars; she is thinking that her husband will be responsible for the repair shop. This is Ledovina's third loan with MFP, and she is committed to be timely with her repayments. Furthermore, she feels very happy with the work of her communal bank since all the members provide support to each other. Ledovina plans to invest the loan into the purchase of additional auto parts inventory that she needs to satisfy the steady demand from her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts inventory

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos mayores que son independientes. Vive en L. localidad de San francisco, ubicada en L. hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa. Martha desde muy niña siempre estuvo inquieta, no le gustaba estar sin hacer nada, cuando podía ayudaba a sus padres en los trabajos domésticos. Hoy se dedica en L. venta de ropa, es así que tiene 25 años realizando esta actividad, en donde recuerda que su primer año le fue difícil pero conforme pasaba el tiempo pudo nivelarse y posteriormente sus ganancias aumentaron. Se siente muy satisfecha con lo que ha logrado, es por ello que en el futuro espera ampliar su tienda de ropa, con L. finalidad de posicionarse en el mercado. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, en ocasiones recibe L. ayuda de su familia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además se siente comprometido con su grupo comunal, ya que todos sus socios son personas que le inspiran puntualidad y solidaridad. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en L. compra de mercadería, con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos como también mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 55 years old. She is a single mother and has three children who are already grown and independent. She lives in her own home in the town of San Francisco, located in the beautiful rain forest near the city of Ayacucho. Ever since she was very young, Martha was always restless - she never liked to sit around and do nothing. Whenever she could, she helped her parents with household work. Today, Martha works in clothing sales; she has been in this business for 25 years. She remembers that starting out during her first year was difficult, but, as time when by, she was able to break even, and later her earnings grew. Martha feels very happy with what she has been able to achieve. For this reason, she is hopeful that she'll be able to expand her clothing store, with the end goal of achieving a position in the market. Martha usually works on her own with occasional help from her family. This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to repay it in a timely manner. Furthermore, she feels very committed to her community group since all her partners inspire punctuality and solidarity. Martha will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise, with the objective of increasing her income and improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 56 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo mayor. Juntos residen en una casa alquilada en una comunidad ubicada en la  selva peruana.Desde muy niña tuvo la noción de instalar su propio negocio, pero nunca se había imaginado que lo iba hacer lejos de su querido pueblo natal. María asegura que por  su buena sazón cautivó a sus clientes más exigentes, pues ofrece platos típicos de la zona con un precio razonable con respecto al resto de su competencia. Su rutina diaria se inicia a partir de las 4 de la mañana, cuando empieza con todos los preparativos diarios, y empieza con  la atención a los  clientes a partir de las 7 de la mañana,  hasta las 10 de la noche. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un local propio y amplio, pues quiere  recibir mayor cantidad de clientes, para mejorar sus ingresos.Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir  puntualmente con sus pagos, además agradece a los integrantes de su banco comunal, porque todos son muy  responsables y puntuales.María tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en  adquirir una parrilla y el resto le servirá para adquirir los ingredientes que le hacen falta, pues quiere obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old. She lives with her husband and her oldest son. They live together in a rented house in a community located in the Peruvian jungle. Ever since she was a girl she had the idea of opening her own business, but she never imagined that she would do it far from her beloved home town. María assures us that because of her excellent cooking she was able to charm even her most demanding customers. She offers meals typical of the area for a more reasonable price than the rest of her competition. Her daily routine begins at 4:00 in the morning, when she begins preparing for the day. She begins serving her customers at 7:00 in the morning and is open until 10:00 at night. For the future, she plans to open her own large restaurant because she’d like to serve a larger number of customers and improve her income. This is the third loan she’s had with Microfinanzas Prisma and she promises to make her payments punctually. María plans to invest her requested loan in a grill and the rest will be used to buy ingredients she needs so that she can improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grill and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: R., de 53 años de edad, es viuda y tiene una hija mayor, Hilda de 18 años. Juntos viven en L. localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en L. hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. R. recuerda que hace un buen tiempo atrás quería instalar su propio negocio, aunque en un inicio no tenía los medios pero sus familiares le hicieron un préstamo y con ello pudo instalar un Bar “Recreo”. Desde entonces y con ayuda de dos empleados, atiende a sus clientes más concurrentes, quienes son muchos que acuden a su establecimiento durante los fines de semana. Con los ahorros acumulados durante su tiempo de trabajo, decidió ampliar su negocio, con L. finalidad de poder captar mayor clienteL.. Su mayor anhelo es implementar una tienda de venta de ropa, introduciendo nuevos estilos y formas según a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes o también comprar un moto carro para ofrecer el servicio de transporte, ya que lo considera muy rentable. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual, además hace hincapié el buen desempeño que tiene su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en L. compra de un moto carro, con L. finalidad de poder ampliar su mercado a L. vez de obtener otros ingresos extras, que le pueda  servir para su canasta familiar.
texts.en:
R., who is 53 years old, is a widow and she has an adult daughter, Hilda, who is 18 years old. They live together in the town of San Francisco, located in the beautiful jungle of Ayacucho, where they have their own house. R. remembers that she had wanted for a long time to open her own business. Though at first she didn’t have the means to do so, some family members made her a loan and she opened a bar called “Recreo.” Since then, with the help of her employees, she has tended to her customers, of whom many come to her establishment on the weekends. With the savings she had accumulated during the time she has been working, she decided to expand her business, with the goal of attracting more customers. Her greatest wish is to open a clothing store and introduce new styles that would appeal to her customers’ tastes and preferences. She would also like to buy a motorcycle taxi to offer transportation services, which is something she thinks is very profitable. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to continue paying punctually. She also emphasizes the good performance of her communal bank. She will invest the loan she is requesting in the purchase of a motorocyle taxi, with the goal of growing her market and also earning an extra income, which will serve her family’s basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Santa María està integrado por dos socias, Rosa Etelvina G. y Betulia Etelvina G. H., ambas son familiares.  Las dos socias viven en la Colonia Santa María en Juticalpa, Olancho.  Antes habia otra socia pero se atrasaba en el pago de sus cuotas.  

Sra. Rosa Etelvina G. tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 7 hijos.  Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace mucho tiempo.  Empezó su negocio con una chiclera pero la ganancia era poca y decidió cambiar de negocio a la elaboración y venta de tortillas.  Invertirá el préstamo de 3,000 Lempiras en materia prima como maíz y leña para aumentar su producción de tortillas y sus ganancias.  Con las ganancias podrá mejorar la alimentación y educación de su familia.  La Sra. Rosa Etelvina G. sueña con poder ampliar su casa y hacerle unas mejoras porque está bastante deteriorada.  Ha sido un buen cliente de FAMA y siempre ha pagado puntualmente.  Agradece la confianza y el apoyo brindado por FAMA, ya que a traves de los préstamos ha superado momentos difíciles.    

Sra. Betulia Etelvina G. H. tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda y tiene un hijo.  Con su hijo tiene un negocio de reparación y servicio de computadoras.  También se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y la venta de agua purificada.  Con el préstamo de 3,000 Lempiras comprará componentes de computadoras, ropa de segunda mano y agua purificada.  Con el apoyo del préstamo su negocio será más amplio y sus ganancias aumentarán.  El sueño de Sra. Betulia Etelvina G. es que su hijo siga su educación en la universidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Santa María” is composed of two members, Rosa Etelvina G. and Betulia Etelvina G. H.. They are family members. They live in the Santa María neighborhood of Juticalpa, Olancho. There used to be another member, but she got behind in making her repayments. Rosa Etelvina G. is 44 years old. She is a single mother and has 7 children. She has been making and selling tortillas for a long time. She started her business with a street stand selling sweets, but the earnings from it weren’t much, so she decided to change the business to making and selling tortillas. She will invest her loan of HNL 3,000.00 (Honduran Lempiras) in raw materials such as corn and firewood so she can increase her production of tortillas and her income. With the earnings she could improve her family’s food and education. Rosa Etelvina G. dreams of being able to expand her house and make some improvements to it because it is quite deteriorated. She has been a good client of FAMA and has always paid punctually. She is grateful for the trust and support shown to her by FAMA because the loans have helped her through difficult moments. Betulia Etelvina G. H. is 64 years old. She is a widow and has one son. Along with her son she has a business repairing and servicing computers. She also sells second-hand clothing and purified water. With the support of the loan, her business will grow and her earnings will increase. Betulia Etelvina G.’ dream is for her son to continue his education at university.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 58 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus siete hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad de la selva peruana.Es una mujer luchadora que a pesar de las carencias económicas que paso cuando era niña, logro salir adelante, y en la actualidad atiende en su tienda de abarrotes que instalo con mucho esfuerzo, y ya lleva casi 34 años trabajando de manera constante. Su estrategia de permanecer en un negocio tan competitivo es que siempre compra productos que están al alcance del público en general, además mantiene su tienda siempre bien abarrotada de variedad de productos. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, y su rutina diaria empieza a las 5  de la mañana, y se extiende  hasta las 9  de la noche. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de poder introducir nuevos productos, para ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.Este es el tercer crédito que tiene  con MFP, y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo puntualmente con sus pagos, además asegura sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, debido a que todos los integrantes se ayudan para salir adelante.Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en  la compra de cantidad de  mercadería con el propósito de abastecer su tienda de abarrotes, pues quiere incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 58, is a single mother who lives with her seven children. They live in their own home in a community in the Peruvian jungle. She is a hardworking woman who managed to get ahead despite financial problems when she was a child. She currently runs her grocery store which she worked hard to open. She has been working there steadily for almost 34 years. Her strategy to solidify herself in such a competitive business is to always buy products that are within the reach of the general public. Furthermore, she always keeps her store well-stocked with a variety of products. She usually works on her own, but her children occasionally help her. Her day starts at 5 am and lasts until 9 pm. Her plan for the future is to expand her grocery store with the goal of introducing new products, in order to offer her customers the best. This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with repayments. She is also very comfortable with her community bank, since all of the members help each other to get ahead. Rosa plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store, as she wants to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Doña Felipa es vecina de San Martin Jilotepeque tiene 65 años de edad es casa con Don Agripino y tienen 6 hijos. Don Agripino trabaja como conserje en el Colegio La Amistad, Doña Felipa se dedica a moler café seco y venderlo en el mercado y también de casa en casa. compra café oro seco por quinta, vende leña por unidad. Solicita el crédito para dcomprar café seco por quintal y Leña; pero ella necesita un molino de café nuevo ya que el que tiene esta muy dañado y lo ha reparado varias veces y presiente que en cualquier momento ya no funcionara, y no quiere quedarse sin el producto. Sueña con tener su propio local para no tener que vender de casa en casa.
texts.en:
Felipa lives near San Martin Jilotepeque. She is 65, married to Agripino, and has six children. Agripino works as a custodian in the La Amistad School. Felipa grinds dried coffee and sells it in the market. She also sells door to door. She buys dried coffee beans by the “quintal” (46 kg.), and she sells firewood by the unit. She is requesting a loan to buy dried coffee by the quintal and firewood. She needs a new coffee grinder because the one she has is very damaged. She has repaired it several times, and it still stops working at any given moment. She does not want to be without her product. She dreams of having her own place to sell so that she does not have to sell door to door.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more product to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia de 40 años que vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el sector Luis Alva Castro del distrito de Paiján, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la fabricación y distribución de pan, cuenta con un horno artesanal instalado en su domicilio, allí prepara su pan y luego lo distribuye en el distrito donde vive, en los caseríos aledaños y en el cercano distrito de Puerto Malabrigo. El ha sabido ganarse un lugar en el mercado y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fiel. Como esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingresos Segundo trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantener su negocio de la mejor manera posible.

Segundo desea comprar mas insumos como harina, azúcar y leña para preparar mas pan e incrementar sus ventas, esta acción le generará mas ganancias con las cuales pueda entregarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Segundo es alguien bastante trabajador y con muchas ganas de superación. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 40-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the Luis Alva Castro sector of the Paijan district, a zone belonging to the Ascope province in the La Libertad region, two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than ten years he has baked and sold bread. He has a traditional oven in his home where he prepares his bread and later distributes it in the zone where he lives, in the surrounding villages and the nearby district of Puerto Malabrigo. He managed to gain a spot in the market and now has a loyal customer base. Since this activity is his only source of income, Segundo is trying to give it his best in order to make it the best possible. Segundo wants to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar and firewood to prepare more bread and increase his sales. This will generate him more income with which he can offer his family a better quality of life. In order to achieve his goal he has found it necessary to request a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alterniva. Segundo is a very hard-working person with a great desire to succeed. He has worked previously with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for bread baking

loans.name: Bertha Julia

texts.es: Doña Julia es casada tiene 46 y 6 hijos una de ellas eta estudiando lo que motiva a Julia y a su esposo para luchar aún más para que se logre graduar.  Doña Julia tiene un comedor ubicado a un costado del mercado Municipal tiene como nombre Shadaí. Vende todos los días menos sábados, al mismo tiempo tiene una venta de cubrecamas, sueteres ponchos, trastos y tiene una crianza de pollitos. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería. Sueña con ampliar mas su negocio y asi prosperar cada día mas.
texts.en:
Julia is 46, married and has 6 daughters, one of whom is studying. This motivates Julia and her husband to work even harder so that she can graduate. Julia has a canteen located next to the Municipal market called Shadai. She sells every day except for Saturday and at the same time she sells bedspreads, poncho sweaters and other items, and she raises chicks. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise. She dreams of expanding her business more and to prosper more every day.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing more in her business

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, de 24 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen dos hijos, Xavier de 8 y Ruth de 5 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Hace más de 7 años Sarita tenía una vida simple y de carencias económicas, siendo joven y con un hijo en brazos le fue muy difícil levantarse. Sin experiencia tuvo que sacar los esfuerzos necesarios para salir adelante. Es así que actualmente tiene una anticuchería, ubicado en la avenida principal de su propia localidad, desde las 5:00 de la tarde hasta las 9:00 de la noche es el tiempo que atiende todos los días, tomando en cuenta el tiempo previo para preparar dichos bocadillos. Generalmente trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja. Sus planes a futuro es abrir un local propio para instalar una tienda de abarrotes en la misma avenida de su localidad con la necesidad de ofrecer productos en cantidad y calidad para sus clientes más exigentes. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además con su grupo comunal se siente satisfecho con los buenos acuerdos que llegan en cada reunión. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar ingrediente y productos perecibles para continuar preparando sus anticuchos.
texts.en:
Sarita, 24, lives with her partner and has two children, Xavier, 8 and Ruth, 5. They live together in the town of Quimbiri, located in the beautiful Cusco jungle, where they have their own wooden home. For more than 7 years Sarita has had a simple life with economic lack, as she is young with a babe in arms it has been tough for her to lift herself up. With no experience she had to find the needed strength to get ahead. She now has a food stall, located on the main street in her area. She works from 5 am to 9 pm every day, taking into account the time it takes to prepare her food. She usually works alone, but sometimes her partner helps her. In the future she plans to open her own grocery store on the same street as her food stall, where she will sell quality products to satisfy the most demanding customers. This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to continue to meet her repayment schedule. She is satisfied with her community group and the sound agreements they reach at every meeting. With the requested loan, she will invest in purchasing ingredients and perishable products to continue preparing her food.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and perishable products

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Doña Sabina de 54 años de edad es ama de casa tiene un hijo y es madre soltera siempre lucho poara darle lo mejor a su hijo, ahora su hijo es mayor de edad la ayuda economicamente y se encuentra en el extranjero. Sabina cultiva café, maíz y frijo, también los vende por quintal, al mismo tiempo tiene venta de animales como; patos cisnes, ganzos y tiene una crianza de marranos. Asi es como Sabina obtiene dinero, ahora solicita que se le siga ayudando, y solicta este nuevo crédito para comprar abono organico, quiere abonar sus cafetales y su milpa ya que es tiempo de siembra y al mismo tiempo dese comprar concentrado para sus ganzos y cerdos y un poco de leña. Sueña con abarcar mas lugares vendiendo su café.
texts.en:
Sabina, 54, is a housewife with one child. She is a single mother who is always fighting to be able to give the best to her child. Now her child is older, helps her economically and is out of the country. Sabina grows coffee, corn and beans and sells them by quintal. She also sells animals such as ducks, swans and geese; and she also grows pigs. This is how Sabina makes money, and she is now asking that we keep helping her. She is requesting this loan to buy organic fertilizer. She wants to fertilize her coffee and corn as it is sowing time. She also wants to buy concentrate for her geese and pigs, and some firewood. She dreams of having more places to sell her coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Nelly es soltera  tiene 04 hijos, es por ellos que  siempre ha trabajado y ha logrado  todo lo que hoy tiene.  Recuerda que fue su hermano quien le dio la idea de invertir en la compra de una moto para hacer servicio público, con sus ahorros y mucho sacrificio pudo comprar una primera moto la que alquila generándole ingresos diarios para así poder solventar los gastos de su familia, actualmente tiene 04 motos que ella misma administra y controla.
muy aparte también se dedica a la venta de ropa,con todos  sus ingresos ha logrado ayudar en la educación de sus hijos y lograr que sean profesionales, para este año tiene proyectado terminar la construcción de su casa  y en cuanto a lo que se refiere su negocio quiere formar una empresa de moto taxis  junto a su familia. Con su préstamo obtenido podrá mejorar  sus unidades y darle mantenimiento, el grupo al que pertenece es “LAS PALMERAS” un grupo muy unido y con ganas de seguir trabajando.

* la Sra. Nelly es la 5ta de la derecha
texts.en:
Nelly is single and has four children who have inspired her to work her whole life long and achieve what she has today. She remembers it was her brother who gave her the idea of investing in the purchase of a motorbike to provide public service. With her savings and much sacrifice she was able to purchase a first motorbike which she rents out, generating daily income in order to pay her family expenses. Currently she has four motorbikes which she herself manages and maintains. In a completely separate venture she also sells clothing. With all of her income she has been able to help with her children’s education and see them become professionals. This year she has planned the completion of the construction of her house and regarding her business she wants to set up a moto-taxi business with her family [A moto-taxi is a motorcycle with attached trailer for passengers]. With her loan she will be able to improve and maintain her units. She belongs to the group “Las Palmeras” [The Palm Trees], a close-knit group motivated to keep working. *Nelly is the fifth from the right

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve and maintain her motorbikes

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 53 años de edad, es divorciado y tiene un hijo, Ronaldo de 12 años. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Teofilo se dedica generalmente a comercializar medicinas naturales, ofreciendo productos de calidad total, por tal motivo ha sabido ganar a su público. Cada quincena adquiere sus productos y entrega los pedidos acorde a las exigencias de sus clientes. Con el pasar del tiempo sus ventas mejoraron, es por ello que en un futuro desea tener una farmacia con la necesidad de imponer su producto natural hacia el publico en general. Usualmente trabaja de manera independiente y apuesta por estos productos naturales debido a que está tomando mucha relevancia a nivel nacional e internacional. Por lo general su producto los vende mayormente en las boticas y de manera ambulante. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo de manera puntual, además se sienten seguro con su grupo comunal, debido al compromiso de cada uno de sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercaderías con la finalidad de cumplir con los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Teofilo, 53, is divorced and has a son, Ronaldo, age 12. They live together in the beautiful Cusco jungle, in the town of Quimbiri, where they have their own house. Teofilo generally sells natural medicines, offering total quality products which have won over his public. Every fortnight he acquires his products and fills orders according to client requests. With the passage of time his sales have increased, and so in the future he wants to have a pharmacy to offer his natural products to the general public. He usually works independently and he is committed to these products because they are gaining much relevance on the national and international level. He usually sells his products in pharmacies and as a street vendor. This is his third loan with MFP, so he promises to continue to be punctual. He feels secure with his community group, because of the commitment of each of the members. With the requested loan, he will invest in the purchase of merchandise with the goal of filling his outstanding orders.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural products for sale

loans.name: María Angelina

texts.es: Doña Angelina tiene 30 años esta casada y tienen 4 hijos, su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero y el le envia ayuda economica. Angelina trabajo para darles estudio a sus hijas para que algún día sean personas profesionales. se dedica a vender comales los días martes, jueves y domingo en el mercado municipal de San Martín Jilotepeque a parte de eso vende pollos y al mismo tiempo borda y vende delantales tipícos. Ella solicita el crédito pra invertilo en comprar más comales ya que los días que no va al mercado vende en su casa porque la gente ya la conoce y sabe donde vive, también comprar concentrado para sus animales. Sueña con tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Angelina, 30, is married and they have 4 children. Her husband is out of the country and sends her economic support. Angelina works to give her daughters an education so that they will be professionals one day. She sells comales [brick dishes for making tortillas] on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays in the local San Martin Jilotepeque market. She also sells chickens and at the same time she embroiders and sells traditional aprons. She is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing more comales, as on the days when she does not go to the market she sells in her home, since people already know her and know where she lives. She also wants to buy concentrate for her animals. She dreams of having her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna B. est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants en charge et tutrice de 02 filles. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG COUNDARA depuis le 22 janvier 2003 et a 14 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle fait une activité d'embouche ovine, elle achète des chèvres et des mouton qu'elle engraisse pendant au mois 4 mois pour les vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. A côté de cette activité elle vend sur une table de fortune le petit déjeuné au bord de la route nationale. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille, par exemple la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants tout en renforçant le niveau de ses épargne.
texts.en:
Maïmouna B. is a 35-year-old woman who is married and the mother of nine children to support, and she is the guardian of two girls.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG COUNDARA since January 22, 2003 and has had fourteen consecutive loans without ever any difficulty repaying.  Maïmouna's work involves fattening sheep.  She buys goats and sheep and fattens them for at least four months and then sells them at the weekly markets in her town.  Aside from this business, she has a makeshift table where she sells breakfast along the Route Nationale.  Her goal is to help support her family in terms of, for example, food, health care, and schooling for the children while she bolsters her savings at the same time. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her business fattening sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
Estefana  G. tiene 55 años vive con sus tres hijos mayores en  casa propia ella tiene aproximadamente 27 años de ser comerciante  inicio vendiendo costuras que ella elaboraba  después comida, inicio su pequeña tienda  de productos de consumo  diario con las ganancia que le generaba su negocio pudo construir su casa  e invertir más en su tienda, gracias al buen trato    y la amabilidad  a podido tener muchos clientes   y debido a eso ha  prosperado. Sus clientes le dan más ánimos para seguir  vendiendo y sentirse independiente  económicamente
Doña Estefana  sueña con manejar un capital propio  está muy agradecida con FAPE  ya que ahora tiene más mercadería, el crédito que solicita ahora será para invertirlo en su tienda  comprar papel higiénico, cereales, granos básicos etc.
texts.en:
Estefana G. is 55 and lives with her three oldest children in her own home. She has been a storekeeper for about 27 years. She started selling clothing that she made, then she sold food. She started her little everyday food shop and with the earnings from her business she was able to build her house and invest more in her store. Thanks to her good service and kindness she has been able to have many customers and has prospered. Her customers give her more encouragement to keep selling and to feel economically independent. Estefana dreams of managing her own capital and is very grateful to FAPE as she already has more merchandise. The requested loan will be invested in her store to buy toilet paper, cereal, basic grains, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment and merchandise

loans.name: Mame Sophie

texts.fr: Mame Sophie C. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de SAMBA 15ANS2 depuis le 17 juillet 20006 et a 7 fois de suite bénéficier de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle développe une activité de petit commerce de chaussures, de tissus, de vaisselles et de fruits et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son approvisionnement en marchandises. Elle soutien ses beaux frères avec qui elle cohabite par rapport à la nourriture et son objectif de de prendre charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mame Sophie C. is a 54 year old woman who is married and a mother of one. She has been a member of the village bank of SAMBA 15ANS2 since July 17, 2006. She has received 7 loans and has never had a problem with repayment. She is developing a small business selling shoes, fabrics, dishes and fruit and her new loan would allow her to increase her supply of merchandise. She supports her brothers-in-law, with whom she lives, with food, and her goal is to take care of their personal needs.

Translated from French by Meghan Davignon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Miriam Margot

texts.es:
Miriam es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de sus clientes concentrados en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura y el comercio, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la venta de uniformes escolares. Ella vende uniformes, buzos, zapatos y ropa en general a sus clientes, Miriam ofrece sus productos de acuerdo a la temporada del año y adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gracias al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad, Miriam ha llegado a tener clientes fieles que a su vez han promocionado su negocio, lo que ha generado un crecimiento en su demanda, por ello ha creído conveniente adquirir mas uniformes para ampliar su negocio y de ese modo percibir mayores ganancias. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Miriam es una persona trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam, 44, is a mother who lives with her family in the Olmos district, a district known for having the majority of its clients concentrated in rural areas with much distance between them. The main economic activities in this area are agriculture and business. It belongs to the Lambayeque province and is located an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over three years Miriam has sold school uniforms. She sells uniforms, jumpers, shoes and general clothing to her customers. Miriam offers her products according to the season and acquires her merchandise in the city of Chiclayo. Thanks to the amount of time she has spent working in this sector, Miriam has gained loyal customers who have promoted her business, which has generated a growth in demand; so she has seen fit to buy more uniforms to expand her business and earn more income. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan of 2000 soles with Edpyme Alternativa. Miriam is a hard-working person who is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to keep growing as a businessperson to be able to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Uniforms to expand her business

loans.name: Vilma Alicia

texts.es:
VILMA TIENE  54 AÑOS DE EDAD   ES MADRE SOLTERA, SE DEDICA A VENDER POLLO Y CARNE DE RES TINE 4  HIJOS 3 MAYORES  Y LA  MENOR  DE  13 AÑOS DE EDAD QUE ESTA ESTUDIANDO  YA LLEVA 9 AÑOS DE VENDER EN SU COMUNIDAD  LA CARNICERIA DE DOÑA VILMA SE LLAMA “SAN ANTONIO”.
ELLA   TRABAJA TODOS LOS DIAS INCLUYENDO LOS FINES DE SEMANA YA QUE NO HAY OTRA CARNICERIA EN ESE SECTOR Y TIENE MUCHOS CLIENTES.
ELLA VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD URVANA MUY TRANQUILA.
SU SUEÑO PÈRSONAL ES HACER MAS GRANDE SU CASA Y QUE SU HIJA TERMINE SUS ESTUDIOS. 
DOÑA VILMA UTILIZARA SU CREDITO PARA SURTIR MAS SU NEGOCIO DE POLLO Y CARNE, PIENZA QUE CON  LA INVERSION  QUE LE ARA A SU NEGOCIO OBTENDRA  MEJORES INGRESOS Y PODRA SATISFACER A SUS CLIENTES
SU META ES PONER OTRA CARNICERIA  EN ESE SETOR Y ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON FAPE POR QUE NUNCA  HAVIA TRABAJADO EN BANCOS COMUNALES HASTA AHORA Y  SU NEGOCIO A PROSPERADO CONSIDERABLEMENTE.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 54-year-old single mother who sells chicken and beef. She has 4 children, 3 of whom are grown, and the youngest is 13 and studies. She has been selling in her community for 9 years already. Her butcher shop is called "San Antonio". She works every day including weekends, and since there is no other butcher shop in the area she has many customers. She lives in a very calm neighbourhood. Her dream is to make her home larger and for her daughter to finish her studies. Vilma will use this loan to stock her business with more chicken and beef. She thinks that this investment in her business will help her to obtain better income and satisfy her customers. Her goal is to open another butcher chop in this area. She is very grateful to FAPE because until now she had not worked with a community bank and now that she is, her business has grown considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stock for butcher shop

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 42 años, es madre D. familia, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en casa D. su madre con su hija y nieta. Mónica se dedica diariamente a vender cartulinas, cuadernos, lápices, láminas en general. Procura siempre D. colocar en orden su material para que sean vistosos y sea fácil la venta. Su punto D. venta es en el interior D. un mercado, favoreciéndola ya que es muy concurrido, siendo los escolares sus principales clientes y demás vecinos D. su barrio. Actualmente su hija y su nieta trabajan con ella,  D. ese modo va D. compras para renovar sus productos. Se siente a gusto con su negocio. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y construir su propia casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que el crédito le será muy útil para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita incrementará útiles escolares, mercerías y demás accesorios D. belleza para abastecer su bazar librería.
texts.en:
Mónica, 42 is a very happy and hard-working mother. She lives in her mother's house with her daughter and granddaughter. Daily, Monica sells cards, notebooks, pens, and educational materials in general. She always tries to organize her merchandise so that it is eye-catching and easily sold. Her shop is in a market, which she favours because it is very busy. Schoolchildren and neighbours are her main customers. Currently, her daughter and granddaughter work with her which allows her to go shopping to replenish her stock. She is comfortable with her business. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to build her own home. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that the credit will be very useful for increasing her working capital, so she promises to repay all the quotas on time. With the requested loan she will increase her stock of school supplies, various items and beauty accessories to supply her school supplies shop.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies, goods and beauty products

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. Jesus;   él tiene 30 años de edad, él soscio titine 3 hijos de 6, 4, 1 y medio años de edad; es casado y él se dedica a prestar servicio de taxi, el socio es chofer y cubré todas las rutas dentro de la ciudad del Cusco; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas apara su auto.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jesus belongs to the Esmeralda community bank; he lives in the San Sebastian district, in the province and department of Cusco. He is 30 and has three little children ages 6, 4 and 1 1/2. He is married and offers a taxi service. He is a driver and covers all of the routes in the city of Cusco. He is requesting this loan to buy tires for his car. He values and appreciates this support and promises to repay the loan as planned.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tires

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio L., de 45 años de edad es casado y con su esposa habitan en el barrio Medardo Andino, su esposa labora en los mercados capitalinos comerciando mercadería, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar,  tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad, que trabajan y apoyan a sus padres a los gastos del hogar, la familia se dedica a la agricultura.

Uno de las principales necesidades y dificultades que se le ha presentado a lo largo de sus 6 años de experiencia en este campo, ha sido la falta de apoyo de las financieras para este rubro, él cosecha hortalizas pero a futuro espera diversificar sus cosechas por cultivos permanentes y rentables, pero primero desea realizar una inversión a su terrenos debido a que ha observado una disminución en la producción por la infección de plagas que amenazan  con las cosechas, es por esta precisa razón que ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, pesticidas, fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos que aporten a sus tierras un mantenimiento mas optimo para llevar a cabo sus proyectos, tras esto la posibilidad de mejorar sus ingresos económicos, sus condiciones de vida que favorezcan a toda la familia.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio Lopez, 45, is married and lives with his wife in the Medardo Andino neighbourhood. His wife works in the markets of the capital, selling merchandise to help with household costs.They have 4 grown children who work and help their parents with household costs. The family works in agriculture. One of the main needs and difficulties that has presented itself during their 6 years of experience in this field has been the lack of financial support for this area. Jose harvests vegetables, but in the future he hopes to diversify his harvests with permanent and profitable crops. But first, he wants to invest in his land because he has seen a decrease in production due to pests that threaten the crops. For this reason, they are requesting a loan to purchase agricultural materials, pesticides, fertilizers and vegetable supplies that will contribute to a more optimal maintenance for their projects. Through this loan they have the possibility of improving their earnings and living conditions for the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agricultural materials, pesticides, fertilizers and vegetable supplies

loans.name: G.s. Jehova E Mi Pastor No 2 Group

texts.es: La señora Luisa Emilia tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de diez años de edad y el otro de un año de edad. Ella se dedica a la distribución de cosméticos de manera ambulante. Ella solicita el crédito con el propósito de incrementar su capital de trabajo, además que desea variar un poco su inventario comprando además productos medicinales. Su otra amiga Cony Maria tiene 34 años de edad, La señora obtiene ingresos de la pulpería que tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, así deciden juntarse y conformar el grupo solidario Jehová Es Mi Pastor. Ambas necesitan el financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Luisa Emilia is 32, married and has 2 children ages 10 and 1. She sells cosmetics in a street market. She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital, and she also wants to add variety to her inventory through buying more medicinal products. Her other friend Cony Maria is 34 and obtains her income from a convenience store in her house. They decided to join together and form the communal bank "Jehova is my Shepherd". Together they need a loan to buy basic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de la Banc Villageois Kounkané depuis le 16 juillet 2002 et a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois et son nouveau crédit l'aidera à renforcer son activité. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Maïmouna D. is a 41 year old woman, married and the mother of 5 children in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois Kounkané since July 16 2002, and has received 15 consecutive loans with no re-payment issues. Since joining the Banc Villageois, she has been making and selling peanut paste, and her new loan will help her to increase this activity. She is helping her family improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capital

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es El Sr. Vidal;   él tiene 26 años de edad, El socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7, 4 años de edad, El socio es chofer y repartidor de agua, Nuestro socio trabaja dando este servicio de la distribución de agua a diferentes empresas en la ciudad del Cusco y en provincias, El socio necesita comprar una motobomba para mejorar su servicio. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una motobomba.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Vidal belongs to the Esmerelda community bank; he lives in the district of San Sebastian, in the province and department of Cusco. Vidal is 26, lives with his partner and has 3 children ages 9, 7, and 4. He is a driver and a water delivery man. He offers this water distribution service to various companies in the city of Cusco and the provinces. He needs to buy a pump to improve his service; he is requesting this loan to buy a pump. He values and appreciates this support exceedingly and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pump

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou B. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois  Sinthiang Houlata depuis le 12 septembre 2006 et a 7 fois bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle a construit à domicile un petit poulailler où elle élève des poulets de chaire et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter sa production en achetant plus de poussins afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et pouvoir mieux prendre en charge son enfant et faire face à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Kadiatou B. is a 29 year old woman. She is single and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois Sinthiang Houlata since September 12, 2006 and has been granted loans 7 times that she has always repaid without difficulty. She has built a small poultry house at home in which she raises table poultry. Her new loan will allow her to increase her production by purchasing more hatchlings in order to make more profits, enabling her to take better care of her child and meet her personal needs.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her production capacity of poultry

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: Ramona G. Barrón es madre y tiene dos hijos; una de ello es la que le apoya económicamente para el sustento familiar. La señora tiene una vivienda de interés social, pero su mayor preocupación de esta persona es cuando sale a trabajar y su casa no tiene ninguna protección es por ello que pide el apoyo para instalar las protecciones en las ventanas y así sus hijos también tengan una mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Ramona G. Barrón is a mother of two children; one helps her economically with family expenses. She lives in social housing; her main concern is that when she leaves for work her home has no protection. For this reason she is requesting a loan to install security features in the windows; this way, her children will have greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: security

loans.name: Adriana Cecilia

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es la madre de Adriana Cecilia.

La señora Adriana Cecilia vive en un ejido cerca de la ciudad, por lo que ella para ir trabajar se traslada a su trabajo en la ciudad todo los día para cubrir los gastos de su casa. Su mamá se queda al cuidado de sus tres nietos para apoyarla con el cuidado de ellos y así brindarles seguridad. Cecilia solicita a esta institución un préstamo para poder impermeabilizar su vivienda ya que en temporada de lluvia el agua se trasmina y el techo se va dañando poco a poco.
texts.en:
The person appearing in this photo is Adriana Cecilia's mother. Adriana Cecilia lives in a cooperative near the city, and so she travels to work in the city every day to cover her household costs. Her mother takes care of Adriana's three children to help Adriana and to provide them with security. She is requesting this loan to waterproof her home since during the rainy season the water leaks in and the roof is slowly becoming damaged.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproofing

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su padre en el distrito de Paiján una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope de la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada ados horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo Carmen e esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Adicionalmente trabaja por las mañanas vendiendo pasajes de una empresa de transporte que une las ciudades de Trujillo con Cajamarca y cuya ruta pasa por el distrito de Paiján, con estas actividades ella sustenta sus ingresos personales y ayuda a su padre en el sostenimiento de su hogar.

Carmen desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho de mantenerse activa, en la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30, single and lives with her father in the Paijan district, a zone belonging to the Ascope province in the La Libertad region, located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has sold beauty products and cosmetics through a catalogue for more than two years. She has a group of customers who buy her products frequently.
