When she fills more orders she obtains more points from the company which provide her products and better earnings. For this reason Carmen strives to get more and more customers. She works in the mornings selling tickets for a carrier that connects the cities of Trujillo and Cajamarca, whose route passes through the district Paiján. With these activities she obtains her personal income and helps her father with household costs. Carmen wants to have stable capital to acquire more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics to allow her customers to get what they need quickly and not have to wait until the end of the month, which is when she fills orders. For this reason she has requested a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to meet her goal. Carmen is a hard-working woman who loves being active. In her neighbourhood she is well-known and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén G. L. es una persona muy trabajadora, desde hace 7 años se dedica al transporte publico, en el que tiene un camión donde traslada a la gente a su lugar destinado. En este momento; el esta pidiendo el apoyo para poder arreglar su camión ya que se le descompuso del motor lo cual requiere capital para poder repararlo. El comenta que esta es su fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia el es padre de al cual quiere brindar a sus hijos una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rubén G. L. is a hardworking individual who has been providing transportation services for seven years. He has a bus that he uses to transport people to their destination. At the moment, he is requesting assistance so that he can repair his bus. The engine is broken and he needs capital in order to fix it. Rubén says this business is the source of income by which he supports his family. He is a father who wants to provide his children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for bus repairs

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German W. L. vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, y tiene 2 hijos mayores, uno de ellos en cantante en un grupo musical de la ciudad y su hija menor acude a la universidad. El señor German trabaja en la Empresa Nacional de Electricidad (ENDE) como topógrafo por más de 20 años. El señor German requiere el préstamo para la compra de una computadora que le ayudara con el manejo de su trabajo puesto que como él nos cuenta cada vez es más difícil por la manera como se actualiza y mejora la manera de hacer topografías.

El señor German nos cuenta que muchos sueños que tenia gracias a Dios ya se cumplieron pero que su próximo gran sueño es ver a sus hijos ser lo mejor que puedan y tengan un futuro exitoso, y poder estar algún día a lado de sus nietos.
texts.en:
Sr. German W. L. lives in the city of Cochabamba. He has two adult children, one is a singer for a musical group that performs in the city and his younger daughter attends the university. Sr. German has been working for the National Electricity Enterprise (ENDE) as a topographer for more than 20 years. He needs a loan to buy a computer to help him manage his work, since it has become increasingly more difficult to create and update topography maps.

Sr. German says he has many dreams and thanks God that many of them have already been fulfilled. However, his next greatest dream is to see his children become the best at what they do and have a successful future. One day he also hopes to have grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer for work

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David G. C. y su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa usada, artículos para el hogar y joyería de plata esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años. Esta pareja esta muy unida y se esfuerzan para poder brindar a su hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
Para poder seguir teniendo variedad en lo que venden ellos solicitan un crédito para comprar más mercancía y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
David G. C. and his wife have been selling secondhand clothing, household products, and silver jewelry for 12 years. This couple is extremely close and strives to provide their children a better quality of life.

In order to continue providing a variety of products to sell, David and his wife are requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that they can generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his business

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Graciela;   ella tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es soltera y se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa y accesorios, como carteras, correas, peluches entre otros, La socia viaja a Lima, Tacna y trae todo tipo de novedades en especial las ropas de temporada y peluches, también trae adornos para regalos, Nuestra socia tiene su stand en el centro plaza sur y viaja cada 15 días o mensual dependiendo como salga la mercadería; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor ropa ella viajará la quincena de junio para Lima,

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Communal Bank “Lideres del Tercer Milenio” (Leaders of the Third Millennium). She lives in the district of Huanchac in the city of Cusco.

Sra. Graciela is 44 years old and single. She sells clothing and accessories such as handbags, belts, plush toys, and other items. Graciela travels to Lima and Tacna and brings back all types of special novelties, seasonal clothing, and stuffed toys. In addition, she acquires ornaments that can be presented as gifts. Graciela has a stand in the south central plaza and travels every 15 days or on a monthly basis depending on how much merchandise she sells. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing for when she travels to Lima on June 15th.

Graciela appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena B. M. cuenta con un negocio de Abarrotes llamado “Mi tiendita Mili” con una antigüedad de 1 año. Este negocio ofrece abarrotes en general, refrescos, botanas, lácteos, galletas y más. Para poder seguir dando mejor servicio a su clintes ellos requieren de capital para poder tener mayor variedad en su negocio para incrementar las ventas y así ofrecer a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magdalena B. M. has been managing a grocery store called “Mi Tiendita Mili” for one year. In addition to groceries, her store sells soft drinks, snack foods, dairy products, cookies, and other items. Magdalena needs additional capital so that her business will have a greater variety of merchandise. This will allow her to continue offering good service, increase her sales, and provide her two children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Mariama Birame

texts.fr: Mariama Birame D. est une femme de 62 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 13 enfants dont seuls les 06 restent en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois SINTHIANG AÏDARA son inauguration le 23 janvier 2003 et y a bénéficié de 14 crédits qu'elle a toujours remboursé régulièrement. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus teintés et de téléphones portables. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama Birame D. is 62 years old, married and the mother of 13 children, of whom only six remain under her care. She has been a member of the SINTHIANG AÏDARA «Banc Villageois» loan group since its inception 23 January 2003 and was granted 14 successive loans, all regularly repaid in full. She runs a small business selling dyed clothing fabric and mobile telephones. This activity provides income enabling her to participate in the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Better develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Libertadores Group

texts.es:
“LIBERTADORES”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  10 socios entusiastas y luchadores, quienes tienen por afinidad realizar actividades D. comercio minorista, trabajan con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 8 meses.
Zenobia asume el cargo D. presidenta, a sus 41 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 7 y 14 años D. edad, quienes se encuentran en el colegio.
DesD. hace 13 años se dedica a L. venta D. salchipapas, el cual lleva por nombre “SALCHIPAPAS ZENOBIA”, se inicio en este negocio porque trabajo en un restaurante como azafata, luego 	quedo embarazada y perdió a su bebé, fue entonces que su esposo le dijo que se independizara y puso su pequeño negocio, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado mejorar su casa y apoyara en L. educación D. sus hijos, sus ingresos cubren el pago D. sus cuotas y servicios, poner un negocio en su vivienda es el gran sueño D. Zenobia,  el reciente préstamo será destinado a L. compra D. una carpa, sillas y mesas para su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado D. los inversionistas y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
“Libertadores” (Liberators) is a communal bank composed of 10 passionate and combative members, whose chosen business activity is similar (they are all retailers), and who have been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for 8 months Zenobia is the president. She is 41 years old, she is married and has 2 children aged 7 and 14 who go to school. Thirteen years ago she started selling salchipapas (sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries), known as “Salchipapas Zenobia”. Before she started this business she used to work in a restaurant as waitress; then she got pregnant but lost her baby, so her husband encouraged her to gain independence and to open her small shop. With the effort of her daily work she has succeeded in improving her house and in helping educating her two children, as her income covers the expenses of their enrollment fees and educational services. Zenobia’s big dream is to set a shop in her own house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy an awning, chairs and tables for her shop. All of our members are thankful for the support granted by the investors and they all commit to paying within the specified periods.

Translated from Spanish by EmanueL. VilL., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an awning, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama K. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 17 juillet 2006 et a bénéficié de 7 crédits qu'elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé à temps. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus teinté et de pâte d'arachide. une bonne partie de sa marchandise est vendu à la capitale (Dakar)Son objectif est de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Mariama K. is a 42 year-old married mother of four. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (credit association) since the 17th of July 2006 and has received 7 loans, all of which have been well-utilised and repaid. She runs a small dyed fabric and peanut-butter business, and sells a lot of her wares in the capital, Dakar. Her aim is to take care of her children's education and to see to her personal needs, as well as putting money aside as savings.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business funds

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José Luis es un padre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en casa de sus padres ubicada en el sector Santa Rosa Baja, una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar pasajeros y carga) con la que brinda servicio de transporte publico desde hace siete meses en el distrito de Cayaltí y en las zonas aledañas. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos y se vale de el para sustentar la economía de su familia.

El contínuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su vehículo empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

José Luis es una persona trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superación, su mayor anhelo es poder construir su propia casa para vivir junto a su familia de un modo mas estable.
texts.en:
José Luis is a 25 year old father who lives with his wife and child in the house of his parents, which is located in the Santa Rosa Baja division, a rural area in the district of Cayaltí. This agricultural district is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

José Luis owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for transporting passengers and cargo). He has been providing public transportation services for six months in the distirct of Cayaltí and the surrounding areas. This business is his only source of income by which he supports his family financially.

The continued use of his vehicle combined with the ragged state of the local roads has caused defects in his vehicle that require urgent repairs. To ensure that his vehicle functions properly, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

José Luis is a hardworking person who has tremendous desire to succeed. His greatest wish is to build his own house so that he and his family can live together in a more stable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs & maintenance

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Justina;   ella tiene 43 años de edad, es natural de la provincia de chumbivilcas la socia es conviviente ella estudio hasta el segundo grado de secundaria y por motivos económicos no pudo culminar la secundaria, La socia  tiene 1 hijo y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tienen un stand en el centro comercial el paraíso, ella vende radios, relojes, despertadores, accesorios de relojes y desea implementar su negocio comprando mayor diversidad de equipos. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con la compra de equipos diversos y accesorios para sus relojes.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is one of the members of the Banco Comunal “Lideres del Tercer Milenio” (“Leaders of the Third Millenium” Communal Bank). She lives in Cusco, in the Huanchac neighborhood. Her name is Justina. A native of the Chumbivilcas province, she is 43 years old and she lives with her partner. She attended school up to the second year of secondary school, but she could not finish her studies due to economic reasons. She has a son, and she alternates her housewife duties with her activity as a retailer. She has a stand in the “El Paraíso” shopping center, where she sells radios, watches, alarm clocks, spare parts for watches, and she wishes to increase her business by buying a wider variety of equipment. The loan she is requesting will be used to boost her business by buying different equipments and spare parts for her watches. She is thankful for and appreciates the help offered to her through this loan, and she commits to complying with repaying his debt within the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different equipments and spare parts for her watches.

loans.name: Angélique

texts.fr: Angélique G. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 005 aout 2003 et a 12 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé régulièrement. Elle est détentrice de réfrigérateur et fabrique de la glace et de la crème glacée, son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'augmenter sa production. Elle cherche à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et a assurer la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Angélique G. is a 52 year-old married mother of eight. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (credit association) since the 5th of August 2003, and has received 12 loans, all of which have been repaid. She owns a refrigerator and makes ice and ice-cream; her new loan will enable her to boost production. She is seeking to improve her living conditions and look after her children's health and schooling.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting business capital in order to develop business activities

loans.name: Jose Bldelomar

texts.es: El señor José tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad y viven aparte. Su esposa trabaja como comerciante en el mercado, que es donde trasladan las cosechas que venden. El señor José se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas, estas se las compra a las mismas personas del mercado, en su mayoría son cosechas de aguacate y cítricos, aunque a veces compra banano. El ya tiene 35 años de  dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual dio inicio primeramente con su papa que era poseedor de una pequeña finca. Por lo que él viajaba a Managua y a Masaya a vender las frutas al mercado. El señor desea invertir en la compra de cosecha de aguacate, ya que es el tiempo de de esta fruta. Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para trasladar el producto ya que actualmente tiene que transportar las cosechas a través de los buses.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 52 years old, married, and has two adult children who live apart from him. His wife works as a merchant at the farmer’s market. Sr. José buys and sells produce from the same people at the market. Avocados and citrus fruits are what he mostly trades, but sometimes he buys bananas. He has been in this business for 35 years and started when his father owned a small farm.

Sr. José travels to Managua and Masaya to sell his fruits at the market. He wants to invest in avocados since this is the season for this fruit. His dream is to purchase a vehicle for hauling his products since he currently has to travel with them on buses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase avocados to sell

loans.name: Enrrique Manuel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. Enrrique;   él tiene 53 años de edad, él socio es soltera y él es natural de la ciudad de Trujillo; Nuestro socio tienen 1 hijo y él se dedica a la venta de libros, Nuestro socio distribuye libros a diferentes librerías, también a domicilios, El socio viaja cada 6 meses a Lima a traer diversos libros y los vende en la ciudad del Cusco, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para viajar a la ciudad de Lima a surtirse de libros para traer a venderlos.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is one of the members of the Banco Comunal “Lideres del Tercer Milenio” (“Leaders of the Third Millenium” Communal Bank). He lives in Cusco, in the Huanchac neighborhood. His name is Enrrique. A native of Trujillo, he is 53 years old and single. He has a son and he sells books for a living. He sells books to different bookshops as well as door-to-door. He goes to Lima every 6 months to buy different books he then resells in Cusco. The loan he is requesting will be used for his trips to Lima to stock up on books to sell. He is thankful for and appreciates the help offered to him through this loan, and he commits to complying with repaying his debt within the specified time

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books to sell.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. Genaro;   él tiene 40 años de edad, El socio es soltera y es natural de la provincia de Acomayo, nuestro socio se dedica a la compra y venta de libros desde el año 2004, El socio compra libros de los proveedores mayores en la ciudad de Lima y los trae a Cusco para vender en las ferias de Tupac Amaru. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de libros y distribuirlos.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is one of the members of the Banco Comunal “Lideres del Tercer Milenio” (“Leaders of the Third Millenium” Communal Bank). He lives in Cusco, in the Huanchac neighborhood. His name is Genaro. A native of the Acomayo province, he is 40 years old and single. He has been buying and selling books since 2004: he buys books from the main suppliers in Lima and he brings them to Cusco to sell them in the fairs of the Tupac Amaru square. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a bigger quantity of books to sell. He is thankful for and appreciates the help offered to him through this loan, and he commits to complying with repaying his debt within the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more books to sell

loans.name: Leon

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. León;  él tiene 56 años de edad, El socio es soltero y se dedica a la compra y venta de libros en el distrito de Santiago, Nuestro socio tiene un stand en la feria de este distrito y hay vende libros, revistas y obras literarias, el socio viaja casi frecuentemente a la ciudad de Lima, pero generalmente le traen a su kiosko sus proveedores.  Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mayor número de libros y revistas.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is one of the members of the Banco Comunal “Lideres del Tercer Milenio” (“Leaders of the Third Millenium” Communal Bank). He lives in Cusco, in the Huanchac neighborhood. His name is León. He is 56 years old, he is single and he sells books for a living in the Santiago district. He has a stand in the local fair of this same district, where he sells books, magazines and literary works. He travels very often to Lima, but it’s his suppliers who generally bring him the books. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a higher number of books and magazines. He is thankful for and appreciates the help offered to him through this loan, and he commits to complying with repaying his debt within the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more books and magazines.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. Luis;   él tiene 32 años de edad, El socio es soltero, natural de Cay Cay; Nuestro socio  se dedica a la compra y venta de libros en la av. de la cultura a un costado de la universidad nacional, el socio viaja a la ciudad de Lima  a traer libros de todas las áreas, revistas, documentales y demás. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de libros y así incrementar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the communal bank “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO” (Leaders of the Third Millennium). He lives in the Huanchac District, city of Cusco. Our member is Mr. Luis. He is 32, single, and a native of Cay Cay. He buys and sells books on the Avenue of Culture on one side of the national university. He travels to Lima to bring books in all subjects, magazines, documentaries and more. Our member is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of books and thus increase his business and improve his quality of life. The member appreciates and values the support offered him through these loans and promises to complete the payments due in the established time schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his book business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr.Alberto;   él es natural de Sicuani,  tiene 55 años de edad, el socio es casado, El socio realiza como principal actividad la pasamanería, venta de (candados, romanas, tijeras, balanzas,) pero también él se dedica a otras actividades porque nuestro socio es todo un personaje, él está metido en todos los negocios que le generen dinero y lo mantengan ocupado, este socio peculiar los meses de enero, febrero y agosto prepara sahumerios, el en estas fechas los vende para las diferentes actividades religiosas de la zona; Él socio también es fotógrafo en ocasiones, él trabaja con el municipio de Huancarani chico en los diferentes eventos, ferias, desfiles, aniversarios y otros y se dedica a filmar, y sacar fotografías para luego venderlos; Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la pasamanería.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member is Alberto. He is a native of Sicuani, 55 years old and married. He main activity is making decorations and selling items like padlocks, scissors and scales, but he also does other activities because he is an important person. He is involved in all of the businesses that make money for him and keep him busy. During the months of January, February and August this member makes insense, which he sells during those months for different religious activities in the region. He is also sometimes a photographer. He works for the municipality of Huancarani at different events: fairs, parades, anniversaries and others, which he films and takes photos that are later sold. He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for making decorations. This member is grateful for and appreciates the support given to him and is committed to fulfil the repayment of his debt within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses deux enfants et ses deux petites filles. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 dont elle est la secrétaire depuis le 8 janvier 2004. Elle développe un petit poulailler dans une partie de la cours de sa maison et ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter sa production de poulets de chaire. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité contribuent à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa D. is 53 years old. She is divorced and lives with her two children and her two grand daughters. She is a member of the CENTRE2 Banc Villageois where she has been secretary since January 2004. Awa is developing a little chicken coop in her courtyard at home and this new loan enables her to increase her chicken production. The profits she makes from her activity contribute to an improved quality of life for her family.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her poultry business.

loans.name: Epinafio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. Epinafio;   él tiene 61 años de edad, él socio es casado con 2 hijos y se dedica al Turismo, Nuestro socio tiene una agencia de viajes y trabaja con su carro en el valle sagrado de los inkas, el hace servicio de transporte a los turistas que están de visita en la ciudad del Cusco y alrededores; Nuestro socio disfruta mucho intercambiar ideas con los pasajeros y el es un gran conocedor de la cultura Inka y de toda la ruta. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios, combustible, y darle mantenimiento a su carro.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the "Líderes del Tercer Milenio¨(Leaders of the Third Millenium) communal bank. He lives in the district of Huanchac, in the city of Cusco. Our member is Epinafio. He is 61 years old, married with 2 children and he works in tourism. He has a travel agency and works with his car in the Sacred Valley of the Incas. He provides transportation service to tourists who visit Cusco and the surrounding area. He enjoys exchanging ideas with his passengers and he is very knowledgeable about the Incan culture. He is requesting this loan to buy parts, fuel and for maintenance of his vehicle. He is thankful for and appreciates the support provided here and promises to fulfil the repayment of his debt within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. Juan Pablo;   él tiene 21 años de edad, El socio es soltero y se dedica a la confección de ropas de vestir de damas y caballeros, el socio trabaja en una empresa de corte y confección en el distrito de Cusco en San Agustin, el socio tiene un taller de corte y confección en San Borja Huanchac, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de costurera y renovar una máquina.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the "Líderes del Tercer Milenio" (Leaders of the Third Millenium) communal bank. He lives in the district of Huanchac, in the city of Cusco. Our member is Juan Pablo. He is 21 years old, single and works making clothing for men and women. He works in a company that makes clothing in the San Agustin district of Cusco and he has his dressmaking workshop in San Borja Huanchac. He is requesting a loan to buy sewing supplies and to refurbish a machine. He is grateful for and appreciates the support provided here and promises to fulfil the repayment of his debt within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing supplies and refurbish a machine

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. Jose Angel;   él tiene 41 años de edad, Él socio es conviviente y el trabaja en Turismo en el sector hotelero, Nuestro socio es auditor  y también está a cargo de la maquinaria del hotel, el resuelve todo lo concerniente a la electricidad y el manejo de las máquinas pesadas. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para reparar una maquinaria.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jose Angel belongs to the communal bank "Lideres del Tercer Milenio." He lives in the Huanchac district of the city of Cusco. Jose Angel is 41 years old, and lives with a partner. He works in tourism in the hotel sector. He is an auditor, and also is in charge of the hotel's physical plant. He resolves all issues regarding electricity and the handling of heavy machines. He is requesting a loan to repair a piece of machinery. He values and appreciates the support provided through these means, and he pledges to make the payments on his debt according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: he requests a loan to repair a machine

loans.name: Percy Wilfredo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. Percy;   él tiene 34 años de edad, El socio es soltera y se dedica al corte y confección de prendas de vestir para damas , caballeros y niños; el socio es natural de Puno y radica aquí en la ciudad del Cusco desde hace 6 años Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  maquinaria y materiales, porque tienen una este negocio en sociedad y ambos socios están poniendo sus máquinas para que esta empresa prospere,  Nuestro socio invertirá el dinero en la compra de una maquinaria de tejer y coser y algunos materiales.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the community bank "Leaders of the Third Millennium". Our member lives in the Huanchac district of the city of Cusco. Our member is Percy. He is 34 years old, single, and he works cutting and tailoring clothes for women, men, and children. He comes from Puno and has lived here in the city of Cusco for six years. Our member requests a loan to buy machinery and materials because he runs this business in partnership with another person and both partners are putting in machinery so that the company will prosper. Our member will invest the money in buying a knitting machine and a sewing machine and some material. The member appreciates and values the support offered to him in this way and he promises to complete the repayment of his debt in the set period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member will invest the money in buying a knitting machine, a sewing machine, and some material.

loans.name: Walter Miguel

texts.es:
El solicitante trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, vive en casa propia; tiene un ingreso semanal de S/. 240.00.
Vive con su conyugue y sus 2 menores hijos cuenta con buenas referencias de pago. El destino del credito es pa comra de mercaderia y mantenimiento de la mototaxi
texts.en:
Walter is a motorcycle taxi driver and earns a weekly income of 240 PEN. He lives in his own home with his wife and two young children. Walter has excellent references to vouch for his payment history.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise and pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi & buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make improvements to the infrastructure of her beauty shop

loans.name: Lourn

texts.en: Mrs. Lourn L., age 56, is a married woman and the mother of a child who is now married and lives independently. To earn a living, she sells cake and dessert and normally earns $1 per day. In addition, Lourn L. and her husband always take the time to cultivate a rice crop for their family to eat. This couple has spent a long time in this business and are very successful. The coming rainfall season is good for growing but Lourn L. does not have the money to hire a laborer to plow her farmland or to buy any supplies to use on her field. This is the reason she has decided to seek a loan through Kiva’s field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the farmland and to buy supplies

loans.name: Andres Alexander

texts.es: El solicitante cuenta con buenas referencias, cuenta con un mototaxi es soltero vive en la casa de su hermana quien es su aval solidario. El destino del credito es para mantenimiento y reparacion de su movilidad
texts.en:
Andres is a motorcycle taxi driver who comes with good references. He is single and lives in the home of his sister, who is acting as his co-signer. This loan will be used to pay for maintenance and repairs to his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance & repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Khourn

texts.en: In the photo is an older woman, T., who is married to Mr. Seth. T. earns a living by cultivating rice on her own land. She harvests the mature rice both for selling and eating in the family. Her husband works on the farm with her. T. now has a married child who has already started a new home. T. says that this is the business she has always done with great success. She requests a loan to plant a rice crop during the coming rainfall season. She intends to use some of the loan to raise a pig.

loans.use: To plant a rice crop and to raise a pig.

loans.name: Nally

texts.en:
For a simple woman like Nally M., happiness doesn’t have to be very expensive. Her life may be poor yet, being blessed with a very loving and supportive husband and children, any trials and problems she encounters in her everyday life seemed to be easy to overcome. She inspires her family to be content with what they have at the present and to work hard for anything else they feel is important to have. Nally believes that everything she dreams of for herself and family will eventually come true. 


With that approach, through her, her family enjoys the opportunity ASHI has given them. Loans she has been receiving have enabled them to start their own income generating activities. They were able to purchase a motorcycle and a second-hand sidecar for a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) which is for her husband’s transportation business. Nally also has her own salt buying and selling business. Large volumes of salt are sold in the market and during the town’s market day when may people and small entrepreneurs come from other municipalities to buy different commodities for personal consumption and business. Nally sells her salt wholesale.

Proceeds of Nally's and her husband’s businesses are the sole source of income for their family. As parents, they are also supporting the needs of their two children who are 19 and 24. Once Nally has the capability to open a saving fund, she will be motivating her children to go back to college as they are just high school graduates. Nally is hopeful that their businesses will become stable and profitable with the support of loans she can access. Presently, Nally’s two daughters are helping her in the business.

loans.use: To purchase a new sidecar and make a down payment on a new motorcycle used as transportation in her salt business

loans.name: Victor Edgar

texts.es: El solicitante se dedica al comercio de ropa por mas de 8 años en un local alquilado. Vive en una casa familiar de una tia, tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos estudia en la universidad y el otro vive con su madre en la ciudad de Nazca. El destino del credito es para incremento de capital
texts.en:
Victor has been selling clothing for more than eight years from a rented location. He lives at his aunt’s house. Victor has two children, one is studying at the university and the other lives with his mother in the city of Nazca. This loan will be used to increase his capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his operating capital

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Mrs. Teng R., 44, is a hard-working woman who tries to earn money by doing various jobs. She sells beef, pork and vegetables to people who live near her house. She also spends time ordering different kinds of fruit to resell to raise additional income. Teng R. is able to generate around $4 per day to cover her family's expenses. She is a widowed mother and is blessed with three children. Two of her children are no longer in school and work every day, while the other one is a student and is dependent on her. As her current business is very profitable, Teng R. has asked for a loan to sustain its growth.

loans.use: To sustain the growth of her business

loans.name: Seath

texts.en: Mrs. K. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photo here. K. is a domestic cultivator who owns a plot of farmland to grow crops to earn a living. Her husband is skilled in making wooden boats and is using this knowledge to earn money. He is hired by neighbors to make their  boats usable for fishing. Recently, he got many jobs from his clients but he lacks some implements required to perform his service. K. has requested a loan for her husband to buy accessories he uses to build boats.

loans.use: To buy accessories needed for boat building.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona G. is a 45-year-old, loving and caring mother, and a supportive wife to her husband, Lorenzo. Lorenzo is a fisherman and his business is Ramona’s source of income too. By selling the fish her husband catches from the ocean, Ramona has been able to generate cashflow for her family. She has four children aged from 3 to 11. She needs to support them and send them to school until they graduate from college. As well as a mother, she also has to be productive and partner her husband in growing and turning their livelihood activity into a stable business which can generate employment outside of family members. This would happen with the support of loans she can avail through ASHI. This is the main reason she joined in 2001.


Ramona has had a very poor kind of life since she was a child. With lots of oppression experienced because of poverty, she promised to herself that her children would not experience a bitter kind of life. When she joined ASHI and started to have her own way of earning money, and with the undying love and support of her husband, good and happy thoughts about life replaced the painful thoughts left by her childhood memories. 


Now, Ramona’s focus is to achieve her dream of growing her husband’s fishing business and her own fish-selling business. She is planning to purchase another fishing boat with this loan which will be managed by another person from their village. Her husband will still be managing their old fishing boat.  Once the volume of fish they produce increases,  she wants to sell fish wholesale to other municipalities and provinces. For now, she only sells her fish in the market. Despite that, her good personality has meant she has been able to acquire more customers.

loans.use: To purchase another fishing boat to expand their business.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
The smiling face shown in the photo is Mrs. S., age 28. S. became a farmer and has been doing this activity with great success since she was single, but now she is married with two young kids. Both of the kids are enrolled in primary school and are dependent on her income. S. has a life partner in her husband, who helps solve the family’s financial crisis by working as a building laborer. 

S. is taking out her first loan which she is using to purchase many piglets to raise in a stall she has built behind her house. S. is hopeful that the loan will allow her to have extra income to ensure that her family has a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase many piglets to raise

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chun P., 36, is a local farmer growing a rice crop. She is married with four school-aged kids, while her husband works on the farm with her.

Chun P. is happy to pursue a loan from Kiva in order to plant rice crops during the coming rainfall season which is a great time for cultivating.

loans.use: To plant rice crops

loans.name: Horm

texts.en:
Mrs. Horm L. was born into a farming family during the civil war and became a farmer, raising crops and pigs, when she was grown up. She is now married and blessed with three kids who attend school. Her husband assists her on the farm.

The coming rainfall season is a great time for cultivating a rice crop, but Horm L. doesn’t have any supplies to use on her field. Thus, she is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seed to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seed to grow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is a hardworking widowed woman who sells school supplies and direct-sells beauty products to earn a living. She uses the profit from her business to support the needs of her family. She has been in this business for more than ten years.

Victoria belongs to a group of active entrepreneurs of Dalig Center in Rizal West Branch (RWB). She appreciates that the organization has helped her improve her business and hence better her living standards. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Php to buy inventories of beauty products and more school supplies for her enterprise.

Victoria dreams of having a store in the shopping mall and the ability to buy more stock in the future for better output. She sees herself venturing into a full-fledged wholesale business in the next ten years.

With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Victoria is positive that the family business will continue to flourish, deliver stable profits, and support improvements in her family’s quality of life, moving them out of poverty.

Victoria’s long term goals are to maintain the productivity of her business and support the family’s other business: an auto repair shop in the local community. Victoria also dreams of a brighter tomorrow and a prosperous standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is a middle-aged woman whose husband is shown in the photo above. P. has two kids who are very young and not yet enrolled in school. Her husband is an ox-trader, buying animals to fatten for a while at their house. Then, he sells the animals to other people to earn a profit.

To pursue a daily revenue, P. owns a milling machine that she uses to provide a service to farmers for a fee. In addition, she buys rice in bulk to mill and sell. Mature rice commands a lowest price in this harvesting season, but she doesn’t have money to buy it for her stock. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to be used to buy rice in bulk to mill and sell.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to mill and sell

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chem K., 61, is a traditional cake producer. She makes cakes and sells to buyers who then take them to retail in the market. Also, she is hired by villagers to make the cake for their wedding parties or ceremonies.

Chem K. normally relies on the income from her husband’s job, working in the construction sector. The older couple has five children: three are married and two are single. Almost all of them are employed at different occupations.

Chem K. has a small piece of land where she hopes to raise crops for extra income, but she has no capital. For this reason, she is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and seed to begin planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed to begin planting

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella A. is from the village of District 3. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Bella owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Bella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia F. is from the village of Marcos. She is 57 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Leticia owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 2008, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her ninth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Mrs. Hay S. is an older woman and the mother of five children. Two are now married and already have their own homes, while the remaining three are single. She has a financial earner in her husband who has the skill of building stone houses. He currently works in a small firm located in Kompong Tom Province.

Hay S. built a large pig stall where she always raises a lot of hogs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this field since she was single so she has a lot of experience. Because her pig-raising trade is the main source of family income, she has obtained a loan to use as capital to buy pig feed and many piglets for her pigpen. With any remaining money from the loan, she will grow crops for additional income.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and many piglets for her stall

loans.name: Hy

texts.en:
Hy S., 53, is a professional seamstress in her village. She repairs or sews the clothes belonging to people who are her neighbors. Also, she buys small pieces of cloth in bulk from garment factories. She sews the cloth as sets of clothes or as furnishings to sell. She has a partner in her husband who cultivates rice crops. This couple is married and is blessed with five children: three are married and two are single.

Most Cambodian farmers normally farm rice when the rainy season comes. One of these people, Hy S.’s husband, wants to do this but he lacks supplies to use on his field. Hy S. is therefore applying for a loan for her husband use to grow rice crops.

loans.use: To grow rice crops

loans.name: Lourdez

texts.en: Lourdez F. is from the village of Marcos. She is 48 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Lourdez owns and operates a business providing recycling services, hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lourdez joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. Lourdez is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste and junk material to sell

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is a young woman and the mother of a lovely young child who is not yet school-aged. K. has a family contributor in her husband who works in the construction field around the community.

In order to earn a daily income, K. plants different types of vegetable crops on her own land that she inherited from her grandparent. She is able to grow the crop twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Because this annual farming business is a profitable one for family, K. requests a loan through Kiva to be used to hire a laborer to plow her farmland and then to buy seeds to grow and fertilizer.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her farmland and to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Chean

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 36 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she has established a small family home with other members. Her husband provides a little income to support the family’s living expenses by running a taxi service. The couple is blessed with two young kids who are enrolled in the local primary school.

C. built a workshop under her home where she sells inventory to people who live around the community. She sells rice and cooking ingredient both retail and wholesale.

C. wants to have a vehicle that she will use for her business activity but, although she tries to save her personal money, she has not managed the ability to buy one. To solve this problem, she decided to ask for a Kiva loan of $1,100 in order to purchase a new motorcycle so she can pick up inventory and travel to anywhere else.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for transporting inventory and other needs

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia T. is from the town of Albur. She is 53 years old and married to Francisco. Anastacia owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years now. In 2007, Anastacia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her eighth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng N. is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She and her husband buy and sell rubber for an income of USD 7.90 per day. N. also sells Cambodian noodles at home to generate extra income for the family.

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to buy more rubber to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more rubber to sell

loans.name: Peoung

texts.en:
Peoung N., 55, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. She and her husband sell seashells for an income of USD 5.9 per day.  

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to buy more seashells for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more seashells to resell

loans.name: Tavakal

texts.ru: Халимов Тавакал проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын работает и живет в России. Сам Тавакал имеет средне - специальное образование, "Сварщик". Работает по профессии. Он в основном изготавливает металлические двери на заказ. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа электрода.
texts.en:
Tavakal H. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 51 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. His son works and lives in Russia. Tavakal has specialized secondary education, he is a welder and is working in this field. He mainly makes custom metal doors. He has been in this business for fifteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy electrode.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrode

loans.name: Peoung

texts.en:
Peoung N., 57, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. She and her husband produce and sell palm sugar for an income of 6.7 USD  a day.  

N. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD  to buy firewood to produce more palm sugar. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. N.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: buy firewood to produce more palm sugar

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza C. is from the village of Marcos. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Eliza owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Eliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Eliza is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang K., 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. She sells used clothes for an income of USD 7.5 per day. Her husband is a security guard for a private company, earning an income of USD 11 per day.  

K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to buy a motorbike to transport her used clothing to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transport used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: M. Musa is thirty-seven years old. He is married with five school agedchildren. He owns a retail shop business selling essential goods. The retail shop is located alonga  highway in Lukaya Central. He is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, bread, cold drinks, millet flour and others items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, bread, cold drinks, millet flour and others items for resale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida L. is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Nylon Shell, Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish. Zenaida’s husband, Hernando, is a security guard and they have two children who are 19 and 32 years old. Their younger child is currently going to school and also helps in the business as part of its daily chores while their older child has work elsewhere. Zenaida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fish vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of P13,000 from her business activities. Zenaida is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of P12,000 was used to fund operations of her fish-vending business and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing P15,000 for her 18th loan which she intends to use in her fish-vending business. Zenaida is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Chean

texts.en:
Chean S., 43, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean Temples. She and her husband sell bread and ice-cream for an income of USD 7.5 per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work in the town. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Jaquilyn

texts.en: Jaquilyn M. is from the village of San Jose. She is 22 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Jaquilyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Jaquilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jaquilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Lours

texts.en:
Lours R., 34, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. She sells groceries, meat, and vegetables for an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, and he also helps his wife to sell fish, earning an income of USD 5 per day. R.'s husband appears in the photograph.

R. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to buy piglets to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rong

texts.en:
Rong N., 53, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. She is a housewife while her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day.

N. is requesting a loan of USD 350 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to raise some pigs at home. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Bel

texts.en:
Bel S., 46, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice for an income of USD 1 each per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to open a garage to repair motorbikes at her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Judy's Group

texts.en:
Judy S. is from the village of Taguntungan, Baggao, Cagayan. He is 39 years old and is the group leader of this thirteen-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Judy is married and has two young aged children. He owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Judy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI.

Judy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his third from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo K., 30, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed as a garment factory worker for an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day.

K. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to repair her house. In the future, she would like her husband to be a construction foreman for small or medium projects. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn V., 38, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. She produces rice wine and raises pigs for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband operates his truck to transport workers from the factory, earning an income of USD 8 per day.

V. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more piglets to raise and sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s education. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Khul

texts.en: Mrs. Khul P. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears in the photo above. Khul P. earns a living by cultivating rice on her own land. She harvests the mature rice both for selling and for her family to eat. Her husband works along the river as a fisherman. Khul P. now has three kids who go to school every day. Khul P. says that this is the business she has always done with great success. She requests a loan to plant a rice crop during the coming rainfall season.

loans.use: To plant a rice crop.

loans.name: Dok

texts.en: Dok K., 40, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is a housewife while her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 7 per day.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase pigs to raise for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Theam

texts.en: Theam C., 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is employed as a garment factory worker for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a broom seller, earning an income of USD 3 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike to transport brooms to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport brooms to sell.

loans.name: Tourn

texts.en: Tourn C., 44, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She produces brooms to sell for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her husband’s business.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Karn

texts.en: Karn R., 36, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She produces rice wine and raises pigs for an income of USD 1.6 per day. Her husband is employed to produce cement tables and chairs, earning an income of USD 4.6 per day.  R. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more rice to produce rice wine. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy rice to produce rice wine

loans.name: Derng

texts.en: Mrs. S., age 44, is a married woman and the mother of four kids who are attending school. To earn a living, S. and her husband cultivate various crops for profit. This couple has spent a long time in the farming business and are very successful. The coming rainfall season is good for growing but they do not have the money to hire a laborer to plow the farmland or to buy any supplies to use on the field. This is the reason she has decided to seek a loan through Kiva’s field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the farmland and to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van V., 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She produces traditional baskets to sell for an income of about $3.30 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about $4 per day.  V. is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase more baskets for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more baskets for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang R., 59, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She grows vegetables to sell for an income of approximately $1 per day. Her husband sells coconut juice, earning an income of about $3.30 per day.  R. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike to transport coconuts to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transport coconuts to sell

loans.name: Bourn

texts.en: Bourn K., 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is employed as a garment factory worker for an income of about $2 per day. Her husband is a farmer and tuk-tuk driver (a motorcycle with a passenger trailer), earning an income of around $3 per day.  K. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a trailer to attach to their mechanical plow. By doing so, they will be able to transport fertilizer and other materials to their rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a trailer to attach to their mechanical plow

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say P., 55, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She grows rice for an income of about $1 per day. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning an income of around $2 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work at the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: HU. U., 52, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is a deputy village chief and earns an income of $0.50 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about $3 per day.  U. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase musical instruments to rent when there is any special ceremony in the village. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy musical instruments to rent in the village

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
Ngư Trần Thị, age 51, lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong-tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Ngư is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đông Mai nhóm 07 (Nhóm 07).
  
Ngư is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Ngư makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Ngư has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

Ngư joined SEDA to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be the first loan she has taken out from SEDA.  Ngư plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

Tạ Thị Bé is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,840.000,VND loan to support her furniture making business.
