“San Miguel” is a group of ten women who attend their meetings at the Panamericana Community Center. This is their first loan cycle. They formed a group because they need to improve and expand their businesses, as well as access a loan that could benefit all of them. Martha C. is 26 years old, married, and a resident of the city of El Alto. She has lived in the San Ancelmo district for three months. Martha has a craft business in which she produces and sells different types of woven garments. After she completes her products, she sells them in the city of La Paz at La Garita from Monday to Sunday. Martha has been doing this for three years and needs a loan to buy merchandise. The other members have different businesses such as weaving blankets, selling clothes, providing construction services, operating a neighborhood store, managing a bookstore, and other activities. They all need a loan to improve their businesses. There are 11 (rather than 10) people in the photo because one of the women is the relative of a group member.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materals for producing woven garments

loans.name: Soulayman

texts.en:
Soulayman is a 33 year old married man living in Lebanon with his wife and their child. He has owned a restaurant in his town since 1998. He serves all types of sandwiches. Soulayman is well known in his region for his delicious food. He opened his restaurant because he wanted to have independent work and because he had experience in this domain.  Soulayman is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase merchandise to improve his restaurant. He wants to offer  narguileh (also known as “shisha” in Egypt, or Hubble bubble). Narguileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. A narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe, and other countries. Soulayman also wants to purchase new chairs so that his clients can feel more comfortable, as well as do some maintenance work in his restaurant.
Soulayman's clients are his friends and neighbors. He says that he is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is very welcoming. This is the first time Soulayman has requested a loan. He hopes to improve his business by attracting more clients.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to improve his restaurant.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza M.  is 47 years old and is married with a husband who is a retired soldier. She has 7 children and two of her children go to school.  Tereza is currently in the business of selling maize, sorghum and millet at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour and onions to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, Tereza hopes to be able to build a shop for her goods.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of maize flour and onions to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 23 year old single man from Lebanon.  Since 2007, he has been working in the construction industry. He specializes in installing and repairing tiles, as well as polishing them. This type of business is very common in Lebanon. Ibrahim is known for his good work and is proud of his experience. He is able to serve several clients at the same time.  His clients can be anyone from his region and its surroundings. His challenge is the competition since it is a demanding work. When he first started, Ibrahim had difficulty making himself known to the public, but through his determination and hard work, he was able to build a network of clients. Ibrahim is requesting from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, a loan to purchase a new tile polishing machine. He hopes to continue to grow and enhance his business in the coming year. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new tile polishing machine.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 20 year old single man  from Lebanon. He's owned a phone mobile shop in his town since 2009. He buys all models of mobile phones in addition to buying rechargeable cards. He also sells phone accessories. 
 Hassan is asking for a loan to change the décor of his shop and improve his showcases. He hopes that these changes will improve his sales and attract more clients so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.fr:
Jean Marie Vianney U. est née à Kichikiro, un quartier de Kigali, la capitale de Rwanda. Il est âgé de 26 ans, et il est célibataire, alors il vit avec ses parents à Kicukiro actuellement. Il a complète son cinquième année des études primaires. Client d'ACB depuis 2007, il a déjà pris et remboursé plus que 10 prêts. 

Il travail pour une entreprise de construction en tant que jardinier. Il a une expérience de 7 ans dans son boulot. Homme très sérieux, il a fait des épargnes avec son petit salaire, ce qui lui a permis de construire une maison qu’il loue pour ajouter à son salaire. 

Actuellement, il prend un prêt de 320,000 Francs Rwandais (FRW) pour embellir la maison en achetant su ciment et du sable pour protéger la ceinture de sa maison contre les eaux de la pluie. Il a acheté aussi des planches triplex pour construire le plafond de la maison. En plus, il a acheté des câbles de l’électricité et il a payé les frais d’installation pour mettre le courant dans la maison, qui n’avait pas de courant auparavant. Tout ces améliorations rendent la maison plus valable, ce qui lui permettra de recevoir plus en tant que loyer.

Dans l’avenir, il veut continuer à clôturer sa maison pour le rendre d’autant plus rentable. Avec les épargnes plus importants qu’il pourra faire avec le loyer et le boulot, il veut un jour s’installer dans la campagne en tant qu’éleveur de vaches. Il veut aussi se marier quand ses moyens lui permettent de soutenir une famille.
texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney U. was born in Kicukiro, a neighborhood of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. He is 26 and single, and so he presently lives with his parents in Kicukiro. He finished his studies up to 5th grade (primary school). He has been a client of ACB since 2007 and has already taken out and reimbursed more than 10 loans. He works for a construction company as a gardener and has an experience of 7 years in this work. A very serious young man, he puts aside savings out of his little salary, which have permitted him to build a house that he rents out for additional income. Right now, he is requesting a loan of 320,000 Rwandan Francs (FRW) to embellish the house by buying cement and sand to protect the outside of the house from rainwater. He has also bought plyboard to build a ceiling for the house. Moreover, he has bought electric wire and paid for installing electricity in the house, which did not have electricity before. All these improvements make the house worth more so that he can get more in rent. In the future, he intends to continue constructing a wall around it so it will bring in even more. With the additional savings that he will be able to put aside between the rent and his salary, he hopes to be able to set himself up in the country, one of these days, and raise cattle. He also wants to marry when his means permit him to support a family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying wire, boards, and cement to improve his rental house

loans.name: Goodwork Group

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

Paulina  N., age 37, is married with three children ages, 13,10 and 7 years.  She also cares for her 18 year old younger sister  who is studying in secondary school.  Paulina sells water to big trucks and home users and also has had a Gange Duka (swahili meaning selling sugar, salt, beans, wheat flour, rice  and vegetable and fruits in the same shop) for two years now.  She works from 8am to 8pm and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $286.

This will be Paulina’s 3rd Motisha loan, the loan which is given to clients who are good payers, from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a water tank of 2000lts and to increase the stock of the Genge Duka. She has paid back the loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase  the water stock.

Paulina will share this loan with her loan group Goodwoork, which totals 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture,  Paulin is 4th from right in the back row, wearing a pink shirt.

loans.use: To increase water stock by pumping more water in the water tanks

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en: Khoder is a 36 year old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and their two children. He has 10 years experience in food and home products sales. He is proud of the high quality of his work. He believes that his honesty and experience working in this field has helped him distinguish himself. His customers are people from his region. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to improve his income by purchasing more merchandise. When he first started his business, Khoder didn’t use to lot of income to diversify his merchandise. This will be his second loan. His previous loan allowed him to diversify his merchandise. He hopes to continue improve his business in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Firyal

texts.en: Firyal has been selling shoes and bags for a year now. She is a 38 year old single woman. Firyal is always trying  improve her shop with the latest collections to attract more clients. She is asking for a loan to purchase the new summer collection of shoes and bags for her shop in order to attract more clients and increase her income. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and also tourists visiting the region. When she first started, Firyal didn't have enough cash to purchase and offer a wide variety of products. However, now she is hoping that the loan will help her expand her stock and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and handbags for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 24-year-old hardworking business lady who sells used clothing. She has done this business for three years and hopes to open another boutique in the future. Esther is the mother of two children and she works hard to meet her family’s needs. Her husband is employed and also supports her financially by paying the school fees for their child in school.

Esther belongs to a group under Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each others loans. She joined this group to access a loan from Faulu Kenya. Through the group, she has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes for men, women and children.

loans.use: To buy men's, women's and children's clothes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife. He has been running a home painting business since 2004. His clients have been people from his region and its surroundings. Ali says that he is committed to his work and proud of his experience. He says that cash has been a challenge to purchase the needed tools and paint for his business. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, A. Majmoua. He plans to purchase a car for his business that will help him travel to his clients. He hopes to further expand his business in the future by opening a home painting company.

loans.use: To purchase tools and paint for his business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 50 years old. She is married and has six children. Her youngest child is 8 years old and the eldest is 28 years old.

Beatrice has different businesses so that she can have a steady income. She sells charcoal and tomatoes on the roadside and she has a store with different foods, such as rice and sorghum. She has become well known for selling these items.  Her husband helps her with the business in addition to rearing cattle. 

Beatrice’s dream is to have a sorghum store and a bigger cattle kraal (corral) with her husband.  With this loan, Beatrice wishes to buy a few sacks of cement to sell. With the profits, she wishes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Nyabuhikye Development Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
45-year-old K. Irene is happily married with three children. She has been selling clothes for the last twenty years in Nyabuhikye in Ibanda district. Twenty years down the road, she is still going strong in her business and this is all down to her hard work, diligence and dedication. 200,000 shillings is what she makes in a month.

This longevity speaks volumes about her chances at future success. With this loan, she is looking at buying more clothes that she will eventually resell to her increasing clientele.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 40 years old and married. He is employed in an advocate firm and he runs a cafeteria. Because of his busy schedule, his wife assists him together with three other employees. His business is located in a busy area; hence, he gets many customers. 

Boniface is in a group called Vision in Faulu Kenya whose aim is to save money, share business ideas and guarantee each others loans. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chairs and tables for his cafeteria. He hopes to open another cafeteria to meet his customers' high demands.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer  is married with three children, all of them are in school. She has sold charcoal for four years to people in Kisaasi on a retail basis. Jenifer buys charcoal from villages of Luwero using public transportation. Her greatest challenge is transporting her charcoal from Luwero villages to her store in  Kisaasi. She works seven days a week and depends on this job to make a living with no other source of livelihood.  She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow and to renovate his cow shed

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.fr:
Yvonne U.  est née à Kirundo au Burundi avec ses parents Rwandais, qui s’étaient refugié là-bas pendant la guerre civil de 1959. Elle a 29 ans et sa famille est rentrée dans leurs pays originaire en 1995. Elle avait dans ce temps là 13 ans, elle a sa mère car son père est déjà mort en 2000. Elle a un diplôme de niveau secondaire en comptabilité.

Elle travaille dans une entreprise de construction  comme aide comptable, et elle a une expérience de 3 ans sur ce poste. 

Elle épargne  chez Amasezerano depuis 2009, et elle sollicite maintenant son premier prêt avec un bût de payer le minerval pour sa deuxième année académique, comme elle compte obtenir son licence en management. Elle prend un prêt de 400000 Francs Rwandais. 

Elle veut prendre courage et bien étudier pour la réussite dans ses études et continuer à la troisième année de ses études. Avec ses épargnes, elle pourra dans le proche avenir entreprendre soit un mini-supermarché, soit un petit bureau de  change.

À la longue, ses ambitions sont de devenir une grande économiste de son pays. Si elle devient grand économiste et obtient un bon boulot, elle pourra financer sa famille dans tous les aspects de la vie.
texts.en:
Yvonne U. was born in Kirundo, Burundi, of Rwandan parents who had sought refuge in Burundi during the civil war of 1959. She is 29 and her family came back to their homeland in 1995. At that time she was 13. She now has only her mother since her father died in 2000. She has a secondary school diploma in accounting. Yvonne works in a construction firm as a bookkeeper, and she has three years' experience in this job. She has been putting aside savings with Amasezerano since 2009, and she is now requesting her first loan with the intention of paying the fees for her second academic year, since she would like to get a Bachelor's degree in management. She is taking out a loan of 400000 Francs Rwandais (Rwandan Francs). Yvonne wants to work hard and diligently so that she will succeed in her studies and be able to continue with her third year. With her savings, she will soon be able to open a mini-mart or a little currency exchange booth. In the long run, her ambition is to become a well-known economist in her country. If she can do that and can find a job, she will be able to support her family in all regards.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: pay the fees for her university courses

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is married with five children. She operates a retail shop and has been in this business for four years and has three employees. In addition, she earns a living from her rental houses. She uses her income to pay school fees for her children and also to pay wages to her employees. She has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 through a group in Faulu Kenya to buy sugar, mobile phone credit cards, and maize flour. She hopes to own a mini-supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, mobile phone credit cards, and maize flour

loans.name: Benedictor

texts.en: Benedictor is a happily married woman with one child who attends school and a husband who works with the Kenya Ports Authority. She has been operating her tailoring business for five years to add to her husband's salary. With the Ksh 40,000 she would like to buy clothing materials and sewing equipment. She faces seasonality as a major challenge. Benedictor hopes some day to have a big industrial unit of tailoring. She decided to join Yehu to acquire a loan to help her modify her business. She rents a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest expenses are food and a school fees.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials and sewing equipment.

loans.name: Hermencia

texts.es:
Hermencia B. A. vive en el Municipio de Soledad departamento del Atlántico,  cuenta  ella que llegó con su esposo  y sus 3  hermosas hijas, procedente de la ciudad de Cali, ubicado en el departamento de Valle del Cauca y aunque inició su negocio en Bucaramanga, encontró en esta zona del caribe, mejores oportunidades productivas, por eso es en este lugar donde montó  su microempresa, que ofrece servicios de diseño grafico de los accesorios de lujos que usan los vehículos como motos, carros y hasta bicicletas. Este es un negocio familiar en el que trabajan  Hermencia, su esposo y dos ayudantes,  allí en una maquina plotter hacen impresiones digitales de gran formato que estampan y convierten en lujosos accesorios para vehículos; así es como elaboran la publicidad, que aplican a cascos, retrovisores, chalecos que adornan cualquier vehiculo o accesorio que utilice su conductor. Herminia  también comercializa, cascos, chalecos, a los que aplica sus lujosos diseños a la medida del cliente, siempre que este lo solicite. Ella está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por un valor de $2.000.000 COP, que invertirá en materias primas, tales como reflectivos, letras,  agujas de plotter y en la compra  cascos y chalecos  para la venta.

Su máximo sueño compartido con su esposo Israel, es lograr el crecimiento de su negocio para poder brindarles a sus hijas  una educación de calidad  en el futuro. Siempre ha estado rodeada de desafíos pues ha tenido que cambiar 2 veces de ciudad y adaptarse a las costumbres de cada región, pero hace tres años encontró estabilidad con este negocio en la Costa Caribe Colombiana.
texts.en:
Hermencia B. A. lives in the town of Soledad, Atlántico department. She relates that she came with her husband and 3 beautiful daughters from the city of Cali, located in the Valle del Cauca department. Although she began her business in Bucaramanga, she found better opprtunities in this area of the Carribbean and that is why she set up her micro-business here. She offers graphic design for luxury accessories used in vehicles such as motorcycles, cars and even bicycles. This is a family business in which Hermencia, her husband, and two assistants work. In a plotter machine they make digital impressions in a grand format which with they stamp and make luxury accessories for vehicles. They make logos in this way that can be applied to helmets, rearview mirrors, and vests that adorn any vehicle or accessory used by a driver. Hermencia also sells helmets, and vests to which she applies her luxury designes to the clients order. She is applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the amount of $2.000.000 COP. She will invest in raw materials such as reflectors, letters and plotter needles and in buying helmets and vests to sell. Her greatest dream, shared by her husband Israel, is to grow their business to be able to offer their daughters a quality education in the future. She has always been surrounded by challenges. She had to change cities twice and adapt to the customs of each region. Three years ago, she found stability with this business in the Carribean coast of Colombia.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials, such as reflectors, letters and plotter needles and to purchase helmets and vests to sell.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina trabaja como educadora en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz; esta es su única fuente de ingresos que tiene.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Mallasilla  de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa de su tía.
El crédito será destinado para educación (trámites y pago de docente, para titulo de licenciatura en ciencias de la educación).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  y con este crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yanina works as an educator in the Alto Obrajes area of the city of La Paz. This is the only source of income that she has. Her address is located in the Mallasilla area of the city of La Paz, in her aunt's house. This loan will be used for education (processing and staff payment for the BA degree in Educational Science). This is the first time that she has asked for a loan from Impro, and she can improve her income and quality of life with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The cost of the processing to obtain her degree in Communication Science.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Desde antes de cumplir la mayoría de edad Julio Cesar L.  sabia  ya de negocios, pues en su familia no hay uno de la familia que no trabaje en ello, asì su mamá tiene un salón de belleza, su padre vende mercancías y lo mismo sus hermanas y tias;  Julio Cesar en un  principio ayudaba a su madre en todo los negocios que tuvo, pero ahora montó el suyo propio : un servicio de llamadas telefónicas el cual ubicó  justo a la salida del local donde su madre  tiene su salón de belleza, en una de las vías más transitadas de barrio simón Bolívar al sur de Barranquilla;  con su negocio no depende de su madre, paga la mensualidad de sus estudios como auxiliar de servicios farmacéuticos  y puede hacer una vida socia con su novia sana y placentera,  sin convertirse en una carga económica para la familia.

En este año ha recibido de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo 2 préstamos,  en este último ha solicitado un monto de $ 1.300.000 COP, que lo invertirá en modernizar  equipos de celulares y dotar su negocio de carcazas protectores y accesorios para la venta. Su sueño agregar a este su propia droguería, porque en 6 meses será un auxiliar de servicios farmacéuticos y con eso  terminará de cumplir  con todos los requisitos legales para hacerlo, por eso se esfuerza como un estudiante trabajador  para poder cumplir su sueño.

Su gran desafío es hacer unas prácticas profesionales de excelencia y responderle  a su familia por todo el apoyo que le brindan su madre, su hermana y su tía en su negocio, especialmente cuando debe ausentarse por efecto de sus estudios. Julio Cesar es un joven  que a sus 21 años tiene mucha madurez y es un excelente miembro de familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar L. knew about business since before he became an adult, since there is not one person in his family who doesn’t work. His mother has a beauty salon, his father sells merchandise, as do his sisters and aunts. At first, Julio Cesar helped his mother with all her businesses. However, he now has his own enterprise: a phone call service that he located on a street near his mother’s beauty salon entrance. It is in the busy Simón Bolívar neighborhood, just south of Barranquilla. His business allows him to pay for his own expenses to become a pharmacist, and not have to depend on his mother for his education. This affords him the opportunity to live a healthy and pleasant social life with his girlfriend, without being a financial burden on his family. This year, he has received 2 loans from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Currently, he is requesting 1,300,000 Colombian pesos to invest in modernizing his cellular equipment and to supply his business with phone covers and other supplies to sell. His dream is to also have his own pharmacy, since in 6 months he will have attained all the legal requirements to be a pharmacist. For these reasons, he puts forth a great effort as a hard-working student to complete his goal. His great challenge is to practice excellent professionalism, so that he can return all the support that his family has provided. His mother, sister and aunt have especially helped him out, particularly when he’s had to be absent in order to complete his studies. Julio Cesar is a 21-year old young man who is very mature and an excellent member of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phone equipment, and to supply his business with phone covers and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Adelia Carina

texts.es:
La señora Adelia Carina Fernández  M.,  tiene 36  años de edad, recientemente se caso con Sergio David Sánchez juntos a su hijo viven en la comunidad de mayra provincia de mizque del departamento de Cochabamba,   Adelia y su esposo se dedican a trabajan hace mas de 18 años en la agricultura lo que más producen es cebolla y zanahoria.

Junto a su esposo la señora Adelia  lograron comprar un lote y desean construir una casita, la señora Adelia  es muy querida y respetada en el pueblo de mizque, por lo dedicada a su familia y su trabajo ella está solicitando el crédito para poder comprar más insumos para  dedicarse más a la agricultura y aumentar su producciones y cumplir su sueño de tener su propia casa.  El crédito ayudara a alcanzar más rápido el sueño de  doña Adela.
texts.en:
Adelia Carina Fernández M. is 36 years old, and recently married Sergio David Sánchez. Together with their son, they live in the Mayra community, located in the Mizque province of Cochabamba. For more than 18 years, Adelia and her husband have dedicated themselves to farming. Their largest crops are onions and carrots. Adelia and her husband managed to buy a plot of land where they wish to build a little house. Adelia is very loved and respected in the town of Mizque, for her dedication to family and work. She is requesting a loan to buy more farming supplies, to increase her production, and to fulfill her wish of having her own home. This loan will help Adelia accomplish this dream.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Dany Teodoro

texts.es: El solicitante es casado, vive en casa de su madre con cual comparte gastos familiares. Cuenta con una movilidad que brinda el servicio de taxi; su esposa vende productos de belleza Avon. El destino del credito es para cambio de motor y arreglos de su movilidad.
texts.en:
This applicant is married and lives with his mother, with whom he shares the household expenses, in her house. He has the use of a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services. His wife sells Avon beauty products. The loan would be destined to replace an engine and make repairs to his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs for his vehicle.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Javier Antonio V. G., es un joven casado de 25 años de edad que vive con su familia en Veracruz, su esposa trabaja como cajera en un restaurante  y con sus ingresos apoya a  su marido en los gastos del hogar, él así mismo labora como cajero también pero en otro restaurante.

Ellos son una familia muy humilde que con sus bajos recursos económicos no le permiten, comprar los materiales de construcción necesarios para la edificación de un muro que brinde seguridad y protección de las fuertes lluvias y vientos que amenazan en estos mesesde invierno, espera se les brinde un apoyo para mejorar sus niveles y condiciones de vida y a futuro pensar en engendrar hijos o sebrellevar otros proyectos que se tienen trazados para su bienenstar familiar.
texts.en:
Javier Antonio V. G. is 25-years old, married, and lives with his family in Veracruz. His wife works as a cashier at a restaurant, and her income helps him meet the family’s living expenses. He also works as a cashier, but at a different restaurant. They are a humble family who does not have the necessary means to pay for the construction of a wall. This addition to their house would help provide added security, as well as protection from the strong rain and wind that threaten the area during the winter months. They hope to receive some support to improve their living conditions, and their future plans to have children or take on other projects that they have planned for the benefit of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the construction of a wall.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Doña Martha de edad de 40 años, por muchos años se ha dedicado  a su negocio una pequeña pulpería, el cual vende medio tiempo ya que trabaja para los pipitos, con el objetivo de obtener mas dinero para poder cubrir los gastos, ya que su esposo trabaja como conductor con un salario bajo.  Madre de un hijo el cual estudia.

Su casa es de concreto pero a un falta repellar las paredes, el cual hará mas después lo que le urge es poder hacer un sumidero y comprar un inodoro ya que las aguas negras no pasan por el barrio,  para poder lograr una mejor higiene para su familia ya que lo que tiene es una letrina de muchos años de uso. Para esto comprara materiales como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, madera.  Para hacer el local del inodoro, como comprar el inodoro nuevo y poder beneficiarse de esta mejora
texts.en:
Martha is 40 years old and has dedicated herself for many years to her business, a small grocery store. She sells part-time since she works for the children, and has the objective of earning more income to cover financial expenses. Her husband works as a driver, but his salary is low. She is the mother of a school-aged child. Her house is made of concrete, but the walls still need to be plastered. She plans to take care of this later, since she has the more urgent need to install a drain and toilet since the sewer line does not pass through her neighborhood. This would provide better hygiene for the family, as they currently have a latrine that has been in use for many years. For this project, she would purchase materials such as: cinderblocks, sand, cement, steel, zinc and lumber. This would allow her to build the location for the toilet, to purchase a new toilet, and to benefit from this home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as: cinderblocks, sand, cement, and steel to build a drain and purchase a toilet for better hygiene.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
Don José es padre de familia de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 44 años, desde hace varios años trabaja con un taxi de su propiedad, pues ha sido su medio de trabajo para ayudar a sus hijos. Su esposa también le ayuda ya que con ahorro logro afiliarse con la Avon en donde vende una variedad de productos.
El señor José trabaja en turnos, las dificultades que se le presentan es el aumento de la gasolina cada día, y los pasajeros desean la carrera baja, lo que disminuye es la clientela que hay día que solo saca para la gasolina. A si como otros días buenos.
Mediante estos préstamos ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa, el cual cambiara techo ya que esta pasándosele el agua en esta época de invierno.
Es por eso comprara zinc, perlines para comenzar hacer la obra.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old and is the father of three children. He’s been driving his own taxi for several years and this has been the source of income with which he supports his children. His wife also helps by selling Avon products. José works in shifts. His biggest challenge is the daily increase in fuel prices, while his passengers expect to continue to pay low prices. On some days he only manages to bring in enough to cover fuel costs, but he has some good days as well. He’s been able to make improvements to his home through these loans. He will install a new roof, now that the current one has been leaking this winter. He is buying zinc metal sheeting in order to begin the job.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New roof

loans.name: Jazmina Soledad

texts.es:
Jazmina es una joven de 31 años de edad,  madre soltera de dos hijos, para ella no ha sido fácil, ya que ha tenido que trabajar mucho para poder sobresalir adelante, cuenta con el apoyo de su mama que para ella ha sido  mas que suficiente.
Desde hace varios años trabaja en gestor telefónico,  anteriormente entro de recepcionista para la empresa, y por su buen desempeño la han promovido.
Contenta ya que en este nuevo desempeño tiene mejores beneficios económicos, y se ayuda más ya que la vida esta difícil todo ha incrementado.
Tiene un cuarto aparte en la casa de su mama, lo que desea hacer es cambiar el techo ya que se le pasa el agua y quiere mejorar esa parte para lograr una mejor condición de techo para sus pequeño.
texts.en:
Jazmina is a 31 year old young single mother of two. Things have not been easy for her, and she has had to work hard to stay ahead. Still, with the support of her mother, she has been able to do so. For several years now she has worked as a telephone operator. Before that she was a receptionist, promoted because of good performance. She is pleased with her new position, as it offers greater economic benefits, and although things are still difficult, they are getting better. She has a room in her mother's house, and what she would like to do is repair the roof, because it leaks, and she wants to provide a better living condition for her little ones.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc and wood to repair her roof that leaks.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
el sr. Santos R. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de muebles de madera por mas de 11 años, es casado y  padre de 4 hijos, su hija mayor cursa la secundaria y los tres menores cursan la primaria, con los ingresos que le genera este negocio suple algunos gastos familiares. El credito lo utilizara para comprar madera que es la materia principàl para la elaboracion de muebles, ya que se aproxima la temporada lluviosa y esto les difulta ya que no encuentran madera seca y esto le ocasiona perdida de tiempo y de ingresos. 
tambien cuenta con un molino donde ofrece los servicios de molienda de maiz nixtamalizado y café.  
Santos R. nos comento que invirtio en la compra de Maquinaria y gracias a ello ha ido obteniendo buenas ganancias.
sus condiciones de vida se han mejorado en estos ultimos años.
texts.en:
Santos manufactures and sells wooden furniture and has done so for more than 11 years. This income helps him support his family. He is married and the father of four children. His oldest daughter attends junior high school and his other three children attend elementary school. He will use the money from this loan to buy furniture making supplies. He needs to do this now that the rainy season has begun, because it becomes difficult to find dry lumber and this causes him to lose revenue. He also has a grinder where he provides services grinding dried corn and coffee. Santos tells us that he invested in some machinery, and thanks to that, he has had a good income and his quality of life has improved in recent years.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furniture making supplies

loans.name: Francis Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Francis Verónica S. R., es casada y su esposo labora como taxista, tiene dos hijos menores de  edad que se dedican a los estudios, ellos habitan en el populoso Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, ella realiza los trabajos domésticos, y es su esposo el que lleva el sustento económico, ellos habitan en una casa muy humilde que con sus esfuerzos físicos y ahorros personales la han remodelado lentamente y afectaban de sobremanera la sobrevivencia diaria de la familia.

Uno de sus principales planes es precisamente la culminación de las reparaciones a la infraestructura de su hogar, que por sus condiciones limitadas de habitad, no les ha permitido llevar a cabo la culminacion de estos planes, razón por que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para la edificacion de un muro que proteja de las lluvias y ventarrones y brinde una mayor seguridad de la delincuencia que amenaza dia a dia a los pobladores del barrio donde ellos residen, un mejor habitad les brindara a los padres la tranquilidad y satisfacción de ofrecerle a sus pequeños, la posibilidad de que ellos se desarrollen en un ambiente digno y seguro en donde morar.
texts.en:
Francis Verónica S. R. is married, and her husband works as a taxi driver. They have two minor children; they go to school. They live in the populous Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla. She does the domestic chores, and her husband supports them economically. They live in a very humble house. With their physical efforts and their personal savings, they have been able to slowly renovate the house. This greatly affected her family’s daily survival. One of their main plans is to finish the renovation of the infrastructure of their home. Due to its limited living conditions, they not been able to complete this plan. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials. The loan is to build a wall, which will provide protection from the rains and the windstorms. The wall will also provide greater security from the delinquency, which is a daily threat to the inhabitants of their neighborhood. A better place to live will give the parents peace of mind. It will also give them the satisfaction of proving their children with the possibility of growing up in a decent atmosphere and a safe place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Teresa del Carmen U. P., tienen 36 años, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y labora como Guarda de Seguridad, con su familia habitan en el Barrio La Borgoña, tienen 4 hijos menores de edad, que estudian la escuela primaria, ellos son una familia muy humilde que con sus recursos han edificado poco a poco su hogar.

Desde hace 3 años han tenido problemas con las plagas que afectan los terrenos y disminuyen la producción, razón por la cual decidieron solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales fertilizadores, pesticidas, insumos vegetativos, etc. Con la idea de brindar un mantenimiento abrasivo que permita el aumento en los volúmenes de producción y tras esto la venta a buen precio de la mies, y la tranquilidad de ofrecerle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de sobrevivencia ofreciéndoles el capital necesario para la proyección a futuros planes que favorezcan al núcleo ecoomico de la familia.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen U. P. is 36 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer, and he works as a security guard. She lives with her family in the La Borgoña neighborhood. They have four children who go to primary school. They are a very humble family that has used their resources to slowly build their home. For three years they have had problems with the pests that affect their fields and decrease production. That is the reason they decided to request a loan. The loan is to buy materials like fertilizer, pesticide, and vegetative supplies, etc. The idea is to provide a strong maintenance that will allow for an increase in the volume of their products. Then they can sell their grain for a good price. It will give them peace of mind by giving their children better living conditions. It will also give them the needed capital to make future plans, which will benefit the family’s economy.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like fertilizer, pesticide, and vegetative supplies

loans.name: Sandra Agustina

texts.es: La historia de Doña Sandra comienza con el negocio de crianza de pollos ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo, Doña Sandra como la conocen en el area se dedica a crecerlos y destazarlos para venderlos por libra en el día de mercado que es día martes y miércoles en su tierra que es Magdalena Milpas Altas, ella cuenta que gracias a FAPE a logrado crecer en su negocio y su deseo es criar mas pollos de engorde y vender mas gallinas, ya que es otro producto que ella ofrece. al mismo tiempo Doña Sandra recibio un curso de como hacer Shampoo, desinfectante y cera lo mas especial es que también esto lo vende pero lo vende en envases de aguas gaseosas ya que es lo que ella tiene a su alcanze.Ella también sueña con crecer en este tipo de negocio y es por eso que también ella solicita este crédito para poder comprar una mejor presentación para sus productos.
texts.en:
Sandra’s story begins with her business of raising poultry. She has devoted herself to this business for a long time. "Doña" (Mrs. or Ms) Sandra, as she is known in the area, raises and quarters poultry to sell by the pound. She sells on the market days. Market days are Tuesdays and Wednesdays in her area, which is Magdalena Milpas Atlas. She says that thanks to FAPE she has been able to grow her business. Her wish is to raise more chickens to fatten. She also wants to sell more hens because that is another product that she sells. At the same time, Sandra took a course on how to make shampoo, disinfectant, and wax. What is the best is that she also sells those products. She sells them in carbonated water bottles because that is what she has available. She also dreams of growing in this type of business. That is why she is requesting this loan to be able to buy a better way to display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Pedro Ricardo

texts.es:
Pedro de 54 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, para poder mantener a su familia el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en víveres para una tienda, ya que su sueño siempre fue seguir los mismos pasos de sus padres que tenían una tienda cuando el era niño.  

Con esfuerzo y dedicación estuvo durante muchos años trabajando en su tienda para agrandarla, ahora el trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días en su tienda, vende enlatados, arroz, azúcar etc. 

Para poder incrementar su tienda con mas víveres quiere comprar con el préstamo embutidos y bebidas y con las ganancias asegurar el futuro de su familia. Uno de sus sueños es tener un Minimarket.
texts.en:
Pedro, 54, lives in the peri-urban zone of Guayaquil. In order to support his family, he had to invest their savings in supplies for a store. His dream was always to follow in the same footsteps of his parents who owned a shop when he was a child. He has put many years of hard work and dedication into working in his store in order to enlarge it. Now, he works from 7:00 am until 11:00 pm every day in his shop selling canned goods, rice, sugar etc. He wants to use the loan to enlarge his store by buying more supplies such as sausages and drinks. The profits will secure his family’s future. One of his dreams is to own a Minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sausages, drinks.

loans.name: Willian Alexis

texts.es:
el sr. Willian Alexis G. D. se dedica al comercio cuenta con mas de 1 año de experiencia,  
se caracteriza por ser un joven muy dinamico y emprendedor, esta casado y por los momentos no tiene hijos.
mientras tanto se esta preparando para cuando sea el tiempo de tener hijos, su 
negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico de mayor influencia comercial sus ventas las realiza al por mayor 
y al detalle, sus productos los compra en la vecina republica de Nicaragua ya que es barato y le queda mas cerca
ya que el vive en el Municipo de Las Trojes y queda fronterizo con Nicaragua. 
El Sr. Willian G. utilizara el credito para comprar mas mercaderia lo que le permitira vender mas producto.
ahora no tendra la necesidad de estar viajando mas seguido a Nicaragua,  con esto ahorrara gastos en la adquisicion de productos y tener mejores porcentajes de utilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Willian Alexis G. D. has over a year of experience in the trade business. He is a very dynamic and enterprising young man. He is married and does not have children as of now. While he prepares for the time to come when he does have children, his business is located in a strategic place to greater commercially influence his sales in wholesale and retail. He buys his products in the neighboring republic of Nicaragua. It is cheap and closer since he lives in the Municipalities of the Trojan and it is on the border with Nicaragua. Mr. Willian G. D. will use the credit to buy more merchandise, allowing him to sell more products. Now he will not have to travel as often to Nicaragua. With this acquisition of products, he will save money and have better profit percentages as a result.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pots, pans, pitchers, jugs, kettles and rubber sandals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
La señora María Elsa C. G., tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y su esposo labora como albañil, con sus 2 hijos adolecentes los cuales son estudiantes , habitan en el barrio la Francia numero dos,  ella es agricultora de piña desde hace 15 años.

Dentro de los problemas que más la agobian, esta el robo indiscriminado de las cosechas, pero solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos vegetativos y fertilizantes que permitan mejores  condiciones fitosanitarias, que favorezcan a la buena producción de las siembras, o el capital necesario para a futuro sembrar una manzana de piña que le brinde mejores condiciones socioeconómicas , o la reconstrucción de su humilde vivienda, que tanto les afana a habitar en un ambiente más optimo para todos los miembros de la familia, sobre todo que sus hijos están en una etapa de sus vidas en donde demandan de mayores condiciones e independencia de espacio para su bienestar personal.
texts.en:
María Elsa is 38 years old. She is married and her husband works as a mason. They live in the Francia 2 neighborhood and have two teen-aged children; both students. María has been a pineapple farmer for 15 years. Among the challenges she faces is the indiscriminant theft of her crops. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a greater inventory of vegetable farming supplies and fertilizer that will improve the quality of the soil and result in increased production, and to have the necessary working capital to be able to plant more pineapple that will help her create more favorable economic conditions and allow her to rebuild her humble home so that she can create better living conditions for her family. Above all, her children are now at the point in their lives where the need more personal space for their well being.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Túcume, una zona bastante conocida por su atractivo turistico: cuenta con un complejo arqueológico conformado por 26 pirámides que datan de una civilización anterior a los Incas. Sus actividades principales son la agricultura y el comercio. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Julio se dedica a la decoración y ornamentación de locales para actividades sociales y celebraciones. El lleva trabajando dos años en esta actividad y se vale de ella para percibir ingresos, los cuales utiliza en el mantenimiento de su familia. Su trabajo consiste en realizar diversos arreglos utilizando telas en los ambientes donde se realizarán fiestas y reuniones. Esta actividad la realiza en el distrito de Túcume y también en el distrito de Illimo.

Gracias a la calidad con la que realiza su trabajo se ha vuelto conocido en la zona y siempre tiene clientes que solicitan sus servicios. El desea adquirir mas material para poder realizar su trabajo de una manera más cómoda, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de telas y sillas.	

Julio es una persona trabajadora y bastante creativa, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida esforzándose al máximo en su trabajo. En la zona donde vive el es una persona bastante conocida y respetada.
texts.en:
Julio is 25 years old, married and has one child. He lives with his family in the Túcume district, a region known as a tourist attraction. It has an archaeological site that has 26 pyramids that date back to a previous Inca civilization. His primary activities are agriculture and business. He belongs to the Lambayeque Province which is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Julio works decorating venues used for social and celebratory activities. He has been doing this for 2 years and it has proved to be a valuable source of income, which he uses to support his family. In his work he uses different fabric arrangements in places where parties and meetings will be held. He works in the Túcume district and also in the Illimo district. Due to the quality of his work he has made a name for himself in the region and always has customers requesting his services. He wants to purchase more material for his job in the most convenient way possible and for this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. He plans to buy fabric and chairs. Julio is quite a creative and hardworking person. His main desire is to give his family a better quality of life and for this reason, he is very driven in his work. In the region where he lives he is quite well know and respected.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julio wants to purchase new fabrics and chairs for his decorating business

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
María Virginia tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos que aún estudian, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Las Pampas, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, el cual se caracteriza por tener a su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y caprino desde hace mas de viente años. El cría sus animales en corralones cercanos a la vivienda en donde vive y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los vende a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona comprando animales para revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos por lo que trata de mantenerlo de la mejor manera posible.

María desea adquirir alimento de engorde para que su ganado gane peso y así poder venderlo a un mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer entregada a su familia que comparte su tiempo entre las actividades hogareñas y el cuidado de sus animales, su sueño es seguir trabajando para apoyar a su familia a salir adelante. En el lugar donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman y respetan mucho.
texts.en:
Mary Virginia is 54 years old. She is married and has three children who are still students. She lives with her family in the village of Las Pampas, a rural area in the Mórrope district, which is characterized by its concentrated populations in rural areas which are situated far apart from each other. The district belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been raising cattle and goats for over twenty years. She raises her animals in large corrals near the house where she lives. When they have reached the desired weight, she sells them to the merchants who always visit the area to buy animals for resale in the city of Chiclayo. This business is her main source of income, so she tries to sustain it in the best way she knows. Maria wants to purchase feed to fatten her cattle and make them gain weight so that she can sell them at a better price. To achieve her goal, she has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This is her first loan. Maria is a woman devoted to her family. She shares her time between home activities and the care of her animals. Her dream is to continue working to support her family so they can get ahead. Her neighbors and acquaintances in the area where she lives admire and respect her very much.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced cattle feed and improve her cattle and goat raising business.

loans.name: Ivanez

texts.es: Ivanez, de 32 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposa Lucy (28)  y sus 4 hijos menores.Desde hace 12 años se dedica a sembrar  plátanos, café y distintas frutas cítricas; realiza la labor junto a su esposa, quien se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de la actividad que desempeña, es rozar los terrenos, en busca de buenas cosechas; sin embargo le disgusta pagar precios altos cada vez que traslada sus productos a la ciudad, por eso en la actualidad recolecta toda la producción de su sector para llevarlo a vender y así ahorra un dinero extra. Con su labor ha obtenido muchos logros, como el adquirir su casa y sus chacras propias, por eso dentro de sus planes futuros se encuentra el de mejorar la calidad de vida, además piensa comprar  más tierras agrícolas, ya que quiere ganar más utilidades.Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se siente motivado de continuar laborando en su banco comunal, porque todos los integrantes son muy trabajadores y responsables. Para mas adelante Ivanez tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado, en la compra de varios sacos de abono, fertilizantes y herramientas agrícolas que necesita para desempeñar bien su labor.
texts.en:
Ivanez is 32 years old and lives in his own home along with his 32 year old wife, Lucy, and four young children. He’s been raising bananas and coffee for the past 12 years. He does this along with his wife, who also cares for the home and the children. What he likes most is that he is able to restore the land in search of better harvests. At the same time, he does not like having to pay high prices every time he needs to transport his products to the city, so now he collects all of the products from his sector, so that he can share the cost of transport and save money. His hard work has allowed him to obtain many things, such as his home and his own farmland. This is why his future plans include improving his quality of life. He also wants to buy more farmland. This will be his second loan through MFP and he is motivated to continue working with his communal bank because all of its members are responsible and hard working. Ivanez will use the money from this loan to buy bags of fertilizer and farm tools that he needs to be able to carry out his labor.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and farm tools

loans.name: Policarpo

texts.es:
Policarpo, tiene 42 años, es soltero  y es natural del Cusco. Actualmente, Su actividad principal es administrar su salón de belleza llamado “Centro de Estética Juan Carlos” que está ubicado en la calle Pavitos muy cerca a la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad del Cusco. El es una persona emprendedora y motivado por sus familiares y amigos decidió abrir un salón de belleza en el cusco. Policarpio requiere el préstamo para comprar tintes, champús y líquidos de permanentes.  

Policarpio pertenece al banco comunal “Chaska Ñahui” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son tres ciclos que participa y se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro, capacitación y  también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Policarpio manifiesta porque permanece en el banco comunal: “Nos hacen un préstamo rápido para invertir en nuestro negocio”.
texts.en:
Policarpio is 42 years old, single, and is from Cusco. Currently, his primary business is running his beauty salon, which is called “Centro de Estética Juan Carlos”, which is located in the street Calle Pavitos, very close to Plaza de Armas in the city of Cusco. He is an enterprising person and, motivated by his family and friends, decided to open a beauty salon in Cusco. Policarpio requests the loan in order to buy dyes, shampoos, and perm supplies. Policarpio belongs to the community bank “Chaska Ñahui" of the Araiwa association. He has already participated in three loan cycles, and he is content and satisfied with the credit, loan, and training services and and is grateful for the opportunity offered to him in this way and promises to complete the repayments according to the schedule. Policarpio explains why he is with the community bank this way: "They gives us quick loans in order to invest in our businesses."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Policarpio requests the loan to buy dyes, shampoo, and perm supplies.

loans.name: José Wilber

texts.es:
José Wilber, tiene 55  años, es soltero  y es natural del Cusco. Actualmente, Su actividad principal es administrar su salón de belleza llamado “PEPE” que está ubicado en la Av. Matara muy cerca a la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad del Cusco. El aprendió el oficio en la ciudad de Lima en el Instituto Superior de Cosmetología “Fransosi” entonces como es una persona emprendedora y motivado por sus familiares y amigos decidió abrir un salón de belleza en el cusco. El sueño de la socia de aquí a 3 a 4 años va cambiar  de negocio, él también es chef pues le encanta la cocina y por ese motivo va abrir un restaurante que le llamara “PEPE”. José requiere el préstamo para comprar tintes, champús y también desea renovar su inmobiliario del salón.  

José manifiesta porque permanece en la banco comunal: “Por las facilidades de pago y Incentiva a Ahorrar”.

José pertenece al banco comunal “Chaska Ñahui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro, capacitación y  también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
José Wilber is 55 years old, single, and from Cusco. Currently, his main activity is running his beauty salon, called "Pepe", which is is located in the street Avenida Matara, very close to the Plaza de Armas in the city of Cusco. He learned this trade in the city of Lima at the Instituto Superior de Cosmetología Fransosi. Then, as he is an enterprising person, and motivated by his family and friends, he decided to open a beauty salon in Cusco. The dream of this bank member is to change businesses in 3 or 4 years - he is also a chef because he loves cooking, and for this reason he is going to open a restaurant that he will call "Pepe". José requests this loan in order to buy dyes and shampoos, and he also wants to renovate the salon premises. José explains why he is a member of the community bank in this way: "because of the payment facilities and the incentive to save." Jose belongs to the community bank “Chaska Ñahui" of the Araiwa association and he is content and satisfied with the credit, loan, and training services and and is grateful for the opportunity offered to him in this way and promises to complete the repayments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dyes and shampoos, and to renovate the salon premise

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, es un señor muy colaborador y honesto, tiene 58 años, está separado de su pareja desde hace 10 años, pero juntos tienen 4 hijos, sin embargo pese a estar pendiente de sus hijos, vive sólo en su casa propia. Hace mas de 20 años cultiva café, plátanos y maíz, sobre sus terrenos propios, pues considera que está actividad le es muy rentable, ya que le permite hacer crecer sus bienes, principalmente sus terrenos agrícolas. Actualmente Alejandro no cuenta con la ayuda de ningún familiar, sólo contrata operarios para que lo ayuden en la limpieza de sus chacras y para la recolección de su cosecha. Disfruta mucho de la venta de su producción, ya que siente satisfacción al recibir las ganancias, esto representa la recompensa de su arduo trabajo. Además indica que parte de su éxito es que viene practicando técnicas agrarias para no perder su producción, ya que los cambios climáticos han hecho que pierda algo de frutos hace algunos meses atrás. Pero sabe que este trabajo le permite ayudar económicamente a sus hijos hasta hoy en día y sobre todo puede cubrir sus primeras  necesidades y vivir cómodamente, por tal motivo quiere repartir a sus hijos sus tierras por igual, pero primero debe trabajar la tierra que posee, renovando y alternando productos para mejores cosechas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y  confía mucho en las personas que integran su grupo  comunal, es por eso que le gusta laborar junto ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará herramientas agrícolas como machetes para que faciliten su trabaja, además contratará operarios, ya que sus tierras necesitan una cuidado.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 58, is a very honest and collaborative person; he has been separated from his wife for 10 years but they have four children together and, although he lives alone in his own house, he’s always mindful of his children’s wellbeing. For over 20 years he has farmed coffee, bananas and corn on his own farmlands. He considers farming to be very profitable because it makes it possible for his assets to grow, especially his farm lands. Currently, Alejandro does not get help from any family member, he hires field hands to help him clear his fields and to harvest his crops. He enjoys selling his products because it satisfies him to earn profits since they represent the reward for his hard work. He also states that his success is due in part to his using farming techniques to protect his crops because recent weather changes have caused some losses in production. However, he realizes that this work makes it possible for him to provide for his children, especially where basic needs are concerned so that they can live comfortably. He’d like to distribute his lands equally among his children but first he has to work the lands he owns, renovating and alternating crops for better production. This is his second loan with MFP and he trusts all the members of this communal group so he enjoys working with them for this reason. He will use the requested funds to buy farming tools like machetes that will make his work easier; he will also hire field hands because his fields are in need of some care.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy machetes and hire field hands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Jhean

texts.es: Jhean , de 30 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de su pareja Justina (24) y sus 4 pequeños hijos.Ser el mejor productor de la zona, es una de sus aspiraciones que lo motiva a trabajar con dedicación, junto a su esposa. Cada día desde tempranas horas de la mañana sale a cultivar y así mantiene limpias sus plantaciones de plátanos, café y maíz, trabaja con la tierra, desde hace 15 años. Empezó a comprar sus terrenos desde muy joven, asegura que de la agricultura todo le gusta, porque es un oficio muy rentable, que hasta hoy le permite vivir sin pasar necesidades, y sobre todo puede cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Para mas adelante tiene planeado cumplir sus metas en la vida, además plantará mayor cantidad de naranjas y café, porque considera que de esa manera asegurará el futuro de sus hijos.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ante los integrantes de su banco comunal, se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.Jhean tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en comprar decenas de plantas cítricas y 3 sacos de fertilizantes, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, pues de esta manera quiere seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Jhean, 30, lives in his own home with his life partner, Justina, 24, and their four small children. He aims to be the area’s best farmer and this motivates him to work hard alongside his wife. He goes out every day very early in the morning to cultivate and maintain his banana, coffee and corn crops clean; he has been a farmer for 15 years. He started out buying farmlands from a very young age. He assures us that he loves everything about farming because it’s a profitable occupation. To date, it has made it possible for him to live without lacking anything; above all, it has allowed him to pay for his children’s education. For later on he plans to meet his life goals; he will plant larger amount of oranges and coffee because he believes this is the way to insure his children’s future. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to his fellow group members to make his payments punctually. Jhean plans to use the requested funds to buy several citrus plants and three sacks of fertilizer that he will spread among his plants so that he can continue to progress this way.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy citrus plants and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Angela Gardenia

texts.es:
Ángela de 49 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran  (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es madre soltera con dos hijos. Ella tiene un salón de belleza.     

Para lograr tener el salón de belleza tuvo que estudiar en un instituto y trabajar como empleada en un gabinete para obtener experiencia. Ahora ella tiene un salón de belleza pequeño y trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas productos de belleza para sus clientes ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cremas, shampoo para cabellos y cosméticos. En el futuro quiere comprar su casa propia y tener sucursales de su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Angela is 49 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban perimeter that was originally irregular, with various hills, rivulets and lakes that remain as ecological remnants in dissolution). She is a single mother with 2 children and has a beauty salon. To get her beauty salon, she had to study in an institute and work as an employ in another business to obtain experience. Now she has a small beauty salon and works from 9:00am until 8:00pm every day. To obtain more beauty products for her clients, Angela requests a loan to buy creams for hair and cosmetic purposes and also shampoo. In the future she wishes to buy her own house and to open branches of her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING  FACIAL AND HAIR CREAMS AND SHAMPOO FOR HER BEAUTY SALON

loans.name: Deysi Marilú

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su hermano, residen en la ciudad de Lambayeque, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de dos años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en un puesto ubicado al interior del mercado de la ciudad, ella adquiere su mercadería en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo y la ofrece en venta desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, Deysi brinda siempre un trato amable y productos de primera necesidad y gracias a ello ha podido obtener una clientela fija. Los ingresos que obtiene los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y para sostener la economía familiar.

Deysi desea ampliar sus ventas adquiriendo mas mercadería con la cual surtir su negocio. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Deysi es una joven emprendedora y bastante trabajadora. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Deysi, 23, is single and lives with her brother in Lambayeque, capital of Lambayeque province, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over two years she has sold groceries in a stand located inside the city’s market. She acquires her merchandise in Chiclayo’s wholesale market and is open for business from very early in the morning. Deysi always provides very kind customer service and basic needs items. Thanks to this, she has acquired a stable base of regular customers. She uses profits from her business to pay for her personal expenses and to support her family. Deysi would like to expand her business buying more merchandise to stock in her store. This is why she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to help her meet this goal. Deysi is an enterprising and quite hard-working young woman. She has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with respect to her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es: Juanito, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa  Elena (42), y 3 de sus 7 hijos, pues el resto son mayores de edad.Desde hace 20 años cultiva plátanos, achiote y café, en sus terrenos propios, lo que le disgusta es no tener capital de trabajo suficiente para comprarse  una hacienda, pero ama la labor de campo. Recuerda como su padre le enseñó todas las técnicas agrícolas, que ahora practica y  enseña a sus hijos con mucho orgullo,  para no perder la tradición familiar. Para la labor agrícola cuenta con la  ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos, porque las buenas ganancias que perciben en la agricultura le alcanzan para vivir cómodamente y también para asumir algunos gastos. Como  es un hombre emprendedor tiene planeado continuar plantando en mayor cantidad todos sus productos que se desarrollan en la selva central.Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y promete seguir pagando  puntualmente sus cuotas, como hasta ahora lo hace, porque quiere  continuar trabajando con su banco comunal.Juanito tiene planeado invertir el dinero del préstamo en comprar varios sacos de abono que necesita  para cuidar sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Juanito is 46 years old and lives in his own home alongside his wife Elena, 42, and three of his seven children. The rest of his children are grown. For twenty years, Juanito has farmed bananas, achiote [a small tree grown for its rust-colored seeds] and coffee on his own land. What upsets him is not having sufficient working capital to buy himself a ranch, but he loves farm work. Juanito remembers how his father taught him all of the farming techniques that he now uses and proudly teaches them to his children so as to not lose the family tradition. For farm work, he counts on the help of his wife and children because the good profits that they receive in agriculture enable them to live comfortably and to take care of some expenses. An entrepreneurial man, Juanito has planned to continue to plant large quantities of all of his products that grow in Peru’s Central Jungle. This is the second loan that he has with Microfinanzas Prisma and he commits to making his payments on time as he has done so far because he wishes to continue working with his community bank. Juanito has planned to invest the money from the loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer that he needs to take care of his next sowings.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer for Crops

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Verónica es una mujer trabajadora, madre de un hijo, tiene la edad de 43 años, y durante todo estos años ha trabajado para lograr apoyar a su esposo, el trabaja como carpintero y ella en servicio domestico, pues anteriormente trabaja como conserje pero nunca le aumentara lo que decidió cambiar de trabajo con el propósito de poder ganar mas dinero el cual necesitan.
Mediante estos financiamiento ha mejorado su casa, el cual esta contenta por las mejoras, lo que desea mejorar es el piso ya que es aun de suelo y falta repellar el cuarto para una mejor higiene y comodidad familiar. 
Comprara: arena, cemento, tablas y otros para comenzar la mejora de su pequeña casa
texts.en:
Verónica, 43, is a hard-working woman; she has one son. All these years she has worked as a domestic employee to help out her husband who is a carpenter. She used to work as a caretaker but they never raised her salary so she decided to go into something that produced more income, which they need. Through these loans she has been improving her dwelling and she’s happy with the improvements. What she’d like to do now is improve the flooring which is still dirt and the walls of one of the rooms still need to be sealed for better hygiene and comfort. She will buy: sand, boards and other materials to begin the improvements on her small house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es:
Don Saúl es un hombre trabajador padre de familia de tres hijos, desde hace varios años trabaja como fiscal en construcción, para las empresa constructora el cual ha tomado experiencia, ya que debido al desempleo no logro ubicarse en su profesión lo que ha sido para el negativo en su vida profesional.
Ha logrado hacer su propio cuarto en donde le falta hacer varias mejoras en su casa, como el repello, y lo que hará es embaldosar ya que es de tierra y se le hace más difícil, y desea obtener una mejor higiene en su casa.
Para hacer esta mejora comprara: arena, cemento, tabla, que el mismo hará  y que le ha sido de mucho beneficio aprender ya que no gasta en mano de obra y se ayuda económicamente.
texts.en:
Saúl is a hard-working father of three children. He has worked as a construction supervisor for a local construction firm where he has gained experience because, due to lack of employment opportunities in his field, he hasn’t been able to get work in his profession and this has been a negative point in his professional life. He has managed to build his own room but he needs several improvements to his house, like sealing the walls and installing tile flooring because the floor is still dirt; this will make life easier and improve the hygiene in his house. To make these improvements he will buy: sand, cement, lumber. He, himself, will do the labor since it’s been a benefit to have learned how and he will save labor costs and help himself economically this way.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es:
Doña Rosa tiene la edad de 44 años, madre de un hijo, vive en el bario Hialeah desde hace varios años, 
Es madre soltera ha tenido que trabajar mucho para poder dar lo necesario a su hijo, hoy cuenta con el apoyo de el,  ya que trabajando. El trabajo de doña Rosa es en despacho en un cafetín del colegio el cual lleva dos años. Pues anteriormente trabajaba en una universidad.
El trabajo es estable lo que desea que no surjan cambios que afecten su trabajo ya que desea seguir mejorando su casa ya que le falta el repello, hacer la cocina, pintar,  pero lo que mas le urge es poder construir el baño de concreto para una mejor higiene y mejor aseo personal. 
Para esta mejora comprara bloques, arena, cemento, madera, zinc para lograr la construcción. Contenta por que lo esta logrando mediante el financiamiento que es el medio por el cual se sale adelante por sus plazos.
texts.en:
44-year old Sra. Rosa has a son and has lived in the neighbourhood of Hialeah for several years. She is a single mother and has had to work hard to provide for her son. Nowadays he helps her while she is working. Rosa works in the office of a college cafeteria; she’s been doing this for two years. She used to work in a university. It is steady work, and she hopes that no changes take place that will affect the job as she wants to continue making improvements to her house. The walls need to be plastered and painted, and a kitchen built, but the her greatest wish is to be able to make a concrete bathroom for greater cleanliness and personal hygiene. To make these improvements, Rosa will buy concrete blocks, sand, cement, wood, and zinc sheeting. She is happy that the loan will enable her to get on with this work and make progress in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a bathroom

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been a van operator for three years and is happily married with one son who attends school. Her husband works with Pan Africa. Grace rents a house with electricity but no piped water. She told us that her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

With the Kshs 80,000 loan, Grace wants to purchase new parts for her van and do some painting. She decided to join Yehu to obtain the loan to uplift her business, her potential customers being her passengers. She faces the challenge of high competition since many vans are operating on the road.

In the future, Grace hopes to begin a tourist company.

loans.use: To purchase new parts for her van and do some painting

loans.name: Maira Elieth

texts.es:
la sra. Maira Elieth L. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan y nacatamales actividad que viene realizando por mas de 5 años.
