Su producto lo vende de forma domiciliar y en diferentes negocios de la localidad, su producto solo es de estregar en los negocios ya que son clientes fijos que siempre le compran todo el año, es madre de 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta en la escuela publica de la localidad, su esposo trabaja en el Paraíso en una carnicería y de esta forman se apoyan mutuamente para poder salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellos y de sus hijos satisfaciendo las necesidades básicas como ser educación, alimentación, vivienda y vestuario.     
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para fabricar sus panes y sus tamales.
y según algunos vecinos Maira es una persona de muy buena conducta y cumplida con los compromisos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maira Elieth L. has been making and selling bread and nacatamales (steamed corn cakes) for five years. She sells these items from her house, and she also delivers them to different local businesses which have been steady customers throughout the years. Maira has two children, one of whom is a student at the local school. Her husband works in a butcher’s store in El Paraíso, and together they work hard to get ahead in life and improve the family’s standard of living. They have to buy basic necessities such as education, food, housing, and clothing. The loan will be used to buy more ingredients for the bread and tamales. Maira’s neighbours say that she is a good citizen and keeps her promises.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Raquel es una mujer con deseo de superación, tiene la edad de 29 años con dos hermosos hijos,  con ayuda de su esposo logro poner su pequeño negocio una pequeña librería que lleva poco tiempo de administrarla. 
En donde vende una variedad de productos para los estudiantes, hay días que las ventas están bajas pero no se deja de vender.
Su casa aun le falta mucho por hacer mejoras es por eso nace la iniciativa de poder trabajar para ayudar con los gastos básicos de agua, luz, y dar lo necesario a sus hijos para poder ahorrar y hacer las mejoras  de infraestructura.
Con este financiamiento comprara docenas de cuadernos, lapiceros, tijeras, reglas, comestiquera, bolsos y otros productos que se venden más para lograr equilibrar las ventas y obtener mejores resultado
texts.en:
Sra. Raquel is a woman who wishes to get ahead in life. She is 29 years old and has two beautiful children. With help from her husband she managed to open a small stationery store, a business that she has only been running for a short time. She sells a variety of products for students. There are days when she doesn’t make many sales but that doesn’t deter her. Raquel’s house still needs much work, and that’s the reason why she started her business: so she could help with basic expenses such as water, electricity, the children’s needs, and to be able to save and make some improvements to the house. With this loan she will buy notebooks, pens, scissors, rulers, makeup bags, purses etc. to increase sales and and provide a more regular income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her stationery store

loans.name: Migdalia Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Migdalia es una mujer trabajadora, casada, madre de cinco hijos, el cual han sido su alegría.
Desde joven junto a su mama trabajaba en la costura pues ha sido su medio de trabajo gracias a la experiencia de los años.
A través de  los financiamiento ha logrado mejor la inversión y tiene varias maquina con diferente tejido esto para dar a los clientes un mejor servicio de costura.
Para generar mejores ingresos también esta vendiendo cajeta, que por  ricas y barata se venden. Con este préstamo comprara varias yardas de tela de sincatex, gabardina, y otras para hacer ropa, cumplir con encargos de los clientes. 
Sus planes a futuro es seguir aumentando en el comercio de sus costuras con el fin de ahorrar para mejorar en mejores condiciones su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Migdalia is a married, hard-working mother of five children, who are her joy. From a very early age she worked as a seamstress alongside her mother; this experience has been her means of support throughout the years. Through loans she has improved her investment and she now has several machines that do a variety of stitches so she can provide her customers with better sewing services. In order to generate better income she is also selling cajeta (caramel syrup) which is inexpensive and delicious. She will use this loan to buy several yards of polyester, gabardine and other fabrics to manufacture clothing to fill pending orders from customers. Her future plans are to continue to increase her sales so that she can have saving with which to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with one son who attends junior school; her husband works with Kenya Ports Authority. Florence rents a house with electricity and piped water. She pointed out her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport.

Florence operates a stall from home selling soft drinks to her neighbors. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she would like to purchase a refrigerator to help her venture into a competitive market to suit her customers’ needs. She cites seasonality and competition to be her major challenges as many people operate the same business as she does.

Florence hopes to buy her own car from her business profits someday. She joined Yehu so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario G.  se encuentra casado, tiene 2 hijos uno de tres añitos y el otro recién nacidito. Vive en la comunidad de Cazorla de la provincia mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. 
 
El Sr. Mario es el hermano mayor de toda su familia, por recursos bajos  de sus papás el sigue colaborando en el estudio y la alimentación a sus hermanos menores que siguen estudiando en la escuela. Su esposa y él se dedican a la producción agrícola en los terrenos de su padre, se apersono a las oficinas para solicitar un crédito para comprar un terreno agrícola y así  poder trabajar en sus propios terrenos y aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y de toda su familia. 

El Sr. Mario también desea comprar una vaca para bajar sus gastos de alimentación de sus hermanos menores y tal vez en un futuro ellos puedan tener más vacas y dedicarse a la producción de leche cruda.
texts.en:
Mario is married, and has 2 children, 1 to 3 years old, plus another recently born. He lives in the community of Cazorla, Mizque Province, Cochabamba Department. Mario is the elder brother in his family. Due to his parents' limited resources, he continues to collaborate in the education and maintenance of his younger brothers who are still studying in school. His wife and he produce agricultural products on his father's land. He has approached our offices to request a loan to buy agricultural land, to be able to work their own lands and increase their income and improve their quality of life as well as that of their family. Mario also wishes to buy a milk cow in order to lower the costs of feeding his younger brothers and, perhaps, in the future they can have more cows and begin production of raw milk.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING AGRICULTURAL LAND AND A MILK COW

loans.name: Claudia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La joven Claudia es madre de dos hijos, tiene la edad de 31 años, vive en una comarca en Santo Domingo junto a su esposo el cual trabaja de albañil.
Desde hace varios años, inicio con ventas de comida, ya que en la comarca  hicieron una fábrica constructora en donde trabajan muchas personas lo que para ella fue de mucho beneficio ya que con la venta de comida  aportaría  con ayuda económica  a su familia. 
Por las mañana hace hamburguesas, pan con mantequilla, café de leche, café, gaseosas, y por la tarde hace comida sólida.
La dificultad que se le presenta es que a sus clientes le da al crédito de quincena y a veces no le pagan toda la cuenta, lo que viene a comprar menos productos para elaborar los alimentos, a demás tiene que cubrir sus gastos.
Con este crédito comprara por quintal el arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carnes, pollo en cantidad para que no le falte los alimento con que hacer su comida. Y por que también necesita aumentar sus ventas y su capital de dinero no ajusta para la inversión. 
Lo que hará con el financiamiento para poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Claudia, 31, has two children and lives in a rural area of Santo Domingo with her husband who is a bricklayer. For several years she has sold prepared meals because a construction firm was built in their area and many people work there; this was of great benefit for her because her sales of meals would contribute to the family’s economy. During the morning she makes hamburgers, bread with butter, coffee with milk, coffee, soft-drinks; during the afternoons she makes complete meals. The difficulty she faces is that she sells to her customers on credit; they repay every two weeks and sometimes they don’t pay the full amount they owe her. This leads to her having to buy reduced amounts of ingredients to prepare her meals and she still has to pay her costs. She will use this loan to buy quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, meats, and chicken so that she will have enough ingredients available to make her meals. She also needs to increase her sales and she lacks capital of her own to invest; the loan will make it possible for her to continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Aditza Maria

texts.es:
Doña Aditza es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, es una mujer de pocos recursos económicos, pero si con muchos deseos de trabajar desde hace varios años logro su negocio de venta de ropa como: camiseta, camisola, ropa interior de mujer y hombre, el cual vende ambulante.
Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad, y aunque su salario es bajo es un trabajo fijo. Su casa es pequeña aun de tablas ya muy viejas, su piso de suelo, pero no ha hecho las mejoras por falta de dinero ya que lo que presta invierte más en su negocio para poder ganar dinero y ayudar a su familia.
Lo que espera en un futuro poder reparar su casa.
Con este financiamiento comprara: bóxer, biquinis, tobilleras, camiseta para varón entre otros para seguir vendiendo
texts.en:
Aditza is a very hard-working woman; she has two children. She is very low-income but very eager to work. Several years ago she set up a clothing sales business; she sells t-shirts, nightgowns, women’s and men’s underwear door-to-door. Her husband is a security guard and even though his salary is low the work is permanent. Her house is small and still made of very old boards; her floor is dirt. She hasn’t made any home improvements because she has lacked funds to do so because what she borrows she prefers to invest in her business in order to earn income to help her family. She hopes in the future to be able to make home improvements. She will use this funding to buy: boxer shorts, bikinis, ankle socks, men’s undershirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is married with four children of whom two attend higher secondary school. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water and her greatest monthly expenses are transport and food. She hopes to use the Kshs 25,000 loan to pay school fees for her two children.

Jacinta has been selling vegetables from her home to her neighbors for the past six years. Her other source of income is her husband’s salary. She cites transportation and competition as her major challenges.

Jacinta hopes to become a wholesaler at the market someday. She decided to join Yehu so as to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To pay school fees for two of her children and to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 34 años, enviudó hace 3 años, y vive solo con sus dos pequeños hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 6 años cultiva café, plátano, maíz y frutas cítricas, en sus terrenos propios y también en algunos arrendados. Labora con la ayuda de operarios, quienes mantienen limpias sus chacras, y de esta manera puede obtener una cosecha a tiempo. Aprendió las técnicas de la agricultura, gracias  a las enseñanzas de su padre, que según refiere, no quería que su hija dependa de ningún varón. Y lo que más le gusta de su oficio es comercializar sus cosechas en los mercados de la ciudad donde vive, porque siempre ahorra el dinero que gana, por ello con esfuerzo  compró los bienes que ahora tiene. Como es una mujer emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado plantar en mayor cantidad café y plátanos.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y desde sus primeras reuniones asegura que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal, porque le han  incentivado en el ahorro, además aprende nuevas actividades con las constantes charlas educativas.Karina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en pagar a operarios, para que limpien las  dos hectáreas de terreno que compró, además adquirirá  dos bolsas de abono que necesita para asegurar sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Karina, age 34, was widowed three years ago. She lives alone with her two small children in her own house. For six years she has been growing coffee, bananas, corn, and citrus fruits on her own fields. She also has some rented fields. She works with the help of workers who keep the fields on her farm cleared. That way she is able to get her harvest on time. She learned farming techniques thanks to her father’s lessons. He did not want his daughter dependent upon any man. What she likes most about her occupation is selling the harvests in the markets in the city where she lives. She saves the money that she earns. With effort she bought the possessions that she now has. As an enterprising woman she plans to later plant a greater quantity of coffee and bananas. This is her first loan with MFP. Ever since her first meeting she was sure that she liked working with her communal bank. She likes it because they have given incentives to save. Also, she learns new activities with the ongoing educational talks. Karina plans to use the requested money to pay for the workers to clear two hectares of land that she bought. She will also get two bags of fertilizer, which she needs to assure her next crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and pay laborers to improve her crops

loans.name: Heydi Patricia

texts.es:
Heydi es una joven de 29 años de edad, soltera, vive en la colonia 14 de septiembre junto a sus padres, el cual la ha apoyado siempre, gracias a sus esfuerzos le dieron estudio y se graduó en administración de empresa.
El negocio que Heydi administra es servicio de auto lavado, y venta de lubricantes desde hace varios años, el cual inicio su papa y luego se lo dejo para que lo trabajara, desde horas tempranas abren para dar sus servicios, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, y ayuda a siete jóvenes quienes trabajan con ella en auto lavado y que son de poco recursos económicos, lo que le sastiface poderle ayudar mediante este trabajo.

En este tiempo de invierno se trabaja poco, pero no deja de vender sus lubricantes que es la otra fuente de ingreso que tiene.
Lo que desea es invertir mas en la compra de lubricantes de aceite para motor de vehiculo ya que tiene poco inventario, y no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para esta inversión. 
Y necesita vender  para poder cubrir los gastos de agua, luz, pago a sus empleados entre otros gastos.
texts.en:
Heydi, 29, is single and lives in the 14 de Septiembre neighborhood with her parents who have always supported her; thanks to their efforts she received an education graduating with a degree in business administration. Heydi has operated a car wash for several years and also sells motor vehicle lubricants. Her father started the business and then left it for her to run. They open for business very early in the morning and they have both repeat and occasional customers. She helps out seven young, low-income people who she employs in the car wash; this is a source of satisfaction for her to be able to provide help through this work. During this winter season work in the car wash decreases less but she still sells her lubricants which is another source of income for her. She wants to invest in more lubricant purchases because her inventory right now is low and she lacks funds to do so. She needs sales in order to pay light, water and employee salaries, among other expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle lubricants and car-wash supplies.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is a married woman with six children,one attending school while others are adults. She has been selling fish for over fifteen years and has no other source of income. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she would like to expand her selling stall, do cultivation and pay school fees.

Kahindi sells fish at the market and from home. The most difficult part of her business is high competition as many people are selling fish in small scale.

Kahindi rents a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport. She hopes to lead a happy life and help her family.

loans.use: To expand her selling stall, pay school fees and do cultivation.

loans.name: Georgia

texts.en:
Georgia walked past a shabby hair salon in San Francisco’s Mission District almost every day for twelve years without giving it a second glance; it was a far cry from the spaces where she worked as a hair stylist.

Over the years, Georgia has paid other business owners considerable monthly fees to rent chairs in their plush salons. Last year she grew tired of sharing her earnings with salons that did not share her vision. She declared, “I want do something innovative, fun and my own…it is my turn.”

One day, rather than just passing by the shabby hair salon, Georgia marched in and asked to buy the space. From this bold move, “Pretty Pretty Collective” was born.

It is no secret that Georgia loves to create fantasy and imagery. She grew up in England and Canada, left home when she was 14, and has been styling and modeling ever since. Georgia’s vision for “Pretty Pretty Collective” is to create an imaginative venue where she can style clients during the day.

In addition to serving her own client base, Georgia will proudly rent out the space to five other stylists who share her passion and her vision. To help keep overhead costs low and to maximize the real estate, at night the space will transform into a setting for art shows and fundraisers featuring local artists and popular neighborhood vendors. She hopes to host a fundraiser for her son’s school, which, like other schools across California, faces serious budget cuts.

Upon purchasing the salon space last year, a friend referred her to the small business section in City Hall where she found Women’s Initiative for Self Employment, and Opportunity Fund. Georgia will use this $10,000 loan from Opportunity Fund to become an authorized vendor of the Bumble and Bumble product lines and to purchase salon furniture.

loans.use: To buy inventory and furniture for her hair salon

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with two children, both adults. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

Esther has been operating a restaurant for seven years, her other sources of income being from her husband and her son. Her restaurant is located near a school and her potential customers are school children and passersby. She cites theft as her major challenge in her business.

Esther decided to join Yehu to obtain the loan to help her upgrade and expand her business. With the Kshs 30,000 loan she hopes to renovate her restaurant and buy new plates, jugs, jiko (a metal or ceramic charcoal stove), tables and chairs.

Esther hopes to have a bigger restaurant in future and also to have at least two branches operating.

loans.use: To renovate her restaurant and add utensils to be used for cooking

loans.name: Pheresher

texts.en:
Pheresher is a married woman with one daughter who is in junior school. Pheresher rents a house with electricity but no piped water; her greatest monthly expense is food.

Pheresher has been selling charcoal for the last three years, her other source of income being her husband’s salary. She decided to work with Yehu in order to uplift her business. With the Ksh 40,000 loan, she would like to add stock, pay unskilled labor, and obtain a permit for transporting charcoal.

Pheresher sells her products wholesale and retail, at the market and door to door. Her customers are neighbors, food venders and small-scale charcoal sellers. Her main challenges are high transport costs and seasonality.

Pheresher’s goal is to own a lorry (truck) for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a sack of charcoal, pay unskilled labour and obtain a business permit

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz B. es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, se encuentran en su tercer ciclo en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga del sector, vive en la comunidad de Guayan, que pertenece a la parroquia de Zhidmad, ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, la agricultura y la ganadería son las actividades a las que se dedican los pobladores de esta parroquia, su iglesia parroquial es el principal atractivo turístico, en ella se guardan reliquias muy antiguas. El mirador del Cerro Borma, donde se encuentra una pirámide de los militares, es otro hermoso lugar para disfrutar de la naturaleza.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre y de esta unión ha concebido 5 hijos quines se encuentran de 15, 10, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda en la economía de la casa, sus tres hijos siguientes están en la escuela y su último hijo pasa en la guardería, su esposo trabaja como empelado del municipio, hace poco termino de construir su casa propia.

La Sra. Luz se dedica a la cría de animales como vacas, chanchos, gallinas los mismo que vende en su comunidad, esta actividad le da la oportunidad de estar con sus hijos en casa, también se dedica a la agricultura. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus cultivos, su meta es de llegar a tener una mejor fuente de ingresos para que todos sus hijos estudien y se superen en la vida, también desea hacerle un poco mas grande a su casa para que todos sus hijos cuenten con un cuarto independiente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz B. is a member of the communal bank “14 de Agosto”. She is in her third loan cycle in the communal bank and was invited by one of her friends from the sector. She lives in the Guayan community, in the Zhidmad parish, southwest of the Gualaceo Canton. The residents of this parish work in agriculture and livestock. Their parish church is the main tourist attraction; in it are kept very ancient relics. The Cerro Borma viewpoint, where there is a military pyramid, is another beautiful place to enjoy nature. Mrs. Luz B. is 32 years old, married and has 5 children who are 15, 10, 8, 6, and 4. Their oldest child works and helps with the household expenses. The following three children are in school and the youngest child is in daycare. Her husband works for the town and recently finished building their own house. Mrs. Luz raises animals such as cows, pigs, chickens, the same that are sold in her community. This activity gives her the opportunity to be home with her children. She also works in agriculture. With the money from the loan, she is going to invest in fertilizer for her crops. Her goal is to have a better source of income so that all of her children can study and excel in their lives. Also, she wants to expand their house a little bit so that all of her children can have their own room.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
la sra. Macaria I.  G. es una señora muy alegre y dispuesta a salir adelante junto con su familia.
Macaria vive en el barrio Las Delicias de Langue Valle. a vivido ahí toda su vida junto con su esposo el señor Rosali Meza Canales. Macaria se dedica al destazo de cerdos y a la venta de carne, este negocio lo realiza desde hace varios años. Dice que vende todo los dias y le va muy bien sus hijos la mayoria radican en los estados unidos, y a veces le apoyan economicamente.
su mayor deseo es tener mas clientes que le compren su producto y que su negocio siga creciendo dia a dia.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas cerdos para criarlos y luego destazarlos.
texts.en:
Macaria I. G. is a very happy woman who is determined to get ahead with her family. Macaria lives in the Las Delicias de Langue Valle neighborhood. She has lived there all of her life with her husband, Rosali Meza Canales. Macaria butchers pigs and sells the meat. She has been in this business for several years. She says that she sells everyday, and it is going very well for her. Most of her children live in the United States. Sometimes they help her economically. Her greatest wish is to have more customers to buy her product. She also wishes that her business continues to grow day to day. She will use the loan to buy more pigs to raise and later butcher.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Mercedes M. A., es una joven soltera de 23 años de edad que habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, ella es decoradora aun no forma familia, pues planifica tener una mejor estabilidad socioeconómica para ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida a los suyos.

Ella vienen de una familia muy humilde, ahora que ella goza de sus propios ingresos y  solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, que le permitan  construir un muro en la que cierre una división de su cuarto y pueda gozar de su propia independencia, esto le traerá la satisfacción personal de disfrutar de su espacio y el respeto de toda su familia, espera le apoyen en la evolución se sus metas personales y profesionales para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y apoyar a su familia que tanto necesita de su resguardo.
texts.en:
Gloria Mercedes M. A., 23, is a young single woman who lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. She is a decorator and still hasn’t formed a family of her own because she wants to have better economic stability to offer better living conditions to her loved ones. She comes from a very humble family. Now that she earns her own income, she’d like a loan to buy building materials and supplies in order to build a wall to close off her bedroom so that she can have her own privacy. This will provide her with independence and personal satisfaction while enjoying her personal space and the respect of all her family. She hopes she will be supported in her personal and professional goals in order to improve her living conditions and help her family that so much needs her protection.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Luisa Elizabeth

texts.es: La soicitante cuenta con un transporte (automovil), la cual la conduce su sobrino en forma diaria. Su conyugue le da una pension voluntaria la cual no ha sido considerada. Vive en casa propia, cuenta con buena acumulacion de bienes. El destino del credito  es para necesidad´personal y reparacion de su automovil
texts.en:
Our associate counts on her nephew to drive her daily. Her husband gives her an allowance that has not been considered. She lives in her own home. She is asking for this loan in order to take care of some personal expenses, including repairing her automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with one son who has just begun school. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water and her greatest monthly expenses are rent and food.

Naomi informs us that she has been operating a beauty salon for the past five years and has no other source of income. She decided to work with Yehu in order to obtain a loan and improve her business. With the Ksh 30,000 she hopes to pay for electrical wiring, pay her electricity bill and also purchase a blowdryer. She tells us further that she sells her products to retailers and neighbors, who are her potential clients.

Naomi’s main challenge is high competition from other salon operators. She would like to have a high-class beauty salon in future where clients receive high-quality services.

loans.use: To pay for electrical wiring, pay her electricity bill and purchase a blowdryer

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
la señora Balbina G. tiene 55 años de edad es originaria de Langue Valle,  a pasado toda su vida en ese lugar dedicandose junto con su esposo el señor Ramiro Tobar al comercio, actividad con la cual han podido salir adelante y darles estudio a sus hijos.
junto con su esposo pagan los estudios de su hija que estudia medicina, tambien tiene una hija que es maestra y recibe ayuda de ella.
La señora Balbina G. se ha dedicado al negocio de las golosinas como ser venta de baleadas, avena con leche,
panqueques y café ademas hace tamales de gallina y cerdo para vender por las tardes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para hacer sus golosinas.
su sueño es ver graduada a su hija que estudia medicina.
texts.en:
Balbina Gómez, 55, is from Langue Valle; she has spent her entire life there as a merchant with her husband, Ramiro Tobar; this activity has made it possible for them to get ahead in life and to educate their children. With her husband’s help she is paying for her daughter’s medical education; she also has a daughter who’s a teacher and she helps her out too. Balbina Gómez has sold sweets, baleadas [the basic baleada is a thick flour tortilla folded in half containing refried beans and grated queso duro (a hard salty white cheese), and mantequilla (a white sauce much like sour cream], oatmeal with milk, pancakes and coffee; she also makes chicken and pork tamales to sell in the evening. She will use the funds to buy more ingredients to make her snacks. Her dream is to see her daughter who is studying medicine graduate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking oil, milk, oatmeal, meats, tortillas, beans, bread, soft-drinks.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group Jehova es mi Pastor (God is my Pastor), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children.

Lucia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cosmetics by purchasing Avon and Abel beauty products as well as perfumes, creams and women's underwear. She will use the profits to continue investing in her business, with the long-term goal of saving towards purchasing her own home. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products from Avon and Abel, perfumes, cremes and women's underwear to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with six children, three attending lower classes while three are in high school.

Dorothy has been selling roasted meat for the last three months – neighbors and passersby are her day-to-day customers. She narrates how she earned her other source of income from her previous occupation of operating a beauty salon and also from her husband’s income.

With the Kshs 40,000, Dorothy wants to start selling fresh meat and roasted meat, to put up a stall and buy more cooking utensils. She sells her products retail and at a market place. Her major challenge is not being in a position to access frequent meat suppliers – hence not meeting customer daily demand in a competitive market.

Dorothy decided to join Yehu so that she can modify her business and improve her living standard. She proudly showed her own house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

Dorothy hopes to open up a butcher shop someday and be able to satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To start selling fresh and roasted meat, to put up a stall, and to buy more cooking utensils

loans.name: Juana Lissette

texts.es: Juana Lissette tiene 39 años, su actividad económica es una abarrotería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionar el sustento diario a su familia, ella ha sido una madre responsable y disfruta realizando su trabajo, ha concebido 3 hijos que se encuentran todos están menores de edad. Inicia sus labores desde las 8 Am hasta las 6 Pm pues también asiste a un colegio para ofrecer sus productos a menores de edad que asisten a este centro. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, bolsas, pan, galletas y gaseosas. Sueña con tener un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old and has been running a small grocery store for more than eight years. She has always worked to provide for her family and is a responsible mother who enjoys her work. She has three young children. She begins work at 8:00 am and works until 6:00 pm. She also helps out at a school in order to be able to offer her products to young children who also help. She will use the money from this loan to buy inventory items, such as sweets, bags, bread, cookies, and soft drinks. Someday she would like a lot on which to have a home built.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Angel Z. tiene 64 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 5 hijos, Angel se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, 
don angel se desplaza todos los dias de su casa al negocio ya que el vive en una comunidad que se llama los Llanos de Langue para atender su negocio en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta basica familiar.
como ser granos basicos, refrescos, dulce, mecates, bolsas.
este negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años, 
a podido sacar adelante a su familia. el credito lo utilizara para invertilo en mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Angel Z., age 64, is married and has 5 children. He is engaged in the sale of popular consumer products. Don Angel lives in a community called Llanos de Langue.

Every day, he leaves his house in order to operate his business, where he sells a variety of basic household items such as bulk grains, soft drinks, sweets, rope, and bags. He has been in this business several years and has been able to get ahead. He will use the loan to invest in merchandise in order to stock more in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of butter, beans, rice, tortillas, wheat and corn flour, soaps, milk, candles, and matches.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with two children who both attend school. She has been frying fish for sale for the past six years as wholesale, retail, at the market, from door to door and from home. She sells to her immediate neighbors. With the Ksh 20,000 she would like to add stock and pay the deposit for a stall at the market to use for selling fish. Her major challenge is the high cost of transporting fish from fresh water catchment areas. 

Pamela rents a house without electricity or piped water, citing transport as her greatest monthly expense.  Pamela hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the market in future.

loans.use: Buy stock and pay  rent for stall used for selling at the market

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.es:
el señor Petronilo C. García tiene 65 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Maria Angela García  quienes se dedican a atender un negocito que tienen en su casa de habitacion en el cual venden refrescos, arroz, maiz, bolsas, condimentos, cafe, pan etc.
don Petronilo a pesar de que ya tiene varios años es una persona inteligente, formal, trabajadora y muy honrada que se dedica mucho a su negocio.
ademas cultiva maiz en la epoca de invierno.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir su negocio.
Su mayor deseo es que su familia este bien de salud.
texts.en:
Mr. Petronilo C. García is sixty-five years old and lives with his partner Mrs.Maria Angela García. They run a small home-business selling drinks, rice, corn, bags, condiments, coffee, bread etc. Mr. Petronilo, in spite of the fact that he is older, is a very intelligent, formal, hard-working, and honorable person, who puts a lot of effort into his business. He also cultivates corn during the winter season. He will use the loan to stock his business. His greatest desire is for his family to be in good health.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural medicine, beans, rice, bags, corn, coffee, bread, drinks, condiments, and  rope.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Santos M. M. tiene 62 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, todos ya se casaron, una vive en los estados unidos de quien recibe remesas cada mes.
Maria vive en la Aldea Bajos de la Flor Langue Valle, tiene mas de 57 años de vivir ahí.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar refrescos al por mayor, desde hace unos años tambien vende granos basicos al por mayor
su deseo es que las ventas se mejoren ya que debido a las constantes lluvias las ventas estan bajas.
\
texts.en:
Maria Santos M. M. is 62 years old. She is single and has no dependant children as they have all already married. One of them lives in the USA and sends her money every month. Maria has lived in Aldea Bajos de la Flor Langue Valle for over 57 years. She will use the loan to buy soft drinks in bulk. She has also been selling basic grains in bulk for a few years. She hopes that sales will improve as they are currently down due to the constant rain.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris has been operating a green grocery for 5 years. She has one child who goes to school, and her husband is a businessman. In addition she runs another business selling cosmetics and CDs as her other source of income. Ladies and all the villagers are her potential customers. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she would like to build a permanent stall and sell her products retail, at the market and door to door. She cites high competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Peris hopes to sell her products wholesale in future. She decided to join Yehu so as to get loan and expand her business. Peris owns a home with electricity but no piped water, her greatest monthly expense being food.

loans.use: To build a stall to sell her goods

loans.name: Ángela Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Ángela del Carmen M. B. tiene la edad de 41 años habita en un barrio humilde llamado San juan, es casada y su esposo es comerciante, le apoya a los trabajos y gastos del hogar. Tienen 3 hijos y son estudiantes, pero en sus tiempos libres le apoyan en los trabajos del campo y las tareas del hogar, ella se dedica a la agricultura de la piña, desde hace 12 años, pero desde hace 6 años heredo unas tierras que se han convertido en el sustento de la familia, fue con el apoyo de su padre quien la inicio en los conocimiento de esta actividad y fue por su ahorro y esfuerzo propio que comenzó a cosechara sus propiedades. 

Uno de las principales ideas que tienen en pro de sus  ingresos, es la diversificación de las siembras y realizar un trabajo de conservación del suelo para futuros proyectos de siembra,  para esto solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales e insumos vegetativos y plaguicidas que a medida avancen con el buen mantenimiento de los terrenos a fin que mejoren los ingresos del hogar para futuros proyectos.
texts.en:
Ángela is 41 years old and lives in a neighborhood called San Juan. She is married and her husband is a businessman who helps with the household chores and expenses. They have three children who are all students, but in their free time they also help with the work in the fields and the home. Ángela has been raising pineapple for the past 12 years, but she inherited some land six years ago, which she converted to be able to provide support to her family. It was her father who taught her this activity and she began with her savings. One of the ideas she has for increasing her income is to diversify her crops and to preserve some of the farmland for future plantings. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy some materials, supplies, insecticides, and fungicides in order to maintain the land so that is can produce more. This will allow her to increase her revenue so that she can save for future projects.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Jesus Roberto

texts.es: El cliente es soltero, tiene una hija de 12 años la cual vive con su madre. El solicitante vive con su madre en donde tiene su negocio de fabricacion de artesanias (cajitas para licores). El destino del credito es para compra de maquinarias para mejorar su trabajo y madera para tener mayor produccion.
texts.en:
Our associate has a 12 year old daughter who lives with her mother. He lives with his mother, where he runs a business manufacturing liquor boxes. He will use the money from this loan to buy tools in order to improve his craftsmanship and production.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools

loans.name: Sigamos Creciendo Group

texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Sigamos Creciendo” and it is made up of 15 members (14 women and 1 man) who live in the Victoria community of the city of Temuco.  Their businesses are, primarily, selling dried fruits and nuts, used clothing, vegetables and salads, desserts, and doing sewing.

The group member interviewed was Edith, who is the group’s president.  In the photo she is pictured in the third row on the left, wearing a gray sweater over a red shirt.  From her home she runs a business selling pinecones and firewood.  

Edith posts advertisements in places like schools and restaurants around her community.  After the forests around Temuco are cut for timber there are many pieces of wood and pinecones left, so she pays people to go in and collect this for her.  She has been doing this business for approximately three years. Edith will invest this loan in a chainsaw because she and her husband also cut wood themselves.

Edith’s greatest motivation is to maintain the health and well-being of her family, especially of her three children who are 15, 11, and 10, because with only her husband’s income they are unable to make ends meet. She is content working with Fondo Esperanza, because it has been a great support for her and for her business.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: To buy a chainsaw

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro de 53 años, es casado vive en una pequeña casa a pesar que es humilde vive con las comodidades necesarias. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de medicamento, siente que todavía le falta mucho por emprender, y recuerda lo mucho que le ha costado ser un buen comerciante, pues todos los días sube a los buses para ofrecer sus productos él, tiene que mostrar mucho conocimiento con lo que ofrece el lee enciclopedia, diccionarios, revistas y tras cosas.  Para el futuro les gustaría establecer su propia tienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio. El dinero lo invertirá en comprar más cantidad de mercadería con el propósito de ofrecer diferente productos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 53 years old. He is married and lives in a small humble home with the necessary comforts. For more than 20 years he has been in the business of selling medications. He feels that he still has a long way to go as an entrepreneur and remembers what is has taken for him to become a good businessman. Each day he boards busses to sell his products. He needs to be very knowledgeable about what he sells, so he reads encyclopedias, dictionaries, magazines, and other literature. In future he would like to establish his own store so that he can offer better service. He will use the money from this loan to buy products in bulk, so that he can offer a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
la sra. Digna A. se dedica la venta de ropa nueva, como ser camisas, camisetas, ropa interior etc,  no tiene dependientes sus hijos todos estan casados.
su esposo Juan Mejia se dedica a la agricultura.
Digna tiene el negocio desde hace varios años, nos comento que con este negocio a podido darles estudio a sus hijos que hoy son profesionales.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de ropa por que en el pueblo hay una actividad 
en donde la gente viene a comprar de otras partes de Langue y necesita tener variedad para poder cumplir las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Digna A. sells new clothing like shirts, t-shirts, underwear, etc. She does not have any dependents, as her children are all married. Her husband, Juan Mejia, works in agriculture. Digna has run her business for several years. She notes that this business allowed her to send her children to school, so today they are professionals. She will use this loan to purchase clothing, because there is an event in her town where people come from other parts of Langue to shop. Digna needs to have a variety of merchandise to meet her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, dresses, underwear, t-shirts, shorts, socks

loans.name: Marco Aurelio

texts.es:
el señor Marco Aurelio D. S. tiene 37 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de achineria, vive en union libre con la señora Maria S. Mejia con quien a procreado 4 hijos. tambien tienen una pulperia en su casa de habitacion la cual es atendida por Maria Mejia.

poco a poco han ido mejorando su condicion de vida para el y la de su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir el negocio ya que en esta epoca el pueblo tiene una actividad donde las ventas se mejoran, muchas personas vienen de varios pueblos aledaños a comprar cosas.
texts.en:
Marco Aurelio D. S. is 37 years old, and has a business selling low-cost consumer goods. He lives in a common-law marriage with Maria S. Mejia, with whom he has fathered 4 children. In addition, he has a grocery store in his home which is attended to by Maria Mejia. Gradually he has been improving the living conditions of his family. This loan will be used to restock his store, since in this season this town has an activity where the sales increase; many people come from the various surrounding towns to buy things.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calculators, cellular phone cases, chargers, toys, batteries, deodorants, dolls, hats, colas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Carolina C. C., es una joven de 32 años que habita en el Barrio Dennis Larios, es casada y su esposo labora como comerciante, con sus 2 hijos menores de edad habitan en una humilde morada puesto que son una familia de escasos recursos que se dedican a la agricultura de piña con más de 15 años  de experiencia.

Dentro de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado en su negocio ha sido la afectación de plagas, tanto así que les tiene maltratada los terrenos, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales que brinden un mantenimiento fitosanitario  y  mejore las cosechas  para brindar optimas condiciones económicas para toda la familia. En otras ocaciones Afodenic con apoyo de los fondos Kiva han podido apoyar a la familia y su mejoraría continua ha sido rápida por la buena administración de la señora, tiene la certeza que esta ayuda será aun mas productiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Carolina C. C. is 32 years old and lives in the Dennis Larios neighborhood. She is married and her husband works as a shopkeeper. They live in a humble home with their 2 young children (since they are a family of meager means), and they have 15 years' experience in the cultivation of pineapple. One of the main problems she is faced with in her business has been the effects of plant diseases that have battered the land. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan for the purchase of materials that will allow her to maintain her plants and improve her harvests, in order to obtain the best economic conditions for her family. On other occasions, AFODENIC has been able to help the C. family with the aid of Kiva funds, and their continuous improvement has been rapid because of the good administration of Mrs. C.. She is certain that this help will be even more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials that will aid plant cultivation

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y ha sabido aprovechar sus financiamientos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio como es la venta de ropa ambulante el crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercadería por lo que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos y quiere sufragar la demanda que tiene de parte de sus clientes, es muy trabajador siempre velando el bienestar de su familia, pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona luchadora y trabajadora. Desea seguir creciendo con este negocio poco a poco.
texts.en:
Alexander Antonio has collaborated with the Fundación for a long time and has taken advantage of the financing. For over 8 years he has been an itinerant clothing merchant. The requested funds will be used to buy merchandise because he has several pending orders and he wants to meet customer demand. He is very hard-working and is always watchful of his family’s wellbeing; he has always been a fighter and a worker. He wants to continue growing with his business little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Delia Yolanda

texts.es:
La Sra. Delia C. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la más hermosa del Ecuador, por sus calles, sus iglesias, su gastronomía, y su gente que es muy cordial y amable.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de fantasías como son lasos, moños binchas, etc., actividad que realiza hace 12 años, trabaja de lunes a domingo sin descansar un solo día, trabaja de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. y su mercadería la vende en la vereda de una calle de la ciudad.

La Sra. Delia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos, quienes se encuentran de 35, 30 y 22 años de edad, su primara hija trabaja con su abuelita y vive haciéndole compañía, su segundo hijo es casado y vive de manera independiente y su última hija estudia en la universidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando, su esposo trabaja en un taller de hierro y bronce.

 Nuestra socia se encuentra en su sexto ciclo, fue invitada por una amiga del bankito para que con los prestamos vaya creciendo en su negocio, con su nuevo crédito va a implementar mas mercaderia para su negocio,  su meta es llegar a tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Delia C. is a member of the El Ahorro Communal Bank. She lives is the city of Cuenca. This city is considered to be the most beautiful in Ecuador because of its streets, its churches, its food, and the very friendly and kind people. Our member sells adornments like ribbons, bows, and headbands, etc. She has been doing this for 12 years. She works from Monday to Sunday without resting even one day. She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. She sells her merchandise on the sidewalk by a street in the city. Delia is 52, married, and has three children. The children are 35, 30, and 22 years old. Her first daughter works with her grandmother and keeps her company. Her second child is married and lives independently. Her last daughter is studying in the university. She does not have her own house, so she rents where she lives. Her husband works in an iron and bronze shop. Our member is in her sixth cycle. She was invited by a friend in the bank so that her business would grow with the loans. She will use the new loan to stock more merchandise for her business. Her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ribbons, headbands, tiaras, and other hair accessories

loans.name: Maria Ferminda

texts.es: la señora Maria Ferminda D. tiene 29 años de edad,  esta casada y tiene 4 hijos. su marido se dedica la agricultura. Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para vestir y casual. con este negocio a salido adelante con su familia, el credito lo utilizara para surtir un poco su negocio ya que esta en la epoca en la comunidad de Langue se celebra una actividad donde se vende bastante ya que llegan personas de todos los lugares cercanos de Langue a comprar y a celebrar esta actividad.
texts.en:
María Ferminda Díaz, 29, is married and has 4 children; her husband is a farmer. María sells new casual and dressy clothing. This business has made it possible for her to move her family ahead in life. She will use the funds to stock her business because this is a season when the Langue community has an event during which sales are high because people come in from the outlying areas to participate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eliezer Enmanuel

texts.es:
El señor Eliezer Enmanuel D. C., es un joven de 24 años, que habita en el Barrio Las Enramadas, con su novia, tienen un hijo de 5 años que estudia el preescolar, es agente de ventas, y su pareja se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda, apoyándole en los gastos del hogar.

Trabaja en este rubro desde hace 2 años, sus ingresos son bastante limitados que no le han permitido realizar la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de edificar su vivienda, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo y poder ofrecerles a su familia mejores condiciones que beneficien al desarrollo social de sus vidas, son una familia que comienza a edificar sus formas de habitad y sobrevivencia, por tanto esperan se les apoye a mejorar sus condiciones socioeconomicas y sobretodo poder ofrecerles a su hijo los recursos necesarios para desarrollarse en un ambiente mas digno.
texts.en:
Eliezer Enmanuel D. C., 24, is a young man who lives in the Las Enramadas neighborhood with his girl friend and their 5-year-old son who is in preschool. He is a sales agent and his girlfriend sells used clothing to help him meet household expenses. He has been in this line of work for two years but his income is quite limited. So much so, that he has been unable to afford to buy building materials and supplies to finish building his house. For this reason, wanting to provide his family with better living conditions that will promote their social development, and being a family that is starting to develop their style of living and surviving, they hope they will be supported in their efforts to improve their socioeconomic conditions, especially in order to provide their son with the necessary resources to develop in a more proper environment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build his house.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Víctor (50) y a sus 4 hijos, de los 5 que tiene, pues el mayor vive independiente.Se dedica al cultivo de plátano, achiote, café, yuca y maíz en sus terrenos propios, además  produce  algodón, pues observa que en la zona donde vive se desarrolla bien este producto. Le gusta mantener limpias sus plantaciones porque asegura, que así les proporciona espacio suficiente para que disfruten de los  nutrientes que tiene la tierra, sin embargo, le resulta pesado caminar varias horas para llegar a sus chacras porque se encuentran alejadas de su vivienda. Lleva 30 años dedicada a la agricultura y ha logrado vivir tranquila sin pasar necesidades porque su oficio es muy rentable, ya que con las ganancias ha comprado las hectáreas de terreno que tiene. Para mas adelante  tiene planeado plantar  mayor cantidad de productos, como el plátano que cosecha cada quince días, y le genera rápidas ganancias.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ante los integrantes de su banco comunal,  promete ser cumplida en cada uno de sus pagos.Flora tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas agrícolas  (machetes, picos y palas) que necesita, además  destinara otra parte para la paga  a los operarios pues necesita  que limpien sus chacras.
texts.en:
Flora, 40, lives in her own home with her husband, Víctor, 50, and four of their five children; the oldest lives independently. She farms banana, achiote (lipstick tree), coffee, manioc and corn on her own farmlands. She also farms cotton because she has noticed that this crop grows well in the area where she lives. She likes to keep her plots weed-free because she is convinced that by keeping her plants clear and well-spaced they can better take advantage of the nutrients in the soil. However, it is a chore to walk for several hours to get to her fields because they are located far from her home. She has been farming for 30 years and has managed to live a peaceful life lacking none of the basics because farming is profitable. She has used profits from it to buy the lands she owns. For later on she plans to plant larger amounts of product, like banana that’s harvested every two weeks and produces profits. This is her first loan from MFP and she pledges to her fellow communal bank members to repay in a timely fashion. Flora will use the requested funds to buy farm tools (machetes, shovels and pickaxes) that she needs and will use part of the funds to pay field hands she needs to clear her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and pay field hands.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
La Sra. María Pérez es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada la ciudad más hermosa del Ecuador,  por sus calles, sus iglesias, su gastronomía, y su gente que es muy cordial y amable.

La Sra. María tiene 41 años de edad es casada, tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 19, 17, 15 y 13 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan para la economía del hogar y sus dos últimos hijo estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja como comerciante de varios productos, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de fantasías y bisutería, actividad que la realiza hace 20 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana sin descansar, labora desde las 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., y sus productos los vende recorriendo el mercado 9 de Octubre en Cuenca.

 Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo,  los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando mas productos de bisutería, su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio para superarse con su familia.
texts.en:
María Pérez, 41, is a member of the El Ahorro (The Savings) communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca considered to be Ecuador’s most beautiful city because of its streets, churches, gastronomy and cordial, kind residents. She’s married and has 4 children who are 19, 17, 15 and 13 years of age. The two oldest are employed and contribute to the family’s finances and the two youngest go to school in the city. Her husband is a merchant; he sells a variety of products. She does not own her own house, she rents. Our member is a costume jewelry merchant; she has been in this line of work for twenty years and works every day of the week with no time off from 9am until 5pm. She sells her products up and down the aisles in Cuenca’s 9 de Octubre market. She is in her 3rd loan cycle. The past loans have helped her business grow and she will use the new loan to buy more costume jewelry. Her goal is to continue growing in her business in order to get ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry: rings, earrings, necklaces, etc.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emérita de 45 años, tiene 5 hijos y solamente 3 hijos están a su cargo y trabajan de manera independiente. Su actividad es la venta de calzado, ropa y pulpería. Con todo su esfuerzo que realiza ha logrado proporcionarles a sus hijos los estudios necesaR.. Hace más de 18 años que tiene este negocio, con la buena administración que ha sabido proporcionarle y poco a poco ha ido creciendo por lo que trabajo desde las 7 de la mañana a las 7 de la noche, por lo que ya esta hora dejan de pasar sus clientes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar calzado, ropa para damas, ropa para caballeros, ropa para niños y vestidos. Para en el futuro quiere que su negocio sea un poco mas grande.
texts.en:
Emérita, 45, has 5 children but only three are still under her care and work independently. She sells clothing, shoes and has a grocery store. Her effort has made it possible for her to provide her children with an education. She has had this business for over 18 years and the good administration she’s given it has allowed it to gradually grow. She is open from 7am until 7pm which is when her customers finally stop coming by. She will use the funds to buy shoes, ladies’ clothing, clothing for gentlemen, clothes for children and dresses. For the future she’d like her business to be a bit larger.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Jaqueline De Paz

texts.es:
Jaqueline de la Paz E., tiene 46 años, reside en Jucuapa del departamento de Usulután, es madre soltera vive con su único hijo de 19 años de edad y una hermana, ella tiene un local de venta de café y comida.
Su madre le enseño sobre el negocio, y hace 10 años tiene su cafetín que está ubicado en la unidad de salud de Jucuapa, y atiende a sus clientes en un horario de 6: am -4:00 pm, ella vende pan dulce, café, refrescos carbonatados, jugos naturales y otros productos. Este negocio es el que le permite solventar las primeras necesidades de su familia, y apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios.
Jaqueline, es una persona responsable y trabajadora que ha  manejado su negocio muy bien, y ella necesita un préstamo para invertir en compra productos como son Harina de maíz, queso, carne, aceite, gas, para elaborar tortillas con estos productos y también comprar agua embolsa, jugos y otros artículos que le demandan sus clientes.
Las aspiraciones de Jaqueline son que con el dinero del préstamo invertir y obtener ganancias, dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaqueline de la Paz E. is 46 years old and lives in Jucuapa in the department of Usulután. She is a single mother who lives with her only son, who is 19 years old, and her sister. She has a store where she sells coffee and food. Her mother taught her about business, and for ten years she has had her cafe, which is located in the health clinic in Jucuapa. She serves her customers from 6:00am to 4:00pm. She sells pastries, coffee, carbonated drinks, natural juices, and other products. This business is what allows her to provide the necessities for her family and support her son with his studies. Jaqueline is a responsible and hardworking person who has run her business very well. She needs a loan in order to invest in the purchase of products like corn flour, cheese, meat, oil, and gas (propane) in order to make tortillas with these products, and also buy bottled water, juices, and other things that her customers ask for. Jacueline's aspirations are to invest the loan money and earn money, provide a better service to her customers, and to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Hilza T. D. 48 años D. edad  tiene 2 hijos D. 20 y 14 años integra la Alcancía Comunal  Virgen D. Chapí D. Yanacoto  conformado por 9 socias que se dedican a labores diferentes.
Hilza se inicio en el negocio D. la venta ambulatoria D. queso, ella los trae D. la parte D. la sierra  y los venD., al transcurrir el tiempo decidió  invertir en un negocio que le pueda ofrecer un mejor ingreso y empezó a vender en su domicilio gaseosas y cervezas, este actual préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. 6  cajas D. gaseosas y 7 cajas D. cervezas.
Los planes que tiene en mente  y está segura que lo lograra,  es D. poder abrir en una  tienda con la venta D. todos los productos como son  abarrotes, golosinas, gaseosas y cervezas, y sobre todo apoyara sus dos hijos que aun están estudiando.
texts.en:
Hilza T. is 48 years old and has 2 children, aged 14 and 20. She is a member of the communal bank "Virgen D. Chapí D. Yanacoto," which is maD. up of 9 members who work in different areas. Hilza started her business as a street vendor selling cheese. She brings cheese from one part of the sierra and sells it. Over time she decided to invest in a business that offered a better income, so she started selling soft drinks and beer from her home. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of 6 crates of soft drinks and 7 cases of beer. The plans she has in mind, that she is sure she will make happen, are to open a store where she can sell all kinds of products such as groceries, snacks, soft drinks and beer, and most of all, to support her two children who are studying.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 6 cases of soft drinks and 7 cases of beer

loans.name: Desarrollo Rural Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Desarrollo Rural inicia su quinto ciclo con 16 socias, el Bancomunal está ubicado en una comunidad del departamento D. Huancavelica, su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y Comercio.
Martha es socia del Bancomunal Desarrollo Rural, este ciclo está apoyando en la Junta directiva con el cargo D. Secretaria, Martha es casada y tiene 2 hijos varones, el mayor D. 13 años está en el colegio y el menor D. 3 años está en PRONOE (Programa no escolarizado D. Educación).
Martha se inició en los negocios hace 11 años vendiendo abarrotes, poco a poco y gracias a los préstamos recibidos a podido ir incrementando su negocio. Actualmente tiene problemas D. salud, pero se está tratando. Gracias a las reuniones D. su bancomunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, las capacitaciones le han ayudado mucho. El préstamo que está solicitándolo utilizará para invertir en su negocio con la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad.
El sueño D. Martha es tener casa propia y poner un negocio D. cabinas D. internet.
texts.en:
The “Desarrollo Rural” (Rural Development) communal bank is starting its fifth cycle with 16 members. It is located in a community in Huancavelica department whose main commercial activities are farming and commerce. Martha is a member and during this cycle she is acting as Secretary on the governing board. She is married and has two sons. The oldest, 13, is in school and the youngest, 3, is in PRONOE (a non-school-based educational program). Martha started selling groceries 11 years ago. Gradually, thanks to loans, she has been able to expand her business. Currently she has some health problems but she is receiving treatment. Thanks to the meetings in her communal bank she has learned how to save; the training sessions have been much help to her. The loan she is requesting will be used to invest in her business buying basic needs items. Martha’s dream is to own her own home and to set up an Internet access business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 35 años, vive con su esposo  Wilfredo (38), y sus 2 menores hijos, en  su casa propia, ubicada en la sierra peruana.Se dedica a la venta de comida  todos los domingos durante las mañanas, y como es una persona hábil, desde hace 6 meses, encontró trabajo como lavandera en un hotel de su ciudad. En este trabajo gana 119 soles mensuales, además lava de manera independiente, con esto puede cubrir sus gastos domésticos y con el dinero que gana su esposo, como músico, puede invertir en la educación de sus hijos. De su trabajo le gusta enjuagar la ropa y ver como queda  reluciente, por otro lado, le disgusta planchar, porque está labor requiere de mayor cuidado. Con los ahorros que tiene planea instalar un restaurante en un lugar comercial de su ciudad.Este es el octavo préstamo, que tiene con MFP, y como siempre se muestra entusiasta porque seguirá trabajando en su banco comunal, con las personas que aprecia y respeta por su responsabilidad y perseverancia.Lucy tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos que necesita para preparar  alimentos, durante los fines de semana, pues quiere venderlos en la esquina de su casa, para generar más ingresos,pues  busca una adecuada calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucy, 35, lives with her husband, Wilfredo, 38, and their two minor children in her own home located in the Peruvian mountains. She sells prepared meals every Sunday morning. Because she’s a skilled person, 6 months ago she also found employment as a laundress in a hotel in her city. This job pays 119 soles a month. She also takes in laundry independently. What she earns is enough to cover household expenses and her husband’s salary as a musician can be used to pay for her children’s education. What she enjoys about her work is rinsing the clothes and seeing how bright they turn out. On the other hand, she dislikes ironing because this requires much more care. She plans to use her savings to set up an eatery in a commercial area of the city. This is her 8th loan with MFP and, as usual, she is enthusiastic to continue working with her communal bank; she respects and likes her fellow members because they are responsible and perseverant. Lucy plans to use the requested funds to buy ingredients she needs to prepare meals that she plans to sell on weekends at the corner where she lives to produce more income because she is looking for ways to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Karen Gisela

texts.es: Desde hace más de 3 años la Joven Karen Gisela, que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, lo que le significo un paso muy importante en su vida pues tenía la responsabilidad de mantener a su hijo menor de edad que está a su cargo. Desde un principio ella inicio con muy poco capital y productos, pues salía a ofrecerlos a sus vecinos con el paso del tiempo ella llego a ser reconocida en su comarca. Ella en la actualidad necesita su crédito para comprar artículos en promociones, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por el momento. Su sueño es convertirse en una buena vendedora y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda pues las necesita.
texts.en:
Karen Gisela has sold general merchandise for over 3 years; this was an important step for her to take in life because she has the responsibility of caring for her young son who is under her care. At the beginning she started out with little capital and not much merchandise that she would go out and try to sell door-to-door among her neighbors in her area; in time she became well-known in her area. She needs funding to buy merchandise on sale because she has a lot of pending orders at the moment. Her dream is to become a good seller and make some needed home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise on sale.

loans.name: Elvia Marlene

texts.es:
La Sra. Elvia L. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, hace 5 años fue invitada por su amiga que pertenece al banco comunal y le esta muy agradecida ya que a logrado crecer poco a poco en su negocio, se dedica a la venta de bolsitas y bisutería, vende recorriendo los mercados de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., son ya 18 años con este negocio.

Nuestra socia vive por un bello sector como es San Pedro del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la ciudad más hermosa del Ecuador, por sus calles, sus iglesias, su gastronomía, y su gente que es muy cordial y amable.

Tiene 46 años de edad, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 27, 25, 20 y 12 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos viven en unión libre y en su casa compartiendo gastos y su último hijo estudia en la escuela, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

 El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en mercadería para su negocio, su mayor sueño es ver a su mamá con salud.
texts.en:
Elvia L. is a member of the El Ahorro (The Savings) communal bank. She was invited to join five years ago by a girl friend who is a member. She is very grateful to her because her business has grown gradually. She sells little bags and costume jewelry at the city’s markets. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 7am until 6pm. She has been in this line of work for 18 years already. She lives in a beautiful area called San Pedro del Cebollar in Cuenca which is considered to be Ecuador’s most beautiful city due to its streets, its churches, its gastronomy and its kind and cordial inhabitants. Elvia is 46 years old, divorced and has four children who are 27, 25, 20 and 12 years of age. Her three oldest are in common law relationships and live in her house sharing expenses; her youngest son is in school. Her efforts in work have made it possible for her to build her own house. She will use the funds to buy merchandise for her business; her greatest wish is to see her mother healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry: earrings, necklaces, rings, etc.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
La señora Maria Jose L. M., es una joven de 29 años de edad casada con un hijo de 8 años, su esposo es jardinero y apoya a la economía del hogar, ella se dedica a los trabajos domésticos, tienen un hijo pequeño de 8 años que estudia la primaria.

Ellos son una familia humilde que por la escases de recursos económicos  no han tenido el capital necesario para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para las remodelaciónes de su vivienda, con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de zinc, bloques, arena, cemento, puesto que desea construir un porche al frente de su hogar para brindarle una fachada mas presentable. Con esta inversión mejoraran sus condiciones de habita y sobretodo la tranquilidad de madre de poder ofrecerle a sus hijos un mejor espacio donde morar y desarrollarse diariamente.
texts.en:
The young woman Maria Jose L. M. is 29 years old, married, and has an 8 year old child. Her husband is a gardener and supports the home financially, she dedicates herself to domestic work, and they have a young son of 8 years who is in primary school. They are a humble family that, because of the scant economic resources, have not had the capital necessary to invest in the purchase of construction materials for remodeling their house. With the loan, she will invest in the purchase of zinc, blocks, sand, cement, since she wishes to construct a porch at the front of her home, to provide her a more presentable exterior. With this investment their living conditions will improve, and above all the peace of the mother to be able to offer her children a better space in which to dwell and develop daily.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling her home

loans.name: Luz Del Milagro

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una distrito cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca, se encuentra ubicado a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella vende prendas de vestir al crédito y al contado y las comercializa de acuerdo a pedidos. Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Lima. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares.

Luz desea adquirir mas ropa para aumentar sus ventas aprovechando la cercanía de las fiestas en su distrito. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Luz es una persona tranquila y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para instalar un pequeño bazar en su vivienda. Su carisma y buen trato le han hecho conocida entres sus vecinos y clientes.
texts.en:
Luz, 29, is a young mother. She lives with her husband and son in Santa Rosa district, a district that depends primarily on fishing. It is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over 5 years she has sold clothing for women, men and children. She sells both on credit and for cash. She sells based on prior orders. She buys her merchandise in Lima. Profits from her business help her husband meet family expenses. Luz would like to acquire more clothes to increase sales taking advantage of the approaching feast days in her district. She is, therefore, asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan to be used to meet this goal. Luz is a calm person who is very dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can set up a small store in her home. Her charisma and good interpersonal skills have made her very well-known among her neighbors and customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Irlanda Carolina
