texts.es: Irlanda Carolina de 27 años, tiene dos hijos, su negocio consiste en la venta de golosinas, en un Kiosco que tiene más de 5 años de tenerlo por la necesidad y buscar una fuente alternativa de ingresos decide establecer este negocio que está ubicado en una escuela donde asisten muchos estudiantes que asisten a este centro. Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital, pues este es su primer crédito y está muy emocionada pues espera que el resultado sea satisfactorio. Sueña con incrementar cada día más su capital para que las ganancias le queden a ella para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda. El crédito será destinado para la compra de jugos, golosinas,  pan, galletas y refrescos.
texts.en:
Irlanda Carolina, 27, has two children. She sells snacks in a kiosk. She has had it for over 5 years. She needed to have an alternative source of income so she decided to open this business; it’s located at the entrance of a school where many students attend. She gradually increased her capital. This is her first loan and she is very excited about it because she expects it to have satisfactory results. She dreams with increasing her capital even more each day so that profits will stay with her in order to make some home improvements. She will use the funds to buy juices, snacks, bread, cookies and soft-drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy juices, snacks, bread, cookies and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Lidia V. D. 38 años D. edad casada  con el padre D. sus tres hijos integra la Alcancía Comunal  Unidos al  Futuro.
Lidia llego atravez D. una vecina  que le invitó a participar en un crédito Grupal y desD. entonces participa junto a las otras 8 socias mas, se inicio en el negocio D.   alquiler D. carros (autos) , Al inicio contaba con un solo vehículo  y al transcurrir el tiempo compro uno más, el ingreso que ella obtenía lo juntaba  para poder ahorrarlo en un nuevo negocio , es D. esa manera que desD. hace 5 años inauguro una Bodega, como en todo negocio  inicio con poca cantidad D. mercadería  como golosinas gaseosa, cerveza, abarrotes, también realiza la venta D. gas,  con el tiempo su ingreso mejoro , este actual préstamo lo invertirá  en la compra D.  un saco D. azúcar, un saco D. arroz , 5 cajas D. cerveza, 5 cajas D. gaseosas D. litro.
Sus planes más adelante es D. abrir en su domicilio un Salón D. Belleza, y lo más importante apoyar en lo que sea necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lidia V. is 38 years old, married and has three children. She belongs to the "Unidos al Futuro" communal bank. Lidia came to the group through a neighbor who invited her to participate in a group loan. Since then, she has participated along with 8 other members and started a business renting cars. In the beginning she only had one vehicle and over time bought another. She saved the income she received so she could open a new business and 5 years ago started up a package store. Like with any business, she started out with a small quantity of merchandise, such as candy, beer, groceries. She also sold gas. Over time her revenue improved. This loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, 5 cases of beer and 5 cases of 1-liter soft drinks. Her plans for the future are to open a beauty salon in her home and more importantly, to proviD. for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, D. 51 años, es una mujer muy laboriosa, vive con su esposo Víctor (54), y con su último hijo D. 4 que tiene, pues los mayores viven independientes.DesD. hace 10 años, se dedica a L. costura D. prendas D. vestir, y tiene muchos clientes, por L. creatividad y diseño que produce  al remendar. ElL. atienD. en un local alquilado, en una zona comercial D. su ciudad, donD. también ofrece golosinas y gaseosas, con L. ayuda D. su madre en L. atención. Lo que más le gusta es diseñar y coser, por otro lado le incomoda lavar y planchar las prendas pues tiene que ser muy cuidadosa para que sus clientes regresen. Los negocios que tiene son muy rentables porque le permiten tener una vida cómoda y sin preocupaciones, para más adelante tiene planeado incrementar su tienda con cantidad D. productos comestibles, pues quiere  generarse más utilidades.Este es su noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que pagará puntualmente cada cuota, porque elL. es un ejemplo para todas las integrantes D. su banco comunal, porque es L. tesorera D. su grupo.María tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado, en L. compra D.  productos D. primera necesidad (comestibles) que necesita para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
María, 51, is a very hard-working woman; she lives with her husband Victor, 54, and her youngest son who is 4. Her older children all live independently. For the last 10 years she has been a seamstress. She has many customers thanks to her creativity and the designs she creates while repairing items. She tends to her customers in a rented locale in a commercial area of the city. She also has snacks and soft-drinks available for sale. Her mother helps out in the shop. What she likes best is designing and sewing; what she dislikes is washing and ironing because she has to be very careful so that her customers will return. The businesses she has are quite profitable because they permit her to have a comfortable life free of worries. For later on she plans to increase the amount of items in her store because she wants to generate higher profits. This is her 9th loan with MFP and she knows that she will repay each payment on time because she’s an example for the other communal bank members since she’s the treasurer. María will use the requested funds to buy food items that she needs to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock food items for her store.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
ZoiL. M.  D. 42 años D. edad madre soltera  D. 4 hijos D. L. cual el ultimo menor tiene 11 años, integra L. Alcancía Comunal San Pedro grupo que sus integrantes se dedican a distintas labores.
ZoiL. se Inicio en L.  venta D. carteras (bolsos) D. forma ambulatoria por todo el sector D. Chosica, pero no siempre su ingreso era el mismo, al inicio le era un poco difícil, pues tardo como 4 meses para captar clientes y D. esa manera su ingreso D. dinero mejore, realiza también  portarretratos  manualmente para luego venderlos, pero al  sentir L. necesidad D. invertir  y atraves D. una amiga llego a participar en este crédito grupal, En L. actualidad se dedica se dedica a cuidar niños en un pequeño local que alquiL..
Este actual préstamo lo invertirá con mucha fe en L.  compra D. materiales para L. elaboración D. carteras y también en L. compra D. pequeñas sillas y mesas para niños D. 2 a 4 años.
Las metas que se ha trazado es L. D. poder poner una bodega  en su domicilio y sobre todo apoyar a su menor hijo D. 11 años en sus estudios.
texts.en:
ZoiL. M. is 42 years old and a single mother of 4 children, the youngest is 11. She belongs to the San Pedro communal bank whose members are dedicated to different activities. ZoiL. started off selling handbags (purses) as a traveling salesperson in the Chosica sector, but her income was not always steady. In the beginning it was a bit difficult and took about 4 months to begin to get customers, after which her income improved. She also makes picture frames by hand and sells them. But she felt the need to invest and through a friend started participating in a group loan. She currently has a daycare in a small storefront that she rents. She will use this loan to buy materials to make handbags and to also buy small chairs and tables for the 2 to 4-year olds. The goals she has set are to install a package store in her home and most of all, to support her 11-year-old in his education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for making handbags

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es: Esther Maria tiene 45 años, Esther tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación pues no es el primer financiamiento que solicita.  Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, pues sus inicios se dieron con su hijo pues él fue quien le dio la idea de empezar este negocio que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de la casa. Su deseo es salir a ofrecer sus productos a comunidades más alejadas que las de ella, así obtendrá nuevos clientes. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria en su negocio.
texts.en:
Esther María, 45, has been collaborating with the Fundación for a long time; this isn’t her first loan request. For over 13 years she has been a used clothing merchant. She started the business with her son because he was the one who had the original idea for it because it would be a way to help meet household expenses. She hopes to be able to go out to communities that are further away to sell her merchandise in order to get new customers. This funding will be used to buy raw material needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Pedro Alexander

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén,un distrito comecial perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombres ubicada en la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Tiene desde hace un año un negocio de venta de repuestos y autopartes de motos y mototaxis, el negocio está instalado en su domicilio y tiene como clientes asiduos a los transportistas de la zona. El negocio tiene mucha acogida ya que en Chepén las mototaxis son un medio frecuente de transporte. Esta actividad es la unica que le brinda ingresos los que utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y en colaborar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Pedro desea adquirir mas mercadería para aumentar sus ventas ya que sus clientes han promocionado su establecimiento y su demanda está aumentando, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Pedro es una persona que ha trabajado desde muy joven para salir adelante, el negocio que actualmente tiene es fruto de su propio esfuerzo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Pedro, 18, is single and lives with his family in Chepén district, a commercial district in Chepén province located in La Libertad region which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last year he has had a motorcycle and mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) spare parts business that he set up in his home. His regular customers are area transportation providers. His business is very well received in Chepén because mototaxis are a common mode of transportation. This activity is his only source of income for his personal expenses and to contribute to the family’s economy. Pedro wants to acquire more merchandise to increase his sales because his customers have talked up his establishment and demand has increased. To meet this goal, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan. Pedro is a person who has worked from a very young age in order to get ahead in life. The business he has is thanks to his own efforts. He has collaborated with Our Institution in the past and has shown responsibility and punctuality with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Queta

texts.es: Queta, de 53 años, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposo  David (54) y con 2 de sus 3 hijas, puesto que la mayor, labora en la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades. Desde hace 5 años  empezó con el negocio de venta de comida en su casa, para lograrlo separó un espacio de su sala y lo convirtió en comedor, donde atiende a diario  a sus exigentes clientes a partir del mediodía. Cada plato de comida lo vende a 5 soles y los días domingo a 7 soles, pues prepara sus comidas con los mejores ingredientes que encuentra, ya que siempre le gusta satisfacer a sus comensales. Asegura que le gusta mucho cocinar y ver como sus clientes disfrutan de sus alimentos, sin embargo, le disgusta comprar los insumos para cada preparación porque tiene que ser muy selecta, por eso realiza sus compras para toda la semana, excepto las verduras. Mientras Queta, administra su restaurante, su esposo labora de docente de educación superior, además le ayuda en su restaurante. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para mas adelante tiene planeado incrementar su negocio con otros productos de  dulcería.Es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasta de continuar trabajando en su banco comunal, donde ella, es presidenta de la junta directiva de su grupo.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en refaccionar la fachada de su casa, para hacer más atractivo y vistoso el ingreso a su negocio, también invertirá  el monto restante, en la compra de insumos que necesita para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Queta, age 53, lives in her own home with her husband David, age 54, and two of their three daughters; the eldest daughter is working in the city in search of better opportunities. Five years ago, Queta started an eatery business in her home. To achieve this, she separated a part of the living room and made it into a dining hall. This is where she serves food to her demanding clients every day starting at noon. She sells each dish for 5 sols during work days and for 7 sols during the weekend. Queta prepares her dishes with the very best ingredients she can find since she is always committed to the satisfaction of her guests; she really likes to cook and to see the enjoyment her customers get from her dishes. Queta is very selective when purchasing ingredients, and, because of this, she does not like to buy them each day, but instead buys enough to last the whole week, except for the vegetables. While Queta manages her restaurant, her husband works as a teacher; he also helps out with the restaurant. Being an entrepreneurial woman, Queta has future plans to expand her business with dessert products. This is Queta's eighth loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about continuing to work as a member of her communal bank, where she is the president of the management committee. She plans to use the loan to renovate the front side of her house in order to make the entrance to her restaurant look more appealing; the remaining amount will be used to purchase raw ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovations, purchase of ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Norla

texts.es: Norla es madre  de familia, tiene dos hijas menores que van al colegio, la realiza una actividad de brindar el servicio de taxi, tiene más de 3 años de trabajar en este negocio. Gracias a su esfuerzo a podido salir adelante ella y su familia, además su marido trabaja para ayudar a su esposa a sufragar los gastos juntos, ambos han puesto mucho empeño en su pequeño negocio que por lo que siempre están buscando como mejorar día a día. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima en la compra de repuestos, llantas, focos y otras cosas.
texts.en:
Norla is a mother of a family; she has two young daughters who go to school. Norla makes her living by driving a taxi. She has been working in this business for over three years. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to make ends meet for herself and for her family. Her husband also works, and together they cover the household expenses. Both have put a lot of work into their small business, and day after day they are looking for opportunities to improve it further. The loan is needed for the purchase of spare parts and materials such as tires, headlights, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 48 años, tiene 7 hijos, dos D. ellos son D. su primer compromiso y 5 con su actual pareja Benjamin D. 40 años y juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 30 años, cultiva plátanos, café, cacao, achiote y frutas cítricas, en está actividad lo ayudan su esposo y sus hijos, por lo que desea brindarle lo mejor, ya que son el motor D. su vida. DesD. entonces cada mañana, se dispone a limpiar y cuidar sus plantaciones con mucho esmero. Disfruta mucho su vida en la selva, por la tranquilidad que le da sus chacras, sin embargo le disgusta cuando los compradores no valoran su trabajo, ofreciendo bajos precios por su cosecha. Por tal motivo busca el lugar adecuado para ofertarlos, pues en la actualidad, la venta por kilo D. café está alrededor D. S/. 8.00 soles, considerándolo muy rentable, ya que le permite cubrir sus gastos domésticos. En adelante desea sembrar todos los productos que crecen en la selva central del Perú, para tener mejores utilidades. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y cuenta que está contenta D. trabajar con su grupo comunal, porque confía mucho en las personas que la integran. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar las herramientas agrícolas necesarias como machetes, también contratará operarios para que limpien sus terrenos y retiren toda la maleza.
texts.en:
Bertha is 48 years old. She has seven children from a previous marriage and five from her current marriage to 40 year old, Benjamin. They all live together in their own home. She has been raising bananas, coffee, cacao, achiote, and citrus for more than 30 years. She gets help from her husband and children, to whom she wants to proviD. the best, as they are the engine that drives her life. Every morning she cleans and cares for her plantations with great effort. She enjoys her life in the jungle because of the tranquility of her farmland, but she doesn’t like when the buyers don’t value her work and offer low prices for her harvest. Because of this, she looks for good places to sell. At the moment the price of coffee is around 8 PEN ($3.00) per kilogram. She considers this to be profitable, as it allows her to be able to cover her household expenses. In the near future she will begin planting all of the types of crops that grow in the Peruvian jungle, in order to better utilize the land. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is happy to be working with her communal group because she trusts its members very much. She will use the money from this loan to buy farm tools, such as machetes, and will also hire some field hands to clear her land.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm tools and labor

loans.name: Diaz

texts.es: Díaz, es un laborioso hombre de 44 años, que está separado de su pareja desde hace 15 años, tiene dos hijos pero sólo vive con el menor de ellos, en su casa propia. A un kilómetro de distancia, desde la comunidad de “Zutzuki”, se encuentran ubicados los hermosos cultivos de yuca, plátanos, frutas cítricas y achiote. Este camino lo recorre diariamente, de acuerdo a los cuidados que tiene que proporcionar  a sus tierras, en el caso de los plátanos, luego de limpiarlos y nutrirlos con abono orgánico espera quince días para cosecharlos. El esmero y los cuidados adecuados que brinda a sus plantaciones, han hecho que sea uno de los mejores productores de la zona y por tal da gracias a su hijo que lo apoyó mucho en el trabajo. Díaz, lleva 20 años en este oficio y lo que más le apasiona es cosechar y vender sus frutos, así como también le disgusta pagar montos excesivos para el traslado de su cosecha a la ciudad. Las ganancias que percibe los invierten en el cuidado de sus tierras y por ello quiere alternar y renovar sus frutos para ganar más utilidades mediante la siguiente productividad. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y asegura que será cumplido en cada uno de los pagos, porque desea seguir progresando y pedir más préstamos, junto a los integrantes de su grupo  comunal con quienes le gusta trabajar. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de decenas de plantas de guanábana, frutas cítricas y plátanos, con las cuales renovará sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Díaz is a hard working 44 year old man who has been separated from his wife for the past 15 years. He has two children but only his youngest son lives with him. Located one kilometer away, in the community of Zutzuki, are beautiful groves of yucca, bananas, citrus fruit, and achiote. He travels this road daily in order to be able to care for his land. For his bananas, he clears the land, applies organic fertilizer, and will wait two more weeks before harvesting. The care he gives his plantations have made him one of the top producers in the zone. He is grateful to his son, who helps him very much with his work. Díaz has been doing this for 20 years and what he enjoys the most is harvesting and selling his fruit, although he doesn’t like having to pay the high cost of transporting his fruit to the city. He reinvests his income into the land and he wants to alternate and renovate his plants in order to increase his revenue at the next harvest. This will be his second loan through MFP and he assures us that he will be on time with his payments, because he wants to continue to move ahead and be able to get other loans in the future, along with the other members of his communal group, with whom he enjoys working. He will use the money from this loan to invest in scores of fruit trees with which he will renovate his plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit trees

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, es una mujer empeñosa, con ánimos D. progresar, tiene 68 años, vive en su casa propia a lado D. su esposo Marcelino D. 68 años y la menor D. sus hijas, pues las dos mayores trabajan D. manera independiente en Lima. El trabajo al que se dedica es el transporte D. frutas provenientes D. la selva y la costa, así como verduras recién cosechadas D. Tarma. Es D. esta manera que viaja todos los jueves hacía la localidad D. Carhuamayo - Cerro D. Pasco, llevando estos productos para venderlos en la feria semanal. Pero durante los demás días D. la semana trabaja en la panadería, por que sus ganas D. trabajar es lo que le sobra, su esposo que también aporta para los gastos D. la casa, labora trasladando personas a bordo D. su motocarro propio. A ella, lo que más le gusta es preparar los diferentes variedades y sabores D. panes, porque nadie le gana, por eso en la panadería donD. trabaja le tratan muy bien porque la quieren mucho y aseguran que sin Graciela, no venderían la cantidad D. panes y bocaditos que venD., porque la preparación D. sus manos son inconfundibles.  Para su futuro, quiere instalar un negocio D. frutas en la capital del Perú, junto  a su hermana que tiene un puesto D. venta en un mercado muy concurrido. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP y está emocionada D. continuar laborando en su grupo comunal, porque le gusta ahorrar y participar en las charlas educativas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería (verduras y frutas), que trasladará a otra localidad para venderlo en la feria D. esa ciudad.
texts.en:
Graciela is a hard-working woman who really wants to make progress in her life. She is 68 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Marcelino and the younger of their daughters; the older two daughters are working independently in Lima. Graciela makes her living by transporting produce that is grown in the rain-forest regions and on the coast, such as the vegetables recently harvested in Tarma. Thus she travels every Thursday to a town of Carhuamayo where she takes the inventory for sale at the weekly town fair. Her husband also helps contribute to the household budget; he drives fares in his own three-wheeler van. Graciela has a lot of desire for work, and so, during the remaining part of the week, she works in a bakery. What Graciela likes most is preparing different varieties and flavors of baked goods, and nobody is better than her at this job. For this reason, she is valued and treated very well at the bakery, and her coworkers say that they wouldn't be able to sell as much bread and snacks without her since the quality of the products prepared by her hands is unmatched. In the future, Graciela wants to start a fruit-selling business in the Peruvian capital, together with her sister who already has a vending post in a well-attended market. This is Graciela's ninth loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic to continue working with her communal group because she likes to save and to participate in the informative conversations. The loan she is seeking will be used to purchase an additional quantity of fruits and vegetables that she will be transporting to another location for sale at the city fair.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria tuvo 9 hijos, ahora solo vive con su esposo y un nieto que esta a su responsabilidad y estudia en la universidad.
Maria venD. ropa a pedido, negocio que realiza con la ayuda e sus hijas que trabajan en la selva a quienes envía la ropa y en algunas oportunidades viaja llevando sus productos. Además Maria viaja a las ferias en donD. compra cereales que luego venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Maria solicita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. blusas y ropas interiores.
Maria sueña con tener una tienda D. abarrotes e implementar una granja D. pollos junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Maria had nine children, but now she lives alone with her husband and a grandchild who is in her care and studies at the university. Maria sells maD.-to-order clothes, a business that she runs with the help of her daughters who work in the jungle. She sends the clothes to her daughters or sometimes she takes the opportunity to deliver the clothes there herself. She also travels to fairs where she buys cereals that she then sells in the city of Ayacucho. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 soles, and she will invest this money in the purchase of blouses and underwear. It is Maria’s dream to have a grocery store and to farm chickens with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses and underwear

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
Odilia es casada, tiene 4 hijos y solo uno estudia, Odilia tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico a las diferentes ferias de la región, Odilia vende ropa a pedido en las ferias y de allá compra cereales que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Odilia hace papa seca en su casa y también hace chuño (papa deshidratada) en sus tierras en el distrito de Paras.
Odilia pertenece al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua y solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que invertirá en la compra de maíz y papa.
Odilia sueña con construir mas pisos en su casa y comprar un carro mas grande para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Odilia is married, has 4 children only one of which is studying. Odilia has a vehicle that she hires out as transportation to the local farmers' markets. She also sells clothing by request at the farmers' markets and buys grain which she resells in the wholesale market in Ayacucho. Additionally Odilia produces dehydrated potatoes as well as cuño [freeze-dried bitter potatoes] on her land in the Paras district. Odilia belongs to the Tarpuy community bank, which means to sow in Quechua. She is requesting a loan of 1200 soles which she will invest in the purchase of corn and potatoes. Odilia dreams of installing more flooring in her home as well as buying a larger vehicle to carry more of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn and potoatoes

loans.name: Rufilia

texts.es:
Rufilia pertenece al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Rufilia es casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian, vive en su casa de material rustico y su sueño es construir una casa de material noble, Rufilia se dedica a la compra de tara, cochinilla y cuero, productos que acopia todos los días en la comunidad de Mollepata, luego sus productos los vende a su papa que es mayorista de estos productos, también Rufilia viaja a la feria de Huamanguilla en donde compra sus productos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de cochinilla.
El deseo de Rufilia es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rufilia belongs to the Tarpuy community bank, which means to sow in Quechua. Rufilia is married with 5 children, 4 of whom study. She lives in a home made from humble materials, and dreams of building a higher quality home. Rufilia makes a living buying tara, cochineal [a type of red dye], and leather, which she gathers daily in Mollepata, then sells these products to her father who is a wholesaler. She also travels to the Huamanguilla street market to purchase her goods. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of cochineal. It's Rufilia's wish to see her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cochineal

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es viuda y tiene un hijo que esta estudiando, Julia tiene una panificadora llamada Santa Rosa, su horno es rustico y esta en su casa, elabora panes típicos, cuenta con la ayuda D. personal, sus productos los reparte a los negocio.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina y azúcar.
Julia sueña con que su ultimo hijo culmine sus estudios en la universidad y le gustaría seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Julia is a widow and she has one son who is studying. She runs a bakery called Santa Rosa where she makes typical breads. Her oven is rustic and is located in her house. She has people to help her with the work and she delivers her products to businesses. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles, and she will invest this money in the purchase of flour and sugar. It is Julia's dream that her youngest son should finish his university studies and she would like to continue building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and sugar

loans.name: Maria Lucy

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Maria es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ya solo 2 estudian, Maria tiene un recreo en su casa llamado Don Guille, en donde vende comida típica, gaseosas, actividad que realiza ella sola todos los días, Maria inicio su negocio vendiendo cebiche de manera ambulatoria y poco a poco fue arreglando su casa para abrir su recreo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de bebidas y golosinas.
Maria sueña con mejorar su recreo, ampliar ambientes, formalizar su empresa porque hasta ahora es todavía informal y luego promocionar en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the Tarpuy community bank, which means to sow in Quechua. Maria is married with 4 children, only 2 of whom are still studying. She has a small restaurant called Don Guille in her home, where she sells typical food and soft drinks. She does this on her own every day. Maria began her business selling ceviche door to door and little by little modified her house to open her restaurant. Her loan will be used to buy beverages and candy. Maria dreams of improving and expanding, as well as formalizing (as it's still informal) her business to then advertise in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages and candy

loans.name: Ruth Liliana

texts.es:
Ruth es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Ruth junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de bicicletas en un local alquilado ubicado cerca del mercado central, Ruth inicio su negocio hace 5 años de manera ambulatoria y ahora ya tiene su local, en donde también brinda el servicio de reparaciones. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de repuestos de bicicletas.
El sueño de Ruth son tener un terreno para la construcción de su casa porque ahora vive en la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Ruth is 28, married and has 2 children. She and her husband sell bicycles in a rented store located near the central market. Ruth started this business 5 years ago in a street market and now they have a store where they offer repair services. This loan will be invested in the purchase of bicycle spare parts. Ruth's dream is to have a plot of land to build her house because they currently live in the home of her parents-in-law.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

Antonette is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antonette from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and save for her child's future. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca C., 61, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Pedro C., a carpenter, she is blessed with four children. Francisca makes sure that she helps her husband to earn money so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own general store and fruit vending business for quite some time now.
Francisca has been a regular member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT), for more than a year. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance for her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her general store and fruit vending business.
To ensure the success of her business, Francisca would like to apply for a 21,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more stock for her general store and fruit business. Francisca dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also dreams of being able to renovate her house.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock

Maribeth U. (photographed with a client) is from the town of Albur. She is 48 years old and has three children. To make a living, Maribeth owns and operates a service-based business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. She also grows hogs for fattening and sale.
Maribeth joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. She also plans to buy additional piglets and feed. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide her service

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta C., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Narciso C., 58, a carpenter, they are blessed in their marriage. Enriqueta has been managing her own general store for quite a few years.
Enriqueta has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and consistently pays her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance for her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She has used the money she has borrowed to expand and improve her business.
To ensure the continued success of her business, she is now requesting a 13,000 PHP loan, which will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. Enriqueta will buy replenishment stock for her general store. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy stock for her general store

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: For more than ten years Charles K., a married Tanzanian entrepreneur, has been operating a bar selling varieties of both soft and alcoholic drinks in Yombo Kilakala ward in Dar es Salaam.  He employs three staff to help him run the business. Earnings from the bar have enabled him to open a guest house and also meet the daily needs of his family.  Charles is now requesting a loan of T.shs 1,200,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Gamaly J.

texts.en:
Gamaly J. K. is an entrepreneur and a married man. He runs a foodstuffs shop at Yombo Lumo ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases and sells a variety of food crops at his shop, purchasing his business goods from the wholesale shops and foodstuff suppliers. His business goods includes wheat flour, maize flour, beans, sugar and rice.

Gamaly managed to build a residential house from his business income and it also helps him to meet his family’s daily needs. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru J. M. is an entrepreneur and a married businesswoman. She runs a pharmacy at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her business goods from the wholesale pharmaceutical shops at Kariakoo City shopping centre and other shops around. She manages to meet her family’s daily needs from her business income.

Nuru is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is a small-business married woman who lives with her family at her own house. She runs a business selling traditional clothes (kanga and vitenge) at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam.

Elizabeth purchases her business goods from Mnazi Mmoja traditional clothes city shopping center from the wholesale shops and sells to retail customers at her shop. She also runs a garden from which different types of green vegetables are cultivated and sold for domestic use.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Yohane

texts.en:
Yohane M. is an entrepreneur and a married man. He runs a foodstuffs shop selling a variety of goods in Kiwalani ward in Dar es Salaam.

Yohane purchases his business goods from the wholesale shops at Kariakoo city market and Buguruni market. He managed to construct his own residential house where he lives with his family. He also meets his family’s daily needs from his business income.

Yohane’s business plan is to run more foodstuffs shops. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to expand his business

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina A. is a small-business married woman. She runs a beautiful salon at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam.

Tina purchases her business materials from the wholesale cosmetics shops at Kariakoo city shopping center. She has employed two workers to assist her in running the business.

Tina is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more business materials to expand her business

loans.name: Eleswida

texts.en: Eleswida F. is a married woman who owns a small business in Tanzania. She runs a food shop in Yombo Lumo Ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases and sells different types of crop-based food products, including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, groundnuts, sugar, rice, and cooking oil. She purchases the goods from wholesale and retail shops at Kariakoo city shopping center. The income from this business enabled her to open onother business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan of TZS 1,400,000 to buy more products to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy L. is a married woman who owns a small business. She runs a café in Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She prepares and sells cooked and fried food to customers. She purchases the ingredients from wholesale and retail city market shops. She was able to buy a plot of land in Kigamboni ward from the income of her business. In addition, the income helps her meet her family's daily needs. She needs a loan of TZS 1,400,000 to grow her business

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en: Arafa T. is an entrepreneur. She is a married woman. She runs a business selling charcoal at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the charcoal direct from wholesale suppliers and sells it to retail customers for domestic use. Charcoal is the main source of power in most developing countries. She also runs a salon at Kitunda, selling cosmetics. She employs two other people who help her run the business. She is requesting a loan of TZS 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Judith F.

texts.en:
Judith F. M. is a small-business woman. She runs a shop selling a variety of both soft and alcoholic drinks to customers at Yombo Lumo ward in Dar es Salaam.

Judith purchases her business goods from the wholesale suppliers and retail shops. She has been in her business for four years. The business income helps her to meet her daily family needs and provide for business expansion.

Judith wants to expand her business by injecting more capital into it as her business income increases. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to top up her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo H. vazquez, tiene  39 años, es casado y tiene dos hijas, su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica,  y el trabaja en un centro comercial, no ganan mucho pero quieren poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, por eso solicitan este préstamo por que requieren comprar el material para colocar vitropiso en el interior de su casa, ya que solo cuentan con piso de cemento.
texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo H. Vazquez is 39 years old, married, and has two daughters. His wife works as a domestic employee and he works in a commercial center. They do not earn much but they want to start improving their house little by little. For this purpose they are requesting a loan because they need to buy the materials to put down tile in the interior of the house, since now they have just cement floors.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of floor tiles

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La Sra. Guadalupe tiene un negocio de abarrotes desde hace algunos años, ella y su familia atienden el negocio y de ese ingreso que perciben han podido salir adelante con sus hijos, ahora tiene la necesidad de hacer una inversión ya que les gustaría comprar mas mercancía y de ese modo obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Guadalupe has had a grocery store for several years. She and her family run it and this income has allowed them to get ahead. She now needs to make an investment as they would like to buy more merchandise to earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Sully

texts.es:
Sully M. O.  es casada y su esposo se dedica al comercio, apoyá con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, tienen un  hijo de 5 años, y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 2 años, fue gracias al apoyo de su esposo que logro realizar la compra para las primeras mercaderías de su negocio.

Ella maneja que existen meses en el año en que las ventas se enfrían y decaen las ganancias, espera que para el segundo semestre del año 2010 se mejoren y para esto solicita de un  préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos, el crédito lo solicitará para la compra de  cosméticos con el objetivo de aprovechar el día en que celebramos a la madre Nicaragüense, de esta forma elevar sus ingresos para la inversión a nuevas fuentes de trabajo, y brindarle a su pequeño hijo mejores condiciones que beneficien a su desarrollo perosonal.
texts.en:
Sully M. O. is married and her husband works in trade. Their earnings help with household costs. They have one child, age 5. She has sold cosmetics for 2 years; it was thanks to her husband's support that she was able to purchase her business' first merchandise. She manages, even though there are months in the year when sales cool off and earnings wane. She hopes that the second half of 2010 will be better, and so she is requesting a loan to buy a better inventory. The requested loan is for the purchase of cosmetics in order to benefit from the day of celebration of Nicaragua's mother. This will improve her income for investment in new jobs, and offer her little child better conditions to benefit his personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Tereza

texts.es:
Doña Maria es madre de familia de cuatro hijos, de edad de 54 años, para ella no ha sido fácil, ha tenido que trabajar desde joven para apoyar a sus hijos, hoy en día casados, pero siempre apoyándolos. Desde hace vaR. años logro poner su propio negocio una pulpería que a través de los financiamientos ha aumentado su inventario ya que comenzó con poco  dinero de su liquidación y ayuda de su esposo.

Desde horas tempranas se levanta para vender. En los últimos meses no ha vendido lo suficiente, las ventas han bajado es por eso desea comprar mas productos en granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, productos enlatados y otros para aumentar sus ventas con los productos de rotamientos  ya que son muchos los gastos que pagar de agua, luz, alimentación y otros.
Entre sus planes, es lograr el aumento de inventario, así como hacer mejoras a su casa como pintarla para que se vea bonita.
texts.en:
Maria is a 54 year old mother of four. Life has not been easy for her. Since she was young, she has had to work to support her children, even though they are now married. A few years back, she was able to start her own business, a pulpería [small grocery store] that because of funding has allowed her to increase her stock. She started it with some money from a settlement and with her husband's help. Maria wakes up in the early morning hours to sell. In the past months she has not sold enough. Because sales have dropped, she would like to buy more basic products like dry grains, dairy products, sweets, canned goods, and other things. This is to increase sales by rotating goods, since there are many costs to pay for water, light, food, and more. Among her plans is to gain an increase in stock in order to improve her home by painting it so that it will look pretty.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dry grains, canned goods, sweets, chickens, meat, and more to increase her sales

loans.name: Ofilio

texts.es:
El señor Ofilio T. B., tienen la edad de 40 años es acompañado por su pareja de vida la cual se gana la vida planchando y lavando, él trabaja como albañil desde hace 17 años, con sus 3 hijos habitan en el Barrio Laureles Norte en una humilde casa, que necesita de mucha inversión para la mejora en pro de los que moran allí.

Es para este fin que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelacion de un porche, instalación de unas puertas y ventanas con el objetivo de habitar de una manera más segura, debido a que el lugar donde habitan tiene un alto índice de delincuencia que amenaza con la estabilidad personal de cada uno de los habitantes. Sobre todo de sus 3 hijos el cual está en una etapa de sus vidas en que son vulnerables a las pandillas.
texts.en:
Ofilio T. B. is forty years old and accompanied by his life partner, who makes a living by ironing and washing. He has worked as a bricklayer for seventeen years. They live in the Laureles Norte neighborhood with their three children, in a humble house that needs a lot of investment to improve it for those who live there. It is to this end that he asks for a loan, to purchase construction materials, to remodel a porch, to install some doors and windows. This is with the objective of living in a more secure way, since the place where they now live has a high incidence of delinquent behavior that threatens the personal stability of each one of its inhabitants. Above all it threatens his three children, who are in a stage in their lives when they are vulnerable to gangs.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel a porch and install some doors and windows

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier A. P., tiene 43 años es casado vive en el barrio Los Cortenses, es casado y su esposa labora como operaria de una Zona Franca, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan para una empresa privada, y con sus ingresos apoyan económicamente a  sus padres. El señor labora como taxista desde hace 2 años.

Uno de los principales problemas que agobian a los trabajadores del transporte urbano y privado de Nicaragua es el alza del combustible, fue con un préstamo en una micro financiera que logró comprar su vehículo el cual hoy en día es el sustento diario de la familia, a futuro solicitará un préstamo para realizar un mantenimiento preventivo a su automóvil, por ahora solicita un credito para la compra de materiales de construcción que permitan la edificación de un cuarto que aporte mejores condiciones a la infraestructura de su hogar y la independencia y privacidad de los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier A. P. is 43 years old and married. He lives in the Cortenses neighborhood. His wife works as an operator in a Free Trade Zone. He has two adult children that work for a private enterprise, and with their earnings they support their parents. Francisco has worked as a taxi driver for two years. One of the main problems that oppresses urban and private transport workers in Nicaragua is the rise of fuel costs. It was with a loan from a microfinance institution the he was able to buy the car that each day supports his family. In the future he will ask for a loan to conduct preventative maintenance on his car. For now, he asks for a loan to purchase construction materials that will allow him to build a room that will contribute to better living conditions and infrastructure in his home, and to the independence and privacy of his family members.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a room for his house

loans.name: Nicacio

texts.es: El Sr. 	Nicasio M. Pérez, es albañil  y esta solicitando este préstamo por que requiere hacer el enjarre de su vivienda,  y necesita comprar el material necesario ya que el no cuenta con la solvencia económica por que no ah tenido mucho trabajo últimamente, el Sr. Nicacio de antemano agradece la ayuda que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Nicasio M. P. is a mason and is requesting this loan because he needs to plaster his home, and needs to buy the necessary material. He does not have the economic resources because he has not had much work lately. He thanks you in advance for the help that you can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plaster his home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marvin Ronald

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero, no tiene carga familiar, vive con su madre la cual se dedica a la venta de comida. El solicitante se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en el mercado modelo. Solicita el credito para compra de mercaderias para su tienda
texts.en:
Marvin is single and has no family burden. He lives with his mother, who sells food. Marvin sells groceries in the Modelo market. He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for his store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital increase

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Señora verónica González A. tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes, tiene 31 años y su esposo le ayuda en el negocio , entre los dos hacen crecer las ventas, es por eso que requieren de este préstamo por que ellos quieren comprar mas mercancía y así poder atraer mas clientes e incrementar mucho mas sus ventas.
texts.en:
Veronica Gonzales A. has a grocery sales business. She is 31 and her husband helps her with the business. Between the two of them their sales have grown, and thus they require this loan because they want to buy more merchandise in order to be able to attract more customers and greatly increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: More merchandise

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: Doña Siomara S. A., tiene 36 años casada con tres hijos, D. los cuales  están a su cargo, se dedica a la crianza D. pollos ponedoras  D. esta forma a trabajado  durante 5 años atrás, venD. todos los días  huevos y con eso logra el sustento diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo. El cual será utilizado como capital D. trabajo y así poder  incrementar el volumen D. ventas. Son 6 señoras y 1 señor  que conforman el grupo   denominado “primavera”, las señoras D. dedican a diversas actividades productivas tales como: la crianza D. animales, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, venta D. verduras, venta D. carne, venta D. cerdos y la venta D. artesanía. En el lugar D. San Juan La Laguna D. Panyevar Sololá
texts.en:
Siomara S. A., 36, is married with three children, all dependents. She has raised laying hens for 5 years. Every day she sells eggs and with this obtains her daily sustenance. With other neighbours she decided to organize a group to request a loan. It will be used as working capital to increase the volume of their sales. There are 6 women and 1 man in this group called "Primavera" ("Spring"). The ladies engage in various productive activities such as raising animals, selling daily consumables, selling food, selling meat, selling pigs and selling handicrafts. They are in San Juan La Laguna D. Panyevar Solola.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es: El Sr. Zacarías Santiago P., tiene un negocio de Medicina Natural,tiene 63 años y es el sustento de su familia por eso el quiere hacerle algunas mejoras en el lugar en donde el Sr. Zacarías quiere colocar un pequeño consultorio para mayor comodidad de sus pacientes y así tener mas personas que lo visiten e incrementar así las ventas de sus productos naturales.
texts.en:
Zacarias Santiago P. has a Natural Medicines business. He is 63 and is his family's breadwinner. Thus, he wants to make some improvements to the place where he wants to open a small office for his patients' convenience. This way he will have more customers and increase the sales of his natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in natural products

loans.name: Xoljuyup 3 Group

texts.es: Doña Santa Rafela , tiene 45 años  de edad quien es una mujer trabajadora  y a salido adelante con sus hijos, y se ha dedicado a la elaboración y venta de cortes típicos, su negocio ya cuenta con 30 años de estar funcionando, vende todos los días y con eso logra el sustento diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo. El cual será utilizado como capital de trabajo y así poder  incrementar el volumen de ventas. Son 7 señoras que conforman el grupo solidario   denominado “Xoljuyup 3”, las señoras de dedican en la elaboración de blusas y venta de la misma  como también en su mayoría compra y venta de ropa típica. En Colyujup, cantón Chuichexuc Santa Lucia Utatlán, Sololá.
texts.en:
Santa Rafela, 45, is a hard-working woman who has gotten ahead with her children. She makes and sells traditional clothing; she has had this business for 30 years. She sells every day and with this earns her daily bread. With other neighbours she decided to organize a group to request a loan. It will be used as working capital to increase sales volume. This group, called "Xolijuyup 3", is made up of 7 women. They make and sell blouses. As well, the majority of them buy and sell traditional clothing. They are in the Colyujup, in Chuichexuc Santa Lucia Utatlán, Sololá.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Alaska Group

texts.es: Doña Herlinda Lucia Perechu T., tiene 47 años de  edad,  se dedica al comercio (en la compra y venta de ropa típica etc.) su negocio ya cuenta con 5 años de estar funcionando, vende los días Domingo y jueves en Nahualá  y con eso logra el sustento diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo. El cual será utilizado como capital de trabajo y así poder  incrementar el volumen de ventas y sus ganancias. Son 3 señoras que conforman el grupo Solidario denominado, GRUPO ALASKA las señoras de dedican a diversas actividades productivas como lo es la compra-venta de ropa típica en dicha localidad.
texts.en:
Herlinda Lucia Perechu T. is 47 and sells and buys traditional clothing. She has been in this business for 5 years. She sells every Sunday and Thursday in Hahuala, and with this she earns her daily bread. With other neighbours she decided to organize a group to request a loan. It will be used as working capital to increase sales volume and their earnings. This group named Groupo Alaska is made up of three women who engage in various productive activities such as the purchase and sale of traditional clothing in their area.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Danitza Lourdes

texts.es:
Danitza tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la region Lambayeque.

Se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catálogo, empezó ayudando a su madre en esta actividad hace dos años y ahora que ya tiene la mayoría de edad ha empezado a vender productos por su cuenta. Ella sigue trabajando con los clientes de su madre y también está consiguiendo clientes nuevos, con el esfuerzo de ambas han podido instalar un pequeño puesto de venta en su vivienda en donde ofrecen los productos a sus clientes sin necesidad de esperar a fin de mes, que es cuando llegan los pedidos.

Danitza desea adquirir productos en oferta para surtir su puesto de venta, para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles.

Danitza es una joven trabajadora y responsable. Las ganancias que percibe de su negocio las utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a la economía familiar. En la imagen aparece junto a su madre, quien esta orgullosa de ella, ya que con su esfuerzo está sacando adelante el negocio.
texts.en:
Danitza is 18, single and lives with her mother in the district of Tambohrande, an agricultural district that belongs to the Piura province in the region of the same name, three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells beauty products through a catalogue. She started helping her mother in this activity two years ago and now that she is of age she has started selling products on her own. She continues to work with her mother's clients and she is also getting new clients. Through both of their efforts she has been able to open a small shop in her home where she offers products to her clients without having to wait until the end of the month, which is when her orders arrive. Danitza wants to purchase products on sale to stock her shop. To meet this goal she has requested her first loan of 400 soles with Edpyme Alternativa. Danitza is a young hard-working and responsible woman. She uses her earnings to cover her personal costs and to support her family. In the photo, she appears with her mother who is proud of her, as with her effort she is getting the business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Adelmo

texts.es:
Adelmo tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona dedicada principalmente al cultivo de frutas que pertenece a la provincia de Piura en la región del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace diez años, el cría ganado vacuno en unos corrales ubicados cerca a la zona en donde vive. Todos los dias el extrae la leche que producen y la vende a la Municipalidad de la zona, la cual utiliza este producto para repartirlo entre los pobladores de bajos recursos y estudiantes de los colegios. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos familiares por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo cuidando sus animales y brindándoles una buena alimentación.

Adelmo desea adquirir alimento balanceado y forraje para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales y lograr que produzcan leche de mejor calidad, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Adelmo es un hombre trabajador y entregado a su familia, en la zona donde vive se ha sabido ganar la estima y respeto de las personas que lo conocen. En la imagen aparece junto a sus animales.

gullosa de ella, ya que con su esfuerzo está sacando adelante el negocio.
texts.en:
Adelmo is 65, married and lives with his family in the Tambogrande district, a zone dedicated primarily to the cultivation of fruits. It is in the province of Piura in the region of the same name, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has been a rancher for 10 years, raising cattle in pens located near the area where he lives. Every day he extracts the milk that they produce and sells it to the local government which uses the milk for distribution among the low-income residents and college students. This business is an important source of income for his family and so he always goes the extra mile in taking care of his animals and offering them good nutrition. Adelmo wants to acquire balanced food and fodder to improve his animals' nutrition so that they produce milk of the highest quality. Thus, he is requesting his first loan of 1000 soles with Edpyme Alternativa. Adelmo is a hard-working man who is dedicated to his family. In his neighbourhood he has succeeded in winning the esteem and respect of those who know him. He appears in the photo with his animals. He is proud of them, and with his effort he is getting his business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fodder and balanced food to improve milk production

loans.name: María Rosalina

texts.es:
María Rosalina tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos dependientes, vive junto a su familia en el anexo El Cuarenta del caserío Lagunas, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la crianza y venta de animales. Ella cría cerdos, pollos, cabritos y cuyes en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Cuando estos animales ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los vende quincenalmente en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo). Esta es una actividad de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia. Su esposo es pescador.

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales y lograr que estos se desarrollen de mejor manera para percibir mayores ganancias al momento de venderlos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar la construcción de su vivienda para obtener una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen nos muestra uno de los animales que venderá pronto.
texts.en:
María Rosalina is 24 and has 2 dependent children. She lives with her family in the El Cuarenta annex of the Lagunas village, a rural area in the district of Morrope, which is known for having the majority of its population concentrated in rural areas with a great distance between them. It belongs to the Lambayeque province located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For five years she has raised and sold animals. She raises hogs, chickens, swine and guinea pigs in pens outside of her home. When these animals have reached a good level of development she sells them every fortnight in the Moshoqueque market (the wholesale market of Chiclayo City). This is an activity that helps her family greatly. Her husband is a fisherman. Maria wants to purchase balanced food to improve her animals' nutrition and help them to develop in a better manner to bring her better income when she sells them. For this reason she has requested her first loan of 1000 soles with Epydme Alternativa, which will help her to achieve this goal. She is a hard-working and very responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to improve her home's construction to obtain a better quality of life. In the photo she is showing us one of the animals that she will sell soon.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Balanced food for improved animal nurtition

loans.name: Janet Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Janet es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector 9 de Octubre, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad conocida a nivel nacional como la Ciudad de la Amistad, es también uno de los principales ejes económicos del país, dado alto desarrollo comercial, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de embutidos y abarrotes en un puesto ubicado en el mercado del sector donde vive; el tiempo que lleva trabajando en la zona, la calidad de los productos que ofrece y el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes le han hecho bastante conocida en el rubro. Esta actividad es una fuente importante de sustento familiar, por ello se esfuerza todos los dias por sacarla adelante.

Janet desea renovar el baño de su vivienda ya que debido al tiempo que llevan viviendo ahí, esa habitación se ha venido deteriorando, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar esta acción y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Janet es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y sus compañeros de trabajo. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Janet is a 45-year-old mother who lives with her family in the '9 de Octubre' sector, a marginal urban area of the city of Chiclayo. Chiclayo is known on the national level as la Ciudad de la Amistad, which is also one of the main economic centers of the country, given its high economic development; it is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than five years she has sold sausages and groceries in a stall in the market of her neighbourhood; the time that she has spent working in this area, the quality of the products she offers and her good customer service has made her very well-known in the industry. This activity is an important source of her family's income, so she works hard every day to get ahead. Janet wants to renovate the bathroom of her home since, during the time that they have lived there, the home has been deteriorating. So she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 soles which will allow her to achieve this goal and improve her quality of life. Janet is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She is quite well-known and respected by her neighbours and co-workers. She has worked with this instutution before and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bathroom repairs

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis Miguel tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito agrícola y de creciente desarrollo comercial situado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva adjunta una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros), el brinda sus servicio en el distrito donde vive y también en sus caseríos y anexos. Adicionalmete trabaja como jornalero en una empresa agrícola de la zona. El divide su tiempo entre estas dos ocupaciones, los ingresos que percibe de ellas los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia en los gastos diarios.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, para reparar su vehículo el ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luis Miguel es un joven responsable y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the agricultural district of Cayalti, which is experiencing business growth. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For a year, he has offered transportation on a “motor-taxi,” which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin to transport cargo and passengers. He offers his services in the district where he lives, and also in the housing projects and adjacent areas. He also works as a day laborer in an agricultural company in the area. He divides his time between these two jobs, and uses the income earned to cover personal expenses and help his family with daily expenses. Constant use of his vehicle has caused it to suffer mechanical failures, which require repairs for proper operation. To repair his vehicle, he has requested a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Luis Miguel is a reliable, hard-working young man. His greatest desire is to continue working to help his family and get ahead. He has worked with our institution previously, and has shown himself to be punctual and responsible when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses of repairing and maintaining a motor-taxi

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una madre de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su menor hija en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona de constante desarrollo comercial ubicada a una hora de la ciuda de Chiclayo.

Ella se gana la vida trabajando como profesora en un colegio primario de la zona y también prepararando dulces en su vivienda para luego venderlos en sus tiempos libres en la puerta de un colegio de la zona. Este negocio es de mucha acogida ya que ella prepara los dulces con muy buena sazón. Durante el tiempo que lleva trabajando se ha vuelto conocida en la zona y ha empezado a repartir dulces por pedidos adicionalmente. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza en solventar los gastos de su familia.

La creciente demanda de pedidos por los dulces que prepara han hecho que piense en incrementar su producción para aumentar sus ventas y por ende, sus ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Liliana es una mujer bastante emprendedora, creativa y de mucha paciencia. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Liliana is a 41 year old mother who lives with her younger daughter in the farming district of Cayaltí, an area of constant commercial development located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She earns her living working as a teacher in an elementary school in the area and also preparing sweets in her home then selling them in her free time at the entrance of the area school. This business is well received as her sweets have a very good flavor. During the time that she has been working she has become known in the area and has also begun to deliver sweets to order. The income that she receives from these business she uses for covering the family's expenses. The increasing demand of orders for the sweets that she prepares means that she is thinking of increasing her production to boost her sales and therefore, her profits. To achieve her goal she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of PEN 2000. Liliana is quite an enterprising woman, creative and has a lot of patience. She has worked previously with Our Institution and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing comsumables to make sweets for sale.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Ciudad Eten, un distrito conocido por sus sombreros y muebles tejidos de paja. Se encuentra ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace quince años a la venta de condimentos al por mayor y menor en el mercado de su distrito, el atiende en su negocio todos los dias y debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad se ha vuelto muy conocido en el rubro. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para la economía de su familia, junto a su esposa se esfuerzan para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras.

Carlos desea adquirir mas condimentos para tener una mayor cantidad de productos en su puesto de trabajo y aumentar sus ventas y ganancias, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Carlos es una persona trabajadora y que siempre se esfuerza por sacar a su familia adelante. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 37 year old married man with two children. He lives with his family in a district of Eten; a district well known for its sombreros and straw woven furniture. He is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He's been selling condiments wholesale and retail in his district for the past 11 years. He tends to his own business everyday and due to the length of time he's been working, he's become well known in the business. This business is of most importance to his family's economy. His wife sells vegetables and togther they struggle to get ahead. Carlos wishes to purchase more condiments in order to have a large quantity of product at his job post and increase his sales and earnings. That is why he has requested a loan for 300 dollars to Edpyme Alternativa in order to reach his objective. Carlos is a hard working person who always tries to get his family ahead. He has worked previously with our institution and he has shown responsibility and punctuality when it comes to making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments to grow sales

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, una zona que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a trabajar negociando animales desde hace mas de dos años, ella compra animales menores a los pobladores de la zona y luego los revende en una feria que se instala todos los dias martes en el distrito de Cayaltí. Esta actividad es muy importante para el sostenimiento de su familia por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacarla adelante.

Elida desea aumentar sus ventas adquiriendo mas animales para negociar, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Elida es una mujer responsable y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad y ayudar a su madre a obtener una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Elida is 36, married and lives with her husband and children in the agricultural district of Nueva Arica, an area located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked with animals for over two years. She buys small animals from the local villagers and later re-sells them at a fair that runs every Tuesday in the Cayalti district. This activity is very important for the maintenance of her family and so she always tries to give it her best in order to get ahead.
