Elida wants to increase her sales through acquiring more animals, so she has requested her first loan of 500 soles with Edpyme Alternativa to help her with this goal. Elida is a responsible and enterprising woman. Her greatest wish is to be able to offer her children a quality education and to help her mother to obtain a better quality of life. In the area where she lives she is very well-known and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Animals to grow and re-sell

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Paiján, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad. Se encuentra ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace mas de un año brindando servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros), el brinda sus servicios en el distrito donde vive y en los anexos que lo rodean, esta actividad tiene mucha acogida, ya que las mototaxis son un medio de transporte bastante frecuentando en la zona.

El continuo uso otorgado a su vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas en el motor que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar el correcto funcionamiento del vehículo, para realizar estas reparaciones el ha solicitado por primera vez  a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Rubén es una persona responsable y bastante trabajadora. El se ha hecho bastante conocido en la zona gracias a su carisma y buen caracter.
texts.en:
Rubén is 31, single and lives with his family in the Paijan district, an area belonging to the Ascope province, in the La Libertad region two and a half hours from the Chiclayo city, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has worked for more than a year offering a transportation service in a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for transporting cargo and passengers). He offers his services in the district where he lives and in the surrounding annexes. This is a welcomed activity, since mototaxis are a very frequently-used mode of transportation in the area. The vehicle is starting to have some motor problems from frequent use that require urgent repair to guarantee proper functioning. In order to make these repairs he has requested his first loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Ruben is a responsible and very hard-working person. He has made himseld very well-known in the area thanks to his charisma and good character.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mototaxi repair and maintenance costs

loans.name: Las Novatas ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Novatas es un banco de 7 mujeres luchadoras quienes buscan con el trabajo diario obtener un futuro para sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad fue declarada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad el 1 de Diciembre de 1999, por su belleza arquitectónica, los 4 ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente es lo que le hace especial a esta ciudad ya que son muy cordiales y amables.

La Sra. Rosa Silvana L. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo realizando los préstamos,  su mamá la invito a ser parte de estas mujeres luchadoras, los préstamos le han beneficiado en la cría de  pollos los que cría a medias con su mamá. También trabaja en la tapicería que es de la familia, labora de lunes a viernes.
 
La Sra. Silvana estudia a distancia y  cursa el sexto año, tiene  veinte años de edad, vive en unión libre y se encuentra contenta ya que tiene cinco meses de embarazo de su primer hijo, vive en casa de sus padres, a quienes ayuda económicamente ya que sus padres no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando. Su nuevo préstamo que realiza en la Fundación Espoir, lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para venderlos y sacar  recursos para su familia. Desea seguir estudiando en la universidad y algún día lograr ser una profesional en medicina ya que este ha sido su sueño desde que era una niña.

 Es el primer crédito de la señora Laura M.,  fue invitada por su hermana que también es socia de nuestra fundación, vive en la de la ciudad de Cuenca por el sector de los 3 Puentes, por el momento se dedica a la cría de cuyes,  los mismos que  los vende en su  casa.  Anteriormente se dedicaba a la costura de jeans pero lastimosamente ya no pudo seguir trabajando por el estrés.

La Sra. Laura tiene 52 años de edad,  es viuda hace 21 años, su esposo murió con cáncer, tiene 6 hijos,  4 de sus hijos ya son casados y viven independientemente, una hija  emigró a otro país, de la cual no recibe ninguna ayuda, y su último hijo trabaja y todo lo que gana es para solventar sus propios gastos.

 Nuestra socia tiene casa propia  gracias a su sacrificio y trabajo. El crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para poder criar más cuyes, su meta es de seguir luchando para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Novatas consists of seven hard-working women who seek with their daily work to obtain a future for their families. They live in the city of Cuenca. This city was declared a World Heritage Site on the December 1, 1999, for its architectural beauty and the four rivers that flow through the city. Its people are what make it special because they are polite and kind. Sra. Rosa Silvana L. lives in the city of Cuenca. She is in her fourth loan cycle. Her mother invited her to be part of this group of hard-working women. The loans have benefited her in the raising of chickens, which she raises as an equal partner with her mother. She also works in her family's weaving shop, where she works from Monday to Friday. Sra. Silvana studies through distance learning and is in her sixth year. She is 20 years old and lives in with her common law husband. She is happy because she is in her fifth month of pregnancy with her first child. She lives in the house of her parents, whom she helps economically since her parents do not have their own home and are renting one. She will invest her new loan from Fundación Espoir in the purchase of chickens to sell to obtain income for her family. She wants to continue studying at the university and some day to be a medical professional, since that has been her dream since she was a girl. This is the first loan for Señora Laura M.. She was invited by her sister, who is also a member of this foundation. She lives in the city of Cuenca, in the Three Bridges district. At this time she is raising guinea pigs, which she sells from her house. In the past, she sewed jeans, but unfortunately she could not continue working because of the stress. Sra. Laura is 52 years old. She has been a widow for 21 years. Her husband died of cancer. She has 6 children. Four of them are married and live independently. One daughter emigrated to another country, but she does not receive any help from her. Her last son works, and everything he earns goes to pay his own expenses. This bank member has her own house thanks to her sacrifice and work. Her loan will be invested in the construction of a cage so that she can raise more guinea pigs. Her goal is to continue working to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, construction materials

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna P. is a married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: rice retailing and pig fattening. She lives in Hacienda Baksay, La Castellana, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their five children who are 24, 25, 26, 28 and 31 years old. Edna has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1993 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her rice retailing and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,500. Edna is now borrowing PHP 25,000 which she will use as additional capital. This will be her thirteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Edna aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additonal working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth E., 49 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by running a butcher shop and by delivering meat to her customers. She lives in Barangay Miranda, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Rodrigo, 52 years old, and their five children who are between 12 and 31 years old. Ruth has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her butcher shop business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000. Ruth is now borrowing Php 15,000 so that she will use as additional working capital for her butcher shop. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ruth aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. Ruth is shown in the accompanying picture posing by the mini-truck that she and her husband use in their meat deliveries. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn D. A. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Kabungahan, Fabrica, Sagay City. She earns her living by selling flip-flops (an open type of outdoor footwear) and other footwear. Jenelyn’s husband, Renato, is a laborer and they have three children who are between 9 and 18 years old. The three children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Jenelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1997 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in selling flip-flops. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 20,000 from her business activities. Jenelyn is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 29,500 was used to fund operations of her flip-flops business and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 29,500 for her 19th loan which she intends to use in her business operations. Jenelyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to proviD. them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Silvena

texts.en: Silvena L., 24 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by raising livestock and through computer games. She lives in El Pardo, Boljoon, Cebu City, with her husband, Firdie, who is 29 years old and a construction worker, and their 6-year-old child. Silvena has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her livestock-raising and computer-games businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 5,000. Silvena is now borrowing Php 14,000 which she will use as additional working capital for her livestock-raising business. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Silvena aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her livestock-raising business

loans.name: Davickson

texts.en:
Davickson M. is 56 years old and married with 3 children, ages 15 to 25 years old. Two of the children are attending school.

He is a farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 41 years and his main product is tea, coffee, milk, beans and maize which he sells to the local market. His major challenges in farming is the unstable market for his products and lack of farming eguipment like spraying pumps.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 70,000 KES to purchase and feed a dairy cow. This loan will help him acquire a dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale and improve the family's living standards. In future, he would like to expand his farming activities and supply more products to the market.

He hopes to get more and better breeds of cows to enhance his milk supply and sales.

loans.use: To purchase and feed a dairy cow

loans.name: Ericah

texts.en:
Ericah is 52 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 10-34 years old. Four of the children are currently attending school.

She is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya. She has been farming for 30 years and has employed 2 people from the community. Her main product is milk which she sells to businessmen. Before venturing into farming, Ericah was operating a retail shop in Litein town.

Her biggest challenge in farming has been lack of enough water for her dairy cows.

She recently completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.45,000 and has requested this new loan for Kes.80,000 to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable her purchase a quality dairy cow and improve her dairy business. In future, she would like to improve her dairy farm and venture into the poultry business. She is requesting this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old. She is a married mother of 4 children ages, 7, 9, 12 and 18 years old. All the children are attending school.

She is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. She has been farming for 10 years and has employed 2 people on a temporary basis. Her products are beans, potatoes, maize and milk which she sells to the local market. Elizabeth is also employed and owns some rental houses in Nkubu town.

Her major challenges in farming are diseases, lack of enough feed for her cows during dry seasons and labor shortages.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 47,700 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will assist her to pay school fees for her children and improve their health and standard of living. In 5 years time she plans to expand her dairy farming by adding 2 more dairy cows.

She is grateful to Juhudi for their efficient services which are helpful to the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 56 years old. He is married with 4 children ages 17, 20, 27, and 29 years old. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. He has been farming for 26 years and has, over time, employed people on a temporary basis. His main product is milk, coffee and fish which he sells to the local market. He also sells tree seedlings to the local market and operates a taxi business in the same area.

His biggest challenges in farming are low milk prices, high cost of feed and unpredictable weather conditions.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 47,700 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help him acquire a dairy cow that will increase his income through the sale of milk and help him educate his children. He hopes to expand his dairy farming in future and start growing beans and maize on his farm in Ruiru-Central Kenya.

He is requesting Juhudi to assist in sourcing a good high-quality dairy cow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 56 years old. He is married with 7 children aged between 15 and 40 years old. All the children except one have completed school.

He is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town where he has been farming for 30 years. His main products are bananas, coffee, beans and maize which he sells to the local market. He depends on farming to cater to the family's needs. His main challenges in farming are diseases and transportation problems.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 47,250 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help the family expand their farming activities thereby improving their livelihood and allowing him to educate his youngest daughter. He plans to expand his dairy farming by buying 2 more dairy cows.

He says that Juhudi Kilimo loans are paid monthly so this will give him ample time to look for money to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Phinneas

texts.en:
60-year-old Phinneas is married with five children aged between 23 and 38 years. All the children except one have completed school.

Phinneas is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. He has been practicing mixed farming for eighteen years and employs two people from the community. His products are: tea, which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority; milk, which he sells to Githongo Dairy Farmers; and cabbages and potatoes, which he sells to the middlemen.

Phinneas’ major challenges in farming are the high cost of animal feeds, pests and diseases, and untrustworthy employees who ask for high wages.

Phinneas has requested this Kes 50,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. Through this loan he will be able to purchase a good dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to buy more good-quality cows with high productivity and extend the land he has under tea plantation.

Phinneas says that Juhudi Kilimo's services have greatly improved and he urges them to keep up the good work.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: M'ringera

texts.en:
M'ringera is 74 years old and is married with five children who are all adults.

M'ringera is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. He has been practicing mixed farming for forty years and employs one permanent employee and one casual laborer. His products are potatoes, cabbages and milk which he sells to the local market. His main challenges in farming are the high cost of inputs and delayed payments during the glut seasons when milk supply is high and the prices are low.

M'ringera successfully completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes 45,000. He has requested this new loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The income from this loan will improve his family's living standards.

M'ringera hopes to expand his dairy farming by acquiring two more dairy cows. He also plans to grow horticultural products. He is happy with the project because it has helped him buy dairy cows and will even help him to expand further.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Isaih

texts.en:
Isaih is 30 years old and married with two children aged 1 and 3 years. His eldest child is currently attending school.

Isaih is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practicing dairy farming for three years and has two employees. He sells his milk to the local market and to the tea estate. He also earns income from the sale of tea, maize and potatoes to the local market. Before venturing into farming he was managing his parents' tea farm.

Isaih’s biggest challenge in farming is a lack of qualified veterinarians and poor road infrastructure.

Isaih has requested this Kes 50,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him pay school fees for his children. In future, he intends to buy high-yielding dairy cows and start a breeding farm so as to sell the heifers.

Isaih is grateful to Juhudi and it's partners for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 32 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 5 years. His eldest child is attending school.

Joel is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for five years with only one employee. His products are tea and milk which he sells locally. His biggest challenges have been lack of a market for his milk and lack of enough feeds for his dairy cows.

Joel has requested this Kes 50,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will assist him in educating and providing food for his children. In future, he would like to acquire a dairy cow that produces at least fifteen liters of milk daily.

Joel is requesting Juhudi to assist him in acquiring quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 37 years old and is married with two children, 5 and 8 years old. Both children are attending school.

Ben is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for six years and has one employee. His products are milk, which he sells to the local market, and tea, which he sells to the local tea factory. Before he ventured into farming, Ben was running a timber business.

Ben’s biggest challenges in farming are animal diseases, lack of enough animal feeds, and poor marketing.

Ben has requested this Kes 35,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him provide for his family.

In future, Ben would like to acquire high-yielding dairy cows and increase his land to plant grass and build a good, modern dairy unit

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 5 years old. His eldest child is currently attending school.

John is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for ten years. His products are milk, which he sells to the tea estate, and tea, which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority. Before venturing into farming, he was operating a retail shop in the same area.

John’s major challenges in farming are a water problem, lack of enough dairy feeds, and lack of enough knowledge in regards to animal diseases.

John has requested this Kes 40,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help his family acquire an additional asset and increase their sources of income. The extra income will enable him to meet his family’s needs.

In future, John would like to acquire five high-yielding dairy cows and increase his production of milk from the current twelve liters to fifty liters daily.

John is grateful to Juhudi for the assistance and plans to request more loans in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 28 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 3½ years old. His eldest child is currently attending school.

Reuben is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for four years and has one employee. His product is milk which he sells to the tea estate. He also earns income from the sale of tea to the local market.

Reuben’s biggest challenges in farming are the constant fluctuation in milk prices and inadequate artificial insemination services.

Reuben has requested this Kes 45,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will assist him in meeting the basic needs of his family and in paying school fees for his children.

In five years time, Reuben hopes to acquire more quality dairy cows and build a dairy unit.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
45-year-old Samwel is the married father of eight children aged between 2 and 21 years. Four of the children are currently attending school.

Samwel is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for twelve years and employs three people from his community. His products are milk, which he sells to the tea estate, and tea, which he sells locally. He depends on the income from farming to cater for his family's needs.

Samwel’s biggest challenges have been diseases and inadequate artificial insemination services.

Samwel has requested this Kes 50,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him in paying school fees for his children. In future, he would like to have a pure-bred cow which produces more than thirty liters of milk daily.

Samwel would like to clear this loan without default so that he can obtain more loans in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pott

texts.fr: Pott G. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THIENABA KHABANE depuis le jour de création le 23 novembre 2006. Elle fait du petit commerce, elle est détentrice d'une boutique à domicile où elle vend divers produits tels du riz, de l'huile végétale, du sucre, du lait, du thé etc. L'objet de son crédit est de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices qui lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Pott G. is 58 years old, married and the mother of four children under her care. She has been a member of the THIENABA KHABANE «Banc Villageois» loan group since its creation 23 November 2006. She runs a small retail business, operating a store in her home where she sells various products such as rice, vegetable oil, sugar, milk, tea, etc. The purpose of her loan is to bolster her stock level so she can generate more income and help her husband take care of family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is divorced and is raising her 10-year-old son by herself. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells men’s clothing at one of the local markets. Svetlana has been in this business for five years. With the financial assistance of Nadiya Ukraine, she has been able to add variety to her assorted merchandise and to expand considerably. Svetlana’s current income is about 4,000 UAH a month.

Svetlana has a reasonable pricing policy, which attracts customers to her vending facility. This summer season, she is planning to increase her seasonal inventory and is requesting a loan of 7,000 UAH. As a single mother, Svetlana works hard to sustain her family. She is hoping to generate additional income and invest part of the profit into much-needed repairs to the old house in which she lives.

loans.use: To increase seasonal inventory

loans.name: 02.11.1.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Nguyet V. T. (7) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.11.1.2 Nam Ngan.

Nguyet is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2009, Nguyet joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Nguyet is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 2nd from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. V. T. Hien (8) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her food stall.

2. D. T. Huong (9) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her general store.

3. P. T. Lan (10) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her clothing business.



About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


*****************************************************
Nguyet V. T. (7) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Nguyet là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.11.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.11.1.2 Nam Ngan).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nguyet thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyet kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND. Vào 2009, Nguyet đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nguyet đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,626,900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. V. T. Hien (8) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

2. D. T. Huong (9) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

3. P. T. Lan (10) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta S. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15ANS1 depuis le 24 février 2002 et a 15 fois de suite reçu du crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux mener son activité. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Binta is a 43 year old woman. She is married and a mother caring for two children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of SAMBA 15ANS1 since February 24, 2002 and has since received 15 loans which she has never had a problem repaying. She fattens sheep and a new loan will allow her to better carry out her work. Her goal is to participate in the improvement of her family's living conditions, all the while strengthening her savings levels.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep for fattening

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La Señora Ana A. es docente jubilada  actualmente; cuenta con un negocio que se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general y otros productos de almacén y viendo la demanda de clientes también posee maxicarga y minicarga para teléfonos celulares. Cuenta con un negocio bien surtido y con una antigüedad de 5 años.

Actualmente estudia y está por terminar su tesis para ser Licenciada en Ciencias de la Educación. 
  

Con el crèdito  obtenido comprarà gaseosas  y cerveza  para  su almacèn
texts.en:
Sra. Ana A. is currently a retired school teacher. She has a business where she sells beverages and other grocery products. Seeing that there is demand among her customers, she also sells electronic loads for mobile phones in various denominations. Ana keeps her business well-stocked and has been in operation for five years.

She is currently studying and finishing her thesis so that she can earn a degree in Education.

This loan will be used to buy sodas and beer for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & beer

loans.name: Aureliano

texts.es:
Don Aureliano  tiene 55 años de edad está casado hace mas de 29 años con la Sra. Lucila Matto  de 47 años de edad, tienen juntos 4 hijos todo mayores  de edad.  

	El señor Aureliano es hijo de un agricultor creció en una de la compañía de Carapeguá (Espartillar) trabajó en el campo con su padre, a los 26 años de edad se casó con Sra. Lucila quien es hija de una tejedora y  empezaron a trabajar juntos, hoy en día   hace mas 20  años que se dedica a  la venta de la tradicional sobrecamas y hamacas que lo lleva a vender por la zona de Itapúa y ciudad del Este con una  clientela bien  formada, incluso su señora quién es artesana le teje las frazadas y así le sale más económico. Gracias a este trabajo y al esfuerzo de los ambos  pudieron contar con casa propia  y también comprarse una  camioneta la que utiliza para repartir sus mercaderías  y a la vez  brindar a su familia una mejor nivel de  vida . 

	Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos de varios tipos  y colorantes, y telas que son materiales que utilizan para la fabricación de sabrecamas.
texts.en:
Aureliano is 55 years old and has been married for over 29 years to Lucila Matto who is 47 years old. Between them, they have four adult children. Aureliano is the son of farmer, raised in the countryside where his father worked for a company in Espartillar de Carapeguá in Paraguay. At the age of 26, he married Lucila, daughter of a weaver and they began to work together. For over 20 years, he has been selling traditional bedspreads and hammocks in the Itapúa area and the eastern part of the city establishing clientele. His wife’s craft in knitting blankets works out more economically. Thanks to this work and both of their efforts they were able to have their own home and also purchase a truck which they use to distribute their goods and offer their family a better life. He is requesting this loan in order to buy various types of thread in many colors and fabrics which are the materials they use to make bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials like various types and colors of thread, fabrics and more.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita C.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting banana for sale. She is 56 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Juanita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine B.'s main source of income comes from operating a trisikad transport service. She is 27 years old, married and has two small children. They are from Prenza, Tangub City. Geraldine has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 9,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Geraldine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Geraldine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita D. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 30 years old. Perlita is married and has 2 school-aged children. Perlita owns & operates a motor transportation business. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle to improve her service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Perlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle to improve customer service

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 33 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 adult children. Virginia owns & operates a a service-based business, providing machete making services to local community members. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Virginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana S. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Taciana is married and has 3 adult children. Taciana owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products such as noodles, eggs, milo, juice pack, shampoo, soap and salt. Taciana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Taciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Taciana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Taciana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ing

texts.en:
Mrs. Ing C., shown in the photo, is 29 years old. Her husband, Mr. Kimsan Yi, is 29 and they have been married since 2000. They have a young son who attends school. They live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ing and her husband have been farming for ten years. The couple also hope to create a new business raising ducks. Therefore, Ing is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase ducks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise.

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Mr. Roth M., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sreymouch Chorn, 30, live in a small village outside Phnom Penh. Mr Roth M. is shown in the photo. They have been married for ten years and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school.       

Roth was hired by a relative to sell groceries. His wife has been a garment factory worker for five years. He is asking for his first loan of $200 to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house.

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoeun P. and her husband, Mr. Phally Sok (pictured together), live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh They were married in 1999 and have three children; one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school and another is pre-school age.

Sophoeun has been a silk weaver since she was twelve years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takesthem to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a farmer and has raised cows since 2000. 

She is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran lives in a small city of Vehari Pakistan.  She has three children who couldn’t complete their education due to a lack of financial resources. Her husband is a painter. To help support the family financially, Manzooran does domestic sewing by receiving orders from her neighbors. She earns a reasonable income from them and uses this to pay for the utilities.  

She is applying for a loan for her son, who sells cosmetics products. He wants to increase the variety of products that he sells by adding more creams, lotions and other cosmetics products to sell from his cart. It will help him increase sales and hence his income will be improved which will help his family to better their living standard.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Hoeun L., age 59, is a widower with two sons and four daughters. He is a construction worker. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Hoeun was not in the photo, but his son is presented. 

His family does not have a proper restroom to use and they must often ask for their relatives for the use of their facilities. It is difficult for them, so Hoeun decided to request a loan in the amount of $600 to build his own restroom.

loans.use: To build a restroom for the family's use.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em A. (presented in the photo), age 42 and her husband, Mr. Kimleang Toem, age 44, have been married 1991. They have six sons. Two are construction workers, one assists his parents in the business, two attend school, and another one is still young for school and stays at home. 

Em and her husband have been selling firewood for ten years. They cut the wood and also buy firewood from other villages. They sell their firewood in a nearby province. She hopes to continue expanding her business and is asking for another loan in the amount of $700 to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Azra Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Azra parveen is living in the city of Vehari, Pakistan with her husband & two children.


Her husband is a rickshaw driver who drives someone else's rickshaw.  Her husband wants to buy his own rickshaw because 30 percent of his income goes in paying rent for the rickshaw. Azra perveen wants to help her husband to buy a new rickshaw so she has applied for a loan. A new auto rickshaw will help her husband minimize costs and, also, he will be able to work full-time without any worries. 


Azra’s daughter is eighteen years old and is nearly of marriage age. Azra is hopeful that she will be able to collect a dowry for her daughter’s marriage with the help of increased profits.

loans.use: to purchase an auto rickshaw

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun L. (pictured above), aged 55, is a widow with four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, one is a driver and the other one stays at home. The family lives aL. National Road Number six, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Lun has been selling chickens and ducks for 15 years. She hopes to expand her business to be able to get extra income to support her family. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $250 to purchase chickens and ducks for resale.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and ducks for resale.

loans.name: Nasreen Mai's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen mai is applying for a loan to support her husband who makes a living by selling bangles. She herself grows young animals and sells them in the animal market for a good profit. She has three children, two of them are studying while her older son helps his father in his business.  



With the help of a loan, her husband will buy a greater variety of bangles which will help him to increase his product range and income. As wedding season is near, a greater variety will help them to improve sales and to increase their customer numbers.

loans.use: to purchase bangles for reselling

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a very supportive and caring lady. She not only takes care of her own family, but also of her relatives as well.  She sells clothes. She takes orders from her neighborhood and fills them by buying fabric from the big cities like Faisalabad and Lahore. She is also a very good mother, taking care of her children and carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife.   



She is applying for a loan for her cousin who will use it to buy an auto rickshaw. Naseem’s cousin is jobless but he needs regular income to support his family.  With the help of a rickshaw, he will start his own transport business which will enable his family to live in a better financial environment.

loans.use: to purchase an auto rickshaw

loans.name: Nasren Mai's Group

texts.en:
Nasren mai lives in a small city of Vehari, Pakistan, with her husband and four children. She is uneducated but is a very clever and business-minded woman. A few years ago, she started her cloth selling business to financially support her husband whose income was not enough for the whole family. She also offers sewing services to her customers. 



Her business did well from the beginning but she knew that money makes money. That is why she needs investment for her business to improve. For that reason she is applying for a loan.  She is hopeful that, from the increased earnings, she will be able to send her remaining two daughters (out of four children) to school. She hasn't been able to start their education yet due to lack of income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Noor Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Noor Suraiya is very supportive to her family; she is always ready to help her family in every possible way so that she can make their life easier. She is applying for a loan to support her son who wants to increase his income by buying more seasonal fruits for his fruit-selling business.

Noor Suraiya has three sons and all of them work. Her son’s increased income will enable her to save money for her elder son’s marriage.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal fruits for her son's business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children and both of them are in school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Veronica has been in her used-clothing business for two years. She wants to use this loan of 200,000/= to buy more secondhand clothes, which she buys from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells her clothes at the market and her customers are local people. She works six days a week.

Veronica depends on her job to make a living. Her main challenge is seasonality and her greatest monthly expenses are medication, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell
